Review: warning spoilers are included in this review but it does not really make much of difference deep impact begins the official summer movie season and it also brings back memories of remember when dantes peak came out in february few months later volcano was released the first was smart exhilirating and one of the best disaster films had ever seen the latter was an incohesive mess that defied logic and wasted talent well it is deja vu all over again as two disaster films go head head in competition this time unfortunately the first comet flick is so bad that people may shy away from armageddon the upcoming cometdisaster be released the beginning of july of course the general reaction of the audience was oppposed mine and so am in the minority as was when stood on the side of dantes peak but while watching deep impact began wonder how anyone in their right mind could actually like this apparently many did and it utterly baffles me be completely honest have not had this little fun watching disaster in my entire life volcano had implausibilities up the wazoo but it was still rather fun watch deep impact does not just have implausibilities it also contains cheap human drama incredibly horrible special effects and poorly constructed plot the only thing that gives it half star above my bottom ranking is slightly entertaining final fifteen minutes and some good actors making the most of their characters deep impact begins in an unnamed year the year varies advanced technology sets it in the future but fire in the sky is showing on local movie theater pushing it back line of students is outside at night peering through telescopes at the dark sky above among these are leo biederman elijah wood and sarah hotchner leelee sobieski leo unknowingly discovers comet and his teacher sends photo of the unknown object an astronomer who then is able determine the correct path of this distant comet in about few seconds he races off mail the information but is killed in reckless car accident year passes and nothing is heard about it again we are then introduced jenny lerner a leoni reporter for msnbc she gets handed job investigate possible coverup in the government involving senator alan rittenhouse james cromwell she talks woman who mentions that rittenhouse was having an affair girl named ellie after talking rittenhouse and unsatisfied the information she gets she decides use the internet for help luckily she knows exactly how spell the certain ellie that she is looking for they spell it ele in the that girl is pretty darn smart for guessing how it was spelled before she can use the information the government decides push her car off the road they take her in meet the president of the united states president beck morgan freeman beck recommends that jenny keep the information secret for hours so they can confirm it and then hold press conference naturally she wants be compensated and they offer her front row seat and the chance for the first question and so yada yada yada they reveal the comet the public and their plans send massive spacecraft out destroy it before it can arrive they announce plan called ark is their only hope for survival computer will select people at random these people are the ones who will go into large cave underground so that the impact of the comet will not kill off the entire human race after two years the dust will settle actually it would take much much longerapproximately ninety years from what understand and the humans could come back the surface and start over the rest of the plot is your standard disaster procedures but there is one subplot worth mentioning jenny and her father jason maximilian schell have very touching relationship that forms out of the impending doom the final moment involving the two characters is heartfelt and emotional it is shame that nothing else is heartfelt now of course we all know that the comet does impact the surface the title alone suggests it and the previews actually show it doing this absoltuely no tension can be drawn from any attempt stop the comet because we all know that it will not work director mimi leder came from her successful tries at direction episodes of the hit television show er her major debut was the peacemaker pathetic and heartless action well this time leder outdid herself creating worse than that one suggestion ms leder please stay away from the big screen or at least the action genre much of the blame can be placed on leder directly because the pace is disastrously off throughout the we are given subtitles that tell us how much time has passed it goes from months weeks hours it literally feels like this lapsed time is taking place in realtimeit is that boring of course leder is not all blame for it screenwriters michael tolkin and bruce joel rubin have crafted simplistic story that only gets worse time what starts out promising soon turns deadly for the audience anyway chock full of cheesy one liners you know you are going have more sex than anyone else in school and stupid characters you might think we were back in the again only one of the subplots is remotely interesting while the rest are forgettable and boring and the main plot is so outrageous that you cannot figure out if this is supposed be an action drama or scifi put it simply the special effects of this are hit and miss situation that is right miss and hit scenes above the earth are well done and the orbiting ship is majestic but the comet is huge mistake making it more laughable than frightening the concept of even trying land on comet is preposterous enough but that is forgiveable what is not forgiveable is actually having humans walk on the surface give me break will ya and of course the much hyped collision of comet and earth well it is far from spectacular and it makes independence day look brilliant the water rushing towards the land is effective but once it hits the continent the effects turn ridiculous cgi water is used and it looks so bad that heard more laughs from the audience than shrieks in fact may even recommend the for those who want see how bad effects can actually get these days just when we think visual effects cannot be improved along comes show that they really can and should be one thing has struck wrong note me concerning mimi leders direction also influences the actors leder loves show the actors faces before and during moments of terror this reminded me of another action director renny harlin die hard cliffhanger but harlin succeeds because he shows the faces of the victims in realistic situations leder likes flaunt peoples fears via their faces but instead of coming off as sympathetic leder seems more of sadist one moment has an astronaut flying off into space this should be enough warrant response from the audience but leder wants go farther and shows us the persons face while drifting into space this is one of the cheapest ways ellicit an emotional response from an audience and for one am not going be fooled on another note leders only picks up its pace during the last fifteen minutes when the comet actually impacts the pace does pick up and some very emotional moments are shown then again when you watch people cry for their loved ones it is obvious it will be emotional it is mostly just big trick rope viewers into feeling for the characters but it did not work for me but anyway the actors do as much as they can what they are given a leoni bad boys tvs the naked truth is the best of the and she is given the meatiest role her character is made stronger leonis presence and we grow care for her robert duvall is energetic and fun watch but his character is turned into shreds the plot elijah wood also comes off rather successfully but he still has not had many good roles wood stick drama you are too talented for this stuff vanessa redgrave is barely acknowledgeable and her performance is only enhanced her strong presence on screen maximilian schell is distracting but he does provide some nice humor morgan freeman has been infinitely better than this and gives one of his most shallow performances date is quite remarkable for him leelee sobieski could have been better but think she just suffered from poorly written character special note should go ron eldard and denise crosby eldard is good in his role but is limited the plot crosby is special me personally because she was tasha yar from tvs star trek the next generation seeing her was one of the highlights of the overall very talented cast virtually wasted deep impact is rated pg for disaster related elements and brief language this is one of the worst films of the year and if it is any omen of things come this summer could be one of the worst ever luckily the xfiles movie is coming up and hopefully armageddon will be more successful it is shame that this will do so successfully because it just is not worth much costing nearly million special effects done the illustrious ilm is huge shocker and score composed oscarwinner james horner titanic one might have expected this be more fun witness and experience well it is not when the comet does hit the earth you almost wish it could just take this along it

my first press screening of and already have gotten prime candidate for my worst ten of the year list what an auspicious beginning welcome the dog days of winter when the only openings of merit are those oscar contenders that the studios opened in late december in new york and a and are just now beginning appear elsewhere firestorm the directorial debut of dances wolvess academy award winning cinematographer dean semler is the first of the new years crop of movies as our story opens the movie pretentiously informs us that of the tens of thousands of firefighters only are smokejumpers we then cut plane load of smoke jumping cowboys and one cowgirl where one of the gungho guys is taking romance quiz from cosmopolitan having the time of their lives they then jump into the middle of burning forest when even in the beginning the director cannot get the small parts right you can sense the movie is in trouble the noisy fire roaring all about them and the trapped people huddled near their gasolinefilled cars smokejumper monica christianne hirt tells them get away from their soontoexplode vehicles not bothering shout nor even get close them she announces her warning without raising her voice much or approaching the people miraculously they manage hear her and move away in movie that specializes in cheap shots the camera locates the proverbial young girl trapped in nearby burning building as it does throughout overly dramatic cinematographer stephen windon from the postman uses extremely fast zooms right down the endangered girls face our show is two heroes the crews chief wynt perkins played laconically scott glenn and his secondincommand jesse graves played howie long in weak attempt be the next steven seagal enter the burning house looking for the little girl in panic they have difficulty in locating her before they are engulfed in flames the manipulative script has her hidden in her own dollhouse this mawkish show cuts back monica who has lifeordeath decision make the chopper the fireretardant chemicals has only enough save one group will it be the large group near the cars or the helpless little girl and monicas two firefighting buddies she has only seconds decide who will be saved yes she goes for the majority but miracle of miracles the other three come out alive anyway not content traditional firefighting story chris soths screenplay attempts jazz it up having william forsythe from palookaville play vicious killer named randy earl shaye who sets forest fire so that he can join the crew put it out and then escape hoods in the woods is what the groundpounders yell out when the convicts are bused in help them fight the fire along the way shaye picks up an ornithologist hostage played suzy amis who turns out have been trained in warrior ways her father who was marine drill instructor most of the highly predictable movie is long chase in poor howie long is given one ridiculous stunt after another look silly performing he flings chain saw backwards over his head while riding speeding motorcycle so that the saw can hit the windshield of the pursuing truck arguably the low point is when he escapes from locked burning building riding motorcycle conveniently parked inside using ramp he shoots straight out of the top of the buildings attic and when he hits the ground he just rides off in cloud of dust when the is not using some stock footage of actual forest fires the simulated ones look hokey editor jack hofstra cheapens the action even more his use of burning flames in scene transitions the ending its sick twists manages be even worse than the rest of the movie perhaps the best that can be said for the picture is the faint praise heard afterwards in the lobby it is not as bad as some of the television sitcoms firestorm runs mercifully just it is rated for violence and language and would be acceptable for teenagers

ever since wargames the first real computer hacking movie has attempted produce more and more films about hacking these films usually show the audience look into computers that really is not impossible and is usually ridiculous if it is not this the exaggeration about what is real is usually greater than you would expect hackers is guilty of all of these crimes anyone familiar computers andor the internet most of the movie is so incredibly stupid that you cannot take it anymore those of you who frequent one of the greatest sites on the world wide web the internet movie database are probably aware of the section for movies entitled goofs this is the section for mistakes in the movies well imdb sums up hackers extremely well the first goof listed generally illinformed and ridiculous the extreme regarding the capabilities of computers and technology and truthfully this is onehundred percent correct the plot obviously centers around computer hacking more specifically it follows the exploits of dade murphy young computer hacker played jonny lee miller miller should be extremely thankful for the trainspotting because if it were not for that who knows where his career would be now after hackers the opens young dade murphy being arrested for hacking computer systems he was forbidden use computer until he turned eighteen years old the then picks up at that point an eighteen year old dade murphy hacking away at the computer dade later meets up fellow hackers acid burn angelina jolie cereal killer matthew lillard lord nikon laurence mason and the phantom phreak renoly santiago who are basically trying do what is next impossible hack the gibson computer and not get caught the fbi oh and as little subplot dade also tries woo acid burn the only female hacker in the really cannot think of much more say about the films plot aside from what have said it is just bunch of computer geeks no obsessive compulsive computer geeks little too advanced for reality running around hacking computers and staying away from the fbi thanks this movie the public unfamiliar computers now has distorted viewpoint of computers and what they can do this movie makes computers look little bit too advanced for their time and the frivolous suggestions it makes are too many list sum it up hackers is terrible computer if you are looking for about computers closer what goes on in the real world suggest sneakers although at times it too may seem little far fetched it should be much more believable than hackers regular computer users hopefully this did not influence too many young computer users out think they can do what is portrayed in this minute waste of time

if there is one thing just cannot stand it is that oozes sentimentality heres note all makers films are more effective when the emotions of the characters speak for themselves swelling saddening music is not good way tell us that the people in the are unhappy and that the situation is hopeless alas my giant is that uses manipulative sentimentality so frequently and such high intensity that forgot as watched it that there are other ways of getting audience members choked up what reminded me was that was not choked up or even the slightest bit moved for that matter my giant is forced contrived and conspicuously uncute detest the word cute but have chosen use it because the makers clearly wanted create cute here it takes premise that might have been interesting liked the preview and bogs it down endless plot turns and cliches all of are intended get some kind of easy emotional rise from the audience maybe it will work for some people it did not work for me billy crystal plays sam cayman an agent who at the beginning of the is in romania he is in romania because the kid actor he made famous is doing the screenplay has him in romania so he can get fired get in car accident and get saved an enormous individual who stands almost eight feet tall his name is max gheorghe muresan and sam thinks he would be great movie star because of his size subplots are as follows sam has son and wife kathleen quinlan and he is never around for them so they move chicago max is in love woman named lilianna who moved away from romania twenty years before the begins sam convinces max go back america him so they can make lots of money and so their various subplots can all be resolved sam is broke max is dying pass the kleenex my giant as comedy is only moderately funny it has its moments the best of features steven seagal making fun of himself in one great scene sam gets his son on the phone talk seagal of course his son does not believe that he is actually speaking seagal and he goes off about how bad of an actor he is would quote the line like but it would probably lose its effect crystal is always entertaining and he has few good lines here some of are subtle throwaways that many will miss entirely often however he is countered slew of jokes that are not funny and cause an involuntary rolling of the eyes muresan is kind of fun watch but he just cannot act very well quinlan on the other hand is great actress who needs get role that shows off her talents she was underused last year in both event horizon and breakdown but at least in those films she had moments in she could show us her stuff here the best thing she gets do is fake romanian accent all of these disappointing ingredients create that for much of its running time is simply mediocre as my giant lumbers its inevitable conclusion however director michael lehmann who did great job directing the underrated hudson hawk and scriptwriter david seltzer pile on every cliche imaginable each one intended specifically pull at our heartstrings sams multiple engagements his family are all completely hackneyed how about main character who has healthy relationship his family later it turns out the entire story is supposed be great big metaphor signifying sams reunion his family and some people might think that what sam does for max towards the end is valiant thing but had few morality problems it and apologize for being vague it is icky it drips gooey wannabe human emotions my giant could have been straightforward and funny family more importantly it could have been moving on level far deeper than it is instead it is complicated overlong and underengaging that elicits too few laughs and strives for superficial tears and since it left me feeling completely unmoved stand my position that sentimentality is evil and will ultimately destroy the world

this is not simple plan about finding plane load of money and getting away the cash this is more about parable of greed and how money can become the bane of your life yes there are elements of fargo here the snow and cold although not as vivid in the blood and gore department it shows how greed can set of chain of events leading death and the destruction of lives and how at the end of the day the things that matter most are love truth and honesty although in one sense it may seem tedious making movie about the ugliness of greed not box office material it does become tedious not because of the morale ending but because one expects the movie end that way this becomes apparent after the first murder cover up the crime the rest of the movie just spirals downward from there the characters in this drama are mixture of simple and intellectual folk brothers and friends who all fall prey the avarice of money they should have perhaps thrown in someone sensible level headed and not affected greed give the party more balance commendable is the exceptional performance of billy bob thornton whose portrayal of the simpleton brother was masterful bill paxton also gives powerful performance as the greedier younger brother whilst bridget fonda is convincing as the greediest wife who indirectly causes the most problems fill room full of greedy people and several million dollars and you will end up simple recipe for blood bath it is not simple plan when you shoot everyone you love for money unless you are the menendez brothers

based on the tv series that had never seen or heard of before this movie be happy will not bore you any lame and unnecessary comparisons this allows will smith take third stab at the independence day weekend boxoffice after scoring huge successes men in black directed the same man who controlled this one and independence day can you say the third times not charm plot james west and artemus gordon are chosen the president find the man responsible for the kidnapping of the nations top scientists and threatening take over the united states within week critique did not laugh once during this entire picture when you consider that this is partcomedy that is not very good sign also did not tense up or particularly enjoy any of its unenergetic action sequences provided me little more than few minutes time think back the lovely salma hayek scenes when you consider that the other part of this is geared as an actionadventure would say that this another negative sign and when you consider that the first hour of the was boring and little slow the storyline tired reminiscent of swiss cheese and uninvolving and the special effects interesting but worth very little inside plot filled lame oneliners weak characterizations and an anticlimactic end you pretty much have the gist of my impression of this big summer blockbuster it blows or as they say in french eet blows could it be that the script was crappy because it took four people write it maybe could it be that most of the special effects do not show up until the last half hour and even then we do not see anything that its trailers had not already given away perhaps or could it be that we have come expect so much more from will smith and bigbudget movies that we cannot help but evaluate them on scale onto their own naaaaaaah bad movie is bad movie on positive note could honestly say that did very much enjoy the lovely performance the adorable salma hayek who seemed underused in my humble opinion and lit up every bubbly scene that she was hardly in branagh was also fun as the scenerymunching overthetop bad guy but that is pretty much where the entertainmentbuck stopped smith and kline were static at best the plot full of holes and the score insignificant and derivative of dozen others would strongly advise anyone not see this movie then again there is that one scene the lovely salma hayek tied up in cage huh oh yeah but the rest of the movie sucked little known facts about this and its stars will smith has starred in two of the ten alltime top grossing films worldwide summer blockbuster men in black for he also recorded the grammywinning title song and independence day he once turned down scholarship mit pursue his singing career kevin kline is graduate of the juilliard school of drama and has been married the cuteasabutton actress phoebe cates since they have two kids together greta simone and owen one of the buildings that gets blown up in this has kasdan written on it lawrence kasdan is director known have worked kevin on five of his movies including the big chill silverado love you death grand canyon and french kiss salma hayek gave up successful career as major television star in latin america and moved the united states start over even though she spoke no english she made her feature debut as an actress small role in allison anders mi vida loca no not the rickie martin video and played her first starring role in robert rodriguezs desperado opposite antonio banderas since then she has made an appearance in each one of rodriguezs films she stands was born in southeast mexico and the daughter of lebanese father and mexican mother one of the actresses cast as branaghs lovely but lethal beauties includes bail ling stage and screen star in her native china who was last seen starring opposite dick gere in red corner another is dutchborn frederique van der wal who is one of the worlds most recognized supermodels having graced the cover of cosmopolitan numerous times as well as harpers bazaar vogue and mademoiselle

in the line of duty is the critically praised series of television movies dealing the reallife incidents that claimed lives of law enforcement officers in usa the twilight murders another one from the series is dealing the case of gordon kahl played rod steiger old farmer from north dakota who would rather spend year in prison than pay taxes the despised s government after being released he still refuses pay taxes and the warrant is issued for his arrest when the s marshals come arrest him it turns out that kahl is not alone many poor farmers in rural northwest share his extremist antigovernment beliefs and the routine operation turns into shootout that would leave federal officers that that brings fbi on the scene and agent mayberly michael gross is supervising the manhunt however his efforts seem fruitless since kahl still has many supporters some of them even in the local law enforcement after betrayed thriller costa gavras mostly ignored the disturbing trends of rising rightwing extremism in the american northwest and that remained so until oklahoma city bombing when media hype brought rightwingers back into spotlight until that time only the television movies like this one bothered pay attention that phenomenon unfortunately the twilight murders is still routine and formulaic television that uses sensationalist real life content in order cover lack of originality in the script sometimes like many american tv movies it creates drama where drama should not be on the other hand is steadily directed dick lowry and rod steiger does good job potraying gordon kahl on the other hand michael gross as his pursuer is quite wooden and his interaction some of the actors is terrible however does deal potentially thoughtprovoking social and political issues so hour and half spent in front of the screen should not be the total waste of time

the following review contains spoilers it is just the way we are rapist matt frewer responds supergirls helen slater query as why she is being attacked an example of the mindnumbingly bad dialogue in supergirl will admit it love superman iii know it is hated amongst the superman faithful who dismiss it as nothing more than vehicle for richard pryor but still think it is worthy addition the man of steel franchise supergirl spinoff of sorts from the series same producers alexander and ilya salkind does not even rival superman iii in terms of quality let alone superman or superman ii supergirl lost me from the opening scenes and went steadily downhill for the rest of its two hour plus running time as the begins we see the residents of argo city commune like place consisting of refugees from krypton resides in inner space go about their daily lives ok what so these are exiles from krypton blew up right were they living there before krypton exploded how do you get inner space this whole inner space notion is never explained particularly in terms of how these people get information from the outside world how do they know where superman went how do they know he took the name clark kent and now works at the daily planet these kinds of things frustrate the hell out of me argo city is kept running power source called the omegahedron one day the founder of argo city zaltar peter toole gives the omegahedron supermans cousin kara helen slater for use as inspiration in her art kara uses it create buglike thing immediately crashes through the layer of whatever that protects the city in the chaos the omegahedron sails out through the opening dooming the argonians death in three days time or something kara then climbs into pod zaltar had designed for interdimensional travel and chases after the omegahedron save her world the power source travels directly earth and lands in the bowl of dip belonging minorleague witch named selena faye dunaway who immediately before her dip was ruined announced her desires rule the world her sometimes warlock boyfriend nigel peter cook selena somehow knows that this ball from the sky will help her her evil plans and she sets out achieve world domination selena is unaware of course that kara has also arrived on earth and that she is arrived as supergirl complete appropriate costume supergirl emerges from the bottom of lake when she arrives ok huh why does the omegahedron fall from the sky but supergirl shoots out of the bottom of lake attention movie explain yourself am sorry can only suspend disbelief so much cannot buy into any of this nonsense just because the movie wants me knowing that she needs secret identity supergirl basically wills herself into school girl outfit complete different hairstyle picks the alias linda lee and enrolls into school she is given her dorm assignment and who happens be her roommate lois lanes sister lucy ok coincidence is one thing folks but we are getting really contrived now what follows are some generic allgirls school hijinks complete evil bully girls mean for no reason of course and even shower scene best moment though comes when supergirl decides put bra on over her school uniform and starts stuffing it socks at this point am rapidly wondering why am bothering this nonsense there is some credit give the however one lengthy and elaborate sequence featuring an evil bulldozer destroying small town in search of its prey is very well done also its commendable see genders reversed in the whereas the women have all the power and the men are merely objects and tools hart bochner die hard is particularly fun as karas love interest lovesick landscaper who is under spell cast selena although he is unfortunately part of one of the films more ridiculous moments when he has be rescued from being tapped some menacing bumper cars then there were numerous little things that bothered me the flying effects are never convincing for moment it is all too obvious that helen slater is hooked wires instead of having her look like she is flying the filmmakers wanted her be graceful so she poses lot and does ballettype maneuvers also who are the first two humans meet supergirl when she arrives on earth pair of truck driversrapists who immediately attack her and then meet wacky demise there is also some rampant product placement in the most notably for popeyes tylenol and aw root beer the latter actually putting its logo on the tshirt of one of the rapists finally just one word monsters faye dunaway and peter otoole ham it up unmercifully however when otoole overacts he is entertaining and when dunaway does it she is annoying her character actually says the line seize them at one point dunaways henchmen played peter cook and brenda vaccaro fare much better vaccaro coming off best as the equivalent of ned beattys otis character from the first two superman movies helen slater effectively portrays supergirl as the innocent naive character she is written be as she is able gaze at flowers and bunnies the right amount of genuine wonder make it believable believability aside though it is still annoying now despite all this negativity and am not alone here supergirl is not well liked nor well respected movie in many circles leave it the good people at anchor bay entertainment actually make people not only interested but excited about its release on dvd they have released two separate editions of the on dvd the delight of many people including myself yet am still unclear as why since this movie is so awful the first and most widely available dvd release features the international version of the runs minutes longer than the print ran in s theaters the movie is presented in its original theatrical aspect ratio of is enhanced for televisions and has been remastered in full thx glory extras on the disc include full length audio commentary track director jeannot szwarc and special project consultant scott michael bosco the excellent minute documentary from called supergirlthe making of feature dig that workout montage trailers tv spots talent bios indepth storyboards accompanied score from the movie and assorted still galleries the transfer on this international version is incredible you would think you were watching new release images are sharp colors jump off the screen and the picture is free of scratches or artifacts only some special effects sequences show the wear of time and there just is not much that can be done about that unless you are obsessive like george lucas the new thx approved audio is loud and clear in all the right places however you will be hearing absurd dialogue and mediocre jerry goldsmith score is completely unrelated john williams classic superman theme and sounds better suited for cannon films golanglobus production the commentary track featuring director szwarc and project consultant bosco is step in the right direction in the evolution of audio commentaries bosco seems be an expert in all things supergirl and is there szwarc ensure that there is no dead air on the track bosco probes szwarc for information on virtually everyone and everything that comes onscreen and we learn great deal more about the as result of his participation although at times you can tell that bosco is looking for specific response from szwarc and is surprised when he does not get that response we learn some fascinating tidbits on the track most notably the almost appearance in the christopher reeve great detail is given about supermans proposed role in the original script before reeve wisely dropped out as it stands superman is written off early on in the when we hear radio broadcast mention that he is billions of light years away on some sort of peace mission for the sake of brevity will not even get into that one szwarc also reveals that is was the conscious decision of the salkinds and everyone else agreed that supergirl needed stand on its own replacing the science fiction of the superman films cutsy whimsical fantasy nonsense bosco also points out scenes not in the american release as they come along claiming that had they been in the original release it would have been hit at the box office again for the sake of brevity will not even get into that one anchor bay has also released limited edition only copies pressed twodisc set disc one contains everything mentioned for the regular release disc two features the never before seen directors cut of the runs minutes long the additions mainly consist of scene extensions do not add much of note except for few moments lengthen peter otooles screen time particularly during his latter appearances the print is rough in spots and the sound is only in mono but fans of the will not care one question though should not the directors commentary be on the directors cut of the would never seen supergirl before sat down watch this dvd was nine when it was released theaters and even then was smart enough inform my parents not take me see it so when popped the dvd into my player and sat down in my easy chair had no idea what expect knew the was not beloved and never had any interest in it before but was willing give it shot because of the impressive amount of work put into the disc as the disc began spin was rather impressed the opening sequence made me sit up and wonder if my assumptions all this time could have been wrong come find out however it was just the chase digital stereo logo so slunk back into my seat as the nightmare started at the end of the supergirl flies back into the lake the omegahedron and flies back argo city ugh give up am surprised even made it the end of the not once not twice but three times review these discs supergirl is definitely terrific dvd package but very lousy movie pg

practical magic is that is so misguided in so many ways that it makes you wonder how such talented and highprofile actors would even get involved in an embarrassing claptrap like this one the stars sandra bullock and nicole kidman as sally and gillian owens two sisters whose family comes from long line of witches spanning back years at the start their parents die when they are still children and they go live their two zany aunts stockard channing and dianne wiest switch the present day gillian who is the stronger more rebellious sibling leaves home and meets up dark abusive guy goran visjnic while sally stays in their hometown meets and falls in love sweet caring man has two children and then is devastated when her husband is hit truck and killed come think of it she is not too devastated since she gets over it in about two minutes when gillian calls sally come get her after having another abusive spat visjnic they accidentally murder him and in desperation bury the body in the backyard of their aunts house add this wildly convoluted story subplots involving the dead rising and an exorcism not mention spattering of lighthearted whimsy and you have pretty good idea how messy practical magic is after seeing the reflected that there was not even one scene or element that liked or enjoyed it is comedy be sure but all of the humor falls astoundingly flat and the occasional dramatic moments are the least bit touching it is not charming or entertaining in any way and then top it off we have got this dark but birdbrained story of an evil spirit taking over gillians body whatever the characters are handled terribly and actually most of the actors do not have the fortune of even getting be what you could call character there is no reason why channing and wiest should have decided be in this and in every scene involving them they are always standing sidebyside no attempt is made flesh them out into actual people the same goes for aidan quinn as handsome police investigator who has the misfortune of being the romantic lead opposite bullock even though he comes into it at around the minute mark and once again there is no attempt develop their relationship or his character in any way in fact every line of dialogue in the is in service of moving the plot along rather than getting know the people saying the lines should have know was headed for trouble during the opening credits when found out the screenplay was written the deeply hated akiva goldsman who managed destroy the batman series batman forever and batman and robin practical magic is directed griffin dunne primarily an actor who last year made the contrived clumsy romance addicted love meg ryan and matthew broderick disliked that movie quite bit but since practical magic is even worse that can only give you taste of what talentless filmmaker he is would tell him quit while he is ahead but in these last two years he is ultimately already buried himself

nearly every tim burton has directed has been an homage the horror genre frankenweenie beetlejuice batman edward scissorhands ed wood mars attacks yet none of them have been horror films sleepy hollow is his first attempt actually scare people greeted the prospect high anticipation burtons whole career seemed be leading up this left disappointed andrew kevin walkers screenplay takes only the character names from the classic short story the legend of sleepy hollow in the movie ichabod crane johnny depp is new york city police constable who is trying introduce scientific methods of investigation his superiors ichabod is dispatched the small town of sleepy hollow investigate series of murders several of the towns leading citizens have been decapitated the headless horseman although he rejects the ghost story the town elders tell him ichabod finds that the facts of the case confound his scientific reasoning he also discovers that the killings are not random that the victims are tied together secret along the way ichabod gets help from bewitching literally young woman christina ricci and the son of one of the murder victims marc pickering my reaction hohum the plot is an accumulation of cliches without even the slightest touch of originality make it interesting that in itself is forgivable constantly tries sell us used products in new packages however burtons attempts at inducing fright come off as goofy it might be his background in his previous movies goofy was the goal along the same lines it does not help that creature designer and producer kevin yagher has done his best work for the tongueincheek tales from the crypt tv series witchs eyes and tongue shoot out like roger rabbit is tree spurts blood like it is in monty python sketch and the headless horseman well he is guy without head on horse boo the performances are also awful although he is impressed me his work in other films depp does not seem know what do ichabod and his dialogue is hampered stilted diction that is supposed pass for an th century accent ricci seems put all her effort into seeming enigmatic guarantees that we will not sympathize her character the actor who is revealed at the end be the villain comes off as ridiculously cartoonish the only pleasure generated the cast comes from surprise cameos christopher lee martin landau and christopher walken wonder if this movie was originally conceived as part of francis ford coppolas projected series of gothic adaptations series that produced only bram stokers dracula and mary shelleys frankenstein coppola is an executive producer for sleepy hollow and the script reflects his interest in early forms of moving pictures particularly in toy that ichabod carries blends two pictures create an optical illusion there is bird on one side of the card cage on the other when the card is flipped rapidly the bird appears be caged bottom line the hollow is not the only thing that is sleepy

annie wilson cate blanchett widow who struggles raise her children in small town in georgia is asked for help local authorities in solving the case of missing woman annie is something of psychic she has involuntary bouts the supernatural where she can see the past and the future and physically feel the actions happenning her she envisions her gift leads the arrest of nasty wife beater who may or may not have killed the pretty rich girl found in the swamp on his property in an ultra conservative backwoods town will her testimony based on her psychic visions hold up in court do they even have the right man what is good about it aside from keanu reeves giving one of the best performances of his career as the loathable redneck donnie barksdale there is little else going for the what is not so good about it lame unoriginal screenplay predictable ending suspense scenes that are just plain boring ridicously trite characterization makes the entire south out be ingnorant hateful goobers relentless in its emotional sensationaliztion overall critique the gift is one of those movies that makes you wonder where you have seen this story before it is collection of every cliche and stereotype of the south ever made and coming from yankee like me who dislikes the south that is really saying something for an established talented director sam raimi is unable provide any kind of originality this it is predictable from the first scene the screenplay is written like ripoff of photocopied bootlegged play you know that as nasty as the murder suspect is he did not actually do it it is no surprise either who the real villain turns out be and what their motive was sigh how trite for supernatural thriller this is neither scary nor intense because it is so cliche the gift is basically glorified bmovie

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned was incredulous when first heard that mgm was planning sequel their sciencefiction flick species squandering an intriguing premise the original turned out be dreadful mess widely disliked both audiences and critics alike and nonetheless still somehow succeeded in becoming financial success raking in over million domestic during the competitive summer season despite distinct lack of star power in its cast ben kingsleys splendid actor but marquee name he as not miraculously dodging the bullet the first doubted that they would dare tempt fate and go for another round so here comes species ii new creative team director peter medak and screenwriter chris brancato step in for roger donaldson and dennis feldman respectively that fails improve the series one iota like its predecessor species ii fails capitalize on potentially promising kernel and instead runs the gamut from ridiculously silly unmitigatedly stupid the follows the exploits of young man patrick ross justin lazard whose sole focus is on cruising along the streets in order pick up women loitering in strip clubs and generally trying bed as many different ladies as he possibly can in other words patrick is like lot of guys these activities could describe the everyday routines of huge percentage of men his age but there is catch he is an astronaut who recently returned from seemingly successful mission mars and who is now infected alien dna patricks overriding compulsion mate and sire countless numbers of gooey little alien offspring and when he becomes aware of eve natasha henstridge halfhuman halfalien clone of the monster from the first being studied in government lab patricks primary focus turns her if these two were mate the resulting pure strain of offspring would be unstoppable warns dr laura baker marg helgenberger gamely reprising her role admirable conviction species ii opens the mars mission and the space scenes are remarkably unconvincing and hokeylooking even splicing back dated grainy footage of actual spacecraft activities they really skimped on production values this time around however this all looks positively inspired when compared the first appearance of the evil alien goo ultimately infests patrick watching as it slinks around the command module of the spaceship any question as whether or not this is cheesy bmovie is quickly answered mr brancatos original screenplay is filled outrageous lines often leaves the audience in stitches like the first and perhaps in homage it there is real penchant for dialogue underlines the obvious last time around featured the hootworthy line uttered forest whitakers psychic empath character upon entering bloodsoaked room something bad happened here this time laura gets stand over fresh shredded corpse its entails ripped out and mutter this is awful and she is not even empathic and when psychotically horny patrick accosts supermarket shopper and drags her kicking and screaming behind the building in woefullypaced suspense sequence eve who is telepathically linked her alienhumanhybrid counterpart whatever helpfully tells our alienhunting protagonists he is going rape her while species ii is often unintentionally hilarious at least it occasionally demonstrates sense of humour of its own there is an amusing tongueincheek bit of product placement does not really make much sense but appreciated the sentiment as well as some supermarketrelated hijinx he is in aisle informs eve if the maintained this sort of lighthearted tone it would have been much more charming and enjoyable watch but its detriment it instead takes its silly plot far too seriously and barrels along bloody effectsladened anticlimactic conclusion much of the fails make whole lot of sense and there are such gaping plot holes that it is terribly difficult contain any suspension of disbelief the implausibilities are endless what about the toxic bomb in eves brain why are the guards armed guns when they already know firearms are ineffectual my favourite was the slowmotion sequence in the where eve sporting superhuman strength is shown tossing aside guards who are attempting contain her what look like body blocks this is the sort of movie leaves you holding your head in amazed disbelief incredulous that it is being foisted upon the public returning headlines michael madsen who reprises tough guy press lennox and ms helgenberger do what they can this goofy screenplay but there is realistically only so much one can do this script as basis mykelti williamson portraying astronaut dennis gamble churns out an alltoofamiliar spin on generic brashmouthed character and fine character actors george dzundza playing colonel burgess and looking ridiculous in the process and james cromwell patricks neglectful father senator ross are utterly wasted in the mr lazard gives his character an appropriately shiftyeyed look while returning vixen ms henstridge is actually given the opportunity act in one scene and acquits herself nicely but is mostly relegated reprising her familiar role of parading about in skimpy clothing or none at all ms henstridge recently commented on how some female audiences have expressed appreciation for her character in the first entry of the species series claiming that she is so empowered lethal halfalien in heat who dispatches of her sexual partners in grotesque fashion now that is what call empowerment

the sequel the fugitive s marshals is an average thriller using it is association the fugitive just so it can make few extra bucks tommy lee jones returns his role as chief deputy samuel gerard the grizzly cop who was after harrison ford in the fugitive this time he is after fugitive mark sheridan snipes who the police think killed two fbi agents but of course he is been set up and when the police plane escort he and gerard are riding crashes he makes run for it gerard not so hot on his tail what follows is about hours of action brought us the director of executive decision another curiously involving plane when comparing this movie the fugitive the prequel is far superior but even on it is own s marshals is pretty lousy movie while the original was reasonably intelligent and had fugitive root for the audience feels strangely distanced from snipes fugitive mainly because we know so little about him until way into the films overlong running time while the fugitive gave little time develop harrison fords character s marshals is straight in there pulling it is trump card the place crash almost immediately be honest could not care less if snipes character got captured or not snipes performance is average and his character gets surprisingly little screen time considering he is the fugitive for reasons will explain later tommy lee jones is as fine as ever although his role is hardly challenge the sense of deja vu was overwhelming know it is the same role from the fugitive but there is seemingly no attempt develop his character from the last there is few nudge nudge references from the first but apart from that nothing nobody even mentions harrison ford in this movie downey jnr is ok as fbi agent john royce who is roped into the chase and sexy french actress irene jacob wanders in and out of the movie as snipes wife nobody looks as if their having good time and all the performers are on autopilot the supporting cast are k but when it comes performances s marshals falls flat on it is face it does not fare any better plotwise either the starts off gerard trying capture snipes but then veers off into terrorists territory as said above the is an normal average terrorist thriller seen million times before but is using the fugitive reputation make it sound more professional if this was not the sequel the fugitive this would probably go straight video or not even been made at all because it is so average and because of the films plot changing it is course snipes is almost forgotten apart and hardly features in the movie stuart baird the director is all right but there is no particular scene that stands out it is director is the usual action movie style even the plane crash is sorely lacking in tension the special effects are nice especially the plane crash and there is good if very loud soundtrack veteran composer jerry goldsmith but in the end s marshals suffers from an overwhelmingly lack of excitement sure it is loud and dumb but in the end s marshals just as not fun bored performers and lackluster plot and script do not make good action movie overall rating review david wilcock web space provided geocities

one of the contributors the destruction of the batman franchise chris odonnell stars in this remake of buster keatons silent seven chances now have never seen seven chances as am more of chaplin fan than keaton fan but seriously doubt that the classic version could be as insipid as this odonnell plays jimmie shannon the manager of pool table manufacturing company he also fears commitment and despite dating anne renee zellweger for over three years he is unwilling marry her his reasons well he is guy you see and well guys are like stallions and they apparently do not like be roped or something hey that is the movies explanation would marry renee zellweger in second eventually it comes time for jimmie propose and when he does it is the most absurd proposal ever uttered man ever he essentially says her you win and hands her ring the audience should now hate this character did then the meat of the plot presents itself jimmies grandfather peter ustinov completely wasted dies and leaves jimmie his entire estate of million dollars as well as ownership of the pool table business however in order get the money and save the jobs of the factory workers jimmie must be married before his next birthday is just over hours away having blown his chances anne jimmie proceeds track down all his prior girlfriends and suggest business proposition the movie was not half bad this time surprisingly it was not boring me and even managed read my thoughts at one point ustinovs character left video will and while he is reading the ridiculous clause in it thought myself what is this brewsters millions as soon as thought it hal holbrooks character actually says what is this brewsters millions it was quite surreal something happens though during the films final act that caused me sharply drop the rating it was going receive up that point all of jimmies prior girlfriends had turned down his business proposition felt was good at least the was not painting women be cold hearted gold diggers when jimmie has no other options his goofy friend played artie lange making career out of playing the goofy friend places an ad in the newspaper that somehow becomes front page story at this point women don wedding gowns and head off persuade jimmie pick them be his bride these women arrive at jimmies location and immediately start bullying him about what he is looking for in woman when he is had enough of their unjustified attacks he tells the angry mob that there is been mistake and he will not be marrying any of them as result the women proceed chase him around the city in hopes of catching him and tearing his limbs off this goes on for the rest of the it is just chris odonnell running from obnoxious greedy angry and stupid women my groans of disgust could be heard for miles the finally ended thankfully but this day am still groaning the bachelor is available on dvd from new line home video it contains the in both full frame and in its original theatrical aspect ratio of cast and crew info and special dvdrom features the original theatrical trailer is also on the disc contains scenes not in the apparently there was even more footage of the gang of brides chasing odonnell around the city and at one point odonnell is leaping from the tops of buses so that was bad enough be cut but the other minutes of bride shenanigans was good ugh

the happy bastards quick movie review holy man more like holy crap the stars eddie murphy as mysticalish figure named on strange journey of some sort when he comes across two network execs jeff goldblum and kelly preston flat tire on their hands somehow he ends up in their car and on their channel lineup of infomercial programs featuring the likes of betty white morgan fairchild and slew of other celebrities and nameless figures it is here that he seems hit his stride speaking of life instead and somehow boosting sales at this point in the movie of course morality comes into play particularly on goldblum who suddenly feels he can market the magical into megabucks get in good his boss robert loggia it does not take long for the movie unfold into sappy mush realizations taking place left and right and poor plot points only real zippy sequence involving frying morgan fairchilds face seems have any interest in the movie murphy lends nothing his character and poor goldblum looks as if he would rather be someplace else some may argue that the movie has message but all that came across me is that could probably get more entertainment watching that informercial the guy in the question mark coat at least he has something for us laught at

forget get carter instead get me cup of coffee what the hell has happened all good american action movies did unknowingly miss meeting somewhere when did all of the badass kicking butt and taking names guntoting crazed vengeful characters of the from such films as commando cobra predator raw deal first blood suddenly turn into innocent compassionate sensitive tearyeyed knuckleheads the only place turn these days for an honest action is towards the east and do not mean new york city get carter the latest masterpiece from uberthespian sylvester stallone is prime example of large and in charge action stars trying fit back into action roles they have long since outgrown stallone seems like that one uncle you have who tries be cool his members only jacket and izod polo shirt the collar popped up few years ago stallone made movie that gave him the opportunity gracefully exit the roles that typecast him as an action monkey that role was sheriff freddy heflin in copland strange about redemption within broken soul stallone actually gave an amazing performance and it seemed he had shaken off the past too bad get carter returns stallone action but the shiny paint rusted off on the edges get carter is simple story stallone plays frank carter vegas bruiser for loan shark played amazing gusto the uncredited voice of actor tom sizemore when franks brother gets himself killed in drunk driving accident frank feeling all guilty and mushy inside thinks foul play is involved and travels seattle set right all the wrongs the patented carters way he talks tough his brothers wife lends helping had his brothers daughter doreen rachel leigh cook and walks around seattle in the pouring rain dressed like lost member of the rat pack really bad goatee carter finds out that his brother was involved in some bad stuff slimy porn king played ultracool mcqueenesque mickey rourke multimillionaire computer geek alan cumming and strange foreign guy michael caine who speaks in riddles and talks tough carter stalks all of them while trying figure out who did in his brother and how extract proper revenge on the responsible parties what minute this sounds just like another saw last year the limey better not tell terence stamp about stallone ripping him off actually get carter is remake of the british production of the same name starring caine in the title role and what his cameo here the cleverness is astonishing while stallone still carries his own weight here the movie lacks what the original did as well purpose throughout the stallone looks like an old guy trying act tough while nobody is taking him seriously his oneliners fall flat and he seems tired and uncertain of all the actions mental and physical required of his character there is even strange homoeroticism between rourke and stallone that lends bizarre tone their numerous conversations in both fists and words the biggest surprise in get carter is that the best job done in the is the versatile mickey rourke an amazing method actor in the eighties who fell into drugs spousal abuse boxing career and an intolerable attitude towards not getting his way rourke still brings dangerous sense of purpose his porn king character he may not win any oscars but he still ranks highly in my book get carter has great directing strong acting rourke and caine and energetic car chases that would make william friedkin proud the only thing it lacks as most productions is good script and proper casting never mind that it should never have been made at all

a remake of the warren beatty vehicle heaven can wait in turn was remake of here comes mr jordan down earth tells the tale of lance barton chris rock lethal weapon iv young black standup comic trying win over the audience at harlems apollo theater when he is taken heaven prematurely bumbling angel keyes eugene levy best in show his only recourse is return in another body he chooses that of charles wellington the tenth richest man in the united states of course wellington is not only rich but white and years old makes lances bid for closing night at the apollo as well as his desire woo suntee regina taylor jerry maguire tad tricky the original elaine maywarren beatty script has been reworked chris rock lance crouther ali leroi and louis k turn beattys vehicle as football player into rocks vehicle as comic and add some racial humor as directed chris weitz and paul weitz codirectors of american pie and costars of chuck buck the whole affair comes off as amateur hour initial scenes play like filmed line reading rehearsals production values are shoddy most serious of all is the use of rock when his wellington counterpart would have been more appropriate this problem is clearly attributable the fact that the old white guy is never lip or action synched when he is on screen rock does get the chance do some fun schtick such as his turnaround on wellingtons plans for poor neighborhood hospital bullet in the head you got bed but he is uneven when interacting the rest of the cast regina taylor fares well amidst the mediocrity as the young activist who confusedly ends up falling for the man she believed be her nemesis also good is frankie faison hannibal as whitney lances compassionate manager the only human who is made privy lances body body switch chaz palminteri and levy are pretty much wasted as heavens ambassadors another best in show alumnus jennifer coolidge is poorly used as wellingtons cheating wife and shown several days apart wearing the same outfit and greg germann tvs ally mcbeal sweet november continues display his sitcom roots as her lover and husbands lawyer mark addy the full monty is sorely underutilized as cisco wellingtons fake english butler stealing the show in every scene she is in is wanda sykes the chris rock show as wellingtons disgruntled maid down earth is for chris rock fans only all others should go rent heaven can wait or truly be brought down earth

what would you do if no one could see you well if you are super smart biomolecular research scientist working for the military you would grope coworker and roughup your neighbor from across the street that is right of all the noncriminal possibilities brought about rendering oneself invisible in hollow man kevin bacons character opts commit sex crimes er it is kevin bacon who plays the super smart military biomolecular research scientist something sounds horribly wrong already but this is paul verhoeven and the sleazepin director of such opencrotch classics as basic instinct and the infamous showgirls never lets little credibility get in the way of his voyeuristic tendencies when you come right down it is all this is about hollow man features string of hapless clist actors among them bacon elisabeth shue josh brolin and kim dickens in gradez plot lot of special effects that frankly do not look much better than those used in the version of the invisible man oh bacon glistens when he gets wet all right and looks like rather fatty side of cheap flank steak when he is attempting reentry but otherwise it is lots of thermal shots and inanimate objects elisabeth shue included bobbing around without any visible signs of support since invisibility once achieved is not much of an effect the actors spend half their time conversing nobody and the other half of their time talking each otherit amounts much of muchness the director elects wardrobe all of his female protagonists in looselybuttoned sweaters so that the minute bacons character gets invisible he can head straight for them it is as if that fascinating conceptwhat would you do if no one could see you is simply verhoeven ploy show some skin as horror hollow man is unsophisticated and disturbing in its intent not its achievements and not worth your time or your hardearned dollars it is minor verhoevenand even that is not saying muchand boy is it hollow

roger ebert asks in his review of sexy beast who would have guessed that the most savage maddog frothing gangster in recent movies would be played ben kingsley my response would be that anyone who has seen alan arkin in wait until dark henry fonda in once upon time in the west or anthony hopkins in the silence of the lambs should have guessed it they should know that the way for create really creepy sociopath is cast someone who generally plays mild sympathetic or even ineffectual character roles the same characteristics that make an actor seem gentle in most of his roles can work in his favor when role calls for him be fierce and vicious that is the principle that works for kingsley in sexy beast gary gal dove played ray winstone has retired from london career of crime and is living on luxurious villa in spain life has become routine of sunning himself and relaxing but his paradise is about be shattered onetwopunch the first punch is boulder that comes rolling down the hill next the villa the second punch comes from gals past back in london gang boss teddy bass ian mcshane tvs lovejoy is planning break into safety deposit room in bank and he wants gal he sends his most rabid henchman don logan ben kingsley fetch gal don will accept any decision gal makes from yes certainly however if gal says no don will do whatever it takes turn it into yes including threatening guys exporn star wife deedee amanda redman in the meantime don knows just how get under everybodys skin kingsley makes don compact package of fury and nastiness there are some serious problems in louis melliss and david scintos script that should have been caught before filming when we see the actual crime we have no idea why gal was so important its success beyond an ability use skindiving gear no special talents are required of him any local hood could have done what gal is needed for additionally the crime involves digging from swimming pool the bank vault flooding the vault no only could they have let the water out of the pool and avoided the complication altogether but there is far too much water be accounted for what was in the pool in spite of the provocative title the story is cliched and overly familiar know have seen all the plot elements of sexy beast in old westerns like the law and jake wade the story is usually of the reformed outlaw robert taylor type who has hung up his guns and is trying for life of peaceful respectability the old gang however wants do one more job their old buddy and sends rabid richard widmark type go and git im it is not great plot in sexy beast even the plot twists have gray beards perhaps the has little more respectability because it was made not as western but as stylish british gangster it is an old plot dressed up look new if the plot is old at least the style is creative this is director jonathan glazers first but he has reputedly done some notable tv ads for guinness stout his style does have some unexpected touches including some very odd dream sequences cinematographer ivan bird uses lot of half lit scenes we see one side of persons faces but the other side fades into the darkness sort of metaphor for the halfworld these characters inhabit half of everything that is happening is also kept hidden us yanks will have hard time some of the dialog at least in my theater it was difficult make out the words the quiet speaking the heavy accents and the cockney language sexy beast is very and familiar minor plot lent respectability in the us being done in what is here still somewhat novel genre the london crime the plot may be new british crime films but it would be overly familiar as western further respectability comes from ben kingsleys highpowered performance give it on the scale and on the scale

apparantly money talks and uses quite bit of obscenities doing so have always considered myself pretty open about the gratuity can possess whether in language violence sex or what have you find that this fact gives me little more leverage complain when movie goes overboard and money talks definitely does it is not so much that the movie swore nearly constantly and mean constantly but it swore so much that it seemed overly prominent and way too staged perhaps if one character were foul mouthed but in this everybody swears nearly every other word money talks is about black ticket scalper named franklin hatchett played less annoyingly than expected chris tucker franklin is your typical conman and ends up more than one person out get him when the plot finally gets underway there is no less than three people or groups that want him dead or alive the frenchman who is somewhat responsible for franklins escape from prisonerpacked bus hoodlum whom franklin owes seven grand and the cops who wrongly suspect him of murder franklins only hope james russell charlie sheen an investigative reporter for the local news who is out prove himself worthy journalist james offers help clear franklins name if franklin will just allow him an exclusive report help channel conquer sweeps week both of these elements are completely lost along the way however and never do reappear as expected the odd couple of franklin and james do wind up friends at the end is another wasted element seeing as how they show no signs of becoming friends at any point along the way there is just nothing original or intriguing about this and so many developments are either nonrelevant or just plain forgotten about money talks is paintbynumbers movie that lacks any real involvment the audience frivilous dialogue predictable flat storyline and twodimensional characters make money talks reason save your money

starting the little mermaid and most recently the lion king the walt disney company once again proved that they could not only consistently make modern day animated classics but were particularly in touch what the general viewing publicparticularly kids wanted see therefore it is some surprise that as big fan of the above mentioned movies was so disappointed pocahontas despite some innovation and risk taking the story is surprisingly straightforward and dramatized in broad strokes as are its characters group of englishmen lead the evil governor ratcliffe come the new world in search of gold no regard for the savages that live there the natives look upon the english just as much fear and distrust only the love between the beautifully structured pocahontas and the dashing captain john smith can prevent terrible clash the ending as it turns out is not entirely happy one and is one of the films finer moments the characters are mixtures of stereotypes and lack any real depth governor ratcliffe for instance is snobbish singleminded bore whose mere appearance is supposed bring about hisses captain john smith is blond hunk who while slightly misguided is good at heart pocahontas herself is the typical disney heroine who is practically being forced marry man who everyone but her likes and finds the man of her dreams just in time she even comes complete insignificant best friend again against tradition talking animals are not used but lusty wizened talking tree is this is an odd compromise but it is one of the few elements that really work the animals are delight and what brief time their interactions take place brings the only humor and fun rather bland presentation maybe it would have been better if we saw the story unfold through their eyes the talking tree who seems have thing for john smith is the only other character that can hold our interest and is perhaps the best developed of the bunch the music welcome delight in the later disney films is mostly let down here the exception of the catchy and motivational colors of the wind mel gibson as the voice of john smith has solid singing voice and should have been used more the opposite holds true for the governor ratcliffe led songs the singing is even more grating than his simplistic character was rather bored through what turned out be shorter than expected running time even the children in the audience seemed restless while there is no stopping kid from seeing something that they wantor disney wants them tomost believe will be disappointed perhaps the biggest problem is that disney has strayed from their familiar fable and fairy tale themes history it is all right change or embellish fantasy suit movies entertainment value but doing so historical facts does not work nearly as well as creating nagging questions in the viewers minds and plot holes that are never filled even the artwork another disney strong point varies greatly in quality making any story problems even more obvious as mentioned above there were many questions that stayed me while viewing the for instance if john smith was truly such world traveler and had so much experience savages why did he so quickly change his previous kill as many indians as can attitude if he was such nice guy after all he should have changed his ways long before this or how about pocahontas amazing english speaking ability when this had supposedly been the first time she had seen white men can understand making the native americans speak english for the benefit of the audience but simply saying that they had met missionary years earlier would have cleared up lot history was modified in the anyway as it is wonder if it does not give kids the wrong impression in short the is too simplistic for adults and contains too much romance and not enough action or humor for the younger set while disney tried valiantly in many ways break some of their firmest traditions they end up failing on too many levels

plot upon the realization that they are failing all of their classes two roommates try find third roomie who will kill himself since the schools charter automatically grants top grades the roommates of any student who succeeds in suicide critique despite this films interesting premise and dark subject matter this movie sucks because it is unfunny boring and presents us one of tom everett scotts worst acting performances add that completely unsuccessful romance element many lame and corny jokes long wait for the setup and an ending that takes all the blackness out of this black comedy if you are gonna create black comedy do not chicken out in the endsee very bad things for perfect example and you have got yourself trite mtv creation worthy of its own subject matter barely laughed at any gags found the bong element contrived and repetitive and was horrified not find any gratuitous nudity tossed anywhere in this movie if you are gonna make bad college comedy at least slap in some free ta shots for the kids this ones not even worth the rental fellas skip it altogether little known facts about this and its stars during auditions for that thing you do tom everett scotts first feature role director tom hanks was opposed hiring tom because of the fact that scott could have passed for hanks years ago it was not until hanks wife rita wilson saw the audition tape and decided he was cute that hanks decided risk hiring scott the actor who played scott cooper in this markpaul gosselaar is best known for having played the character of zack morris on tvs saved the bell his parents are dutch and named hans and paula and who would have guessed that this is director alan cohns first shot at directing feature

when respecting director you must also respect the fact that they are not perfect woody allen has made couple lessthan good films and he is my favorite even martin scorsese has not had perfect track
