you do not need have seen the original species appreciate how utterly lousy species ii is few exceptions sequels tend be worse than the films that spawned them but the fact that species ii is followup is not the only reason it is so miserable it is the predictable storyline the cardboard characters the banal dialogue the failed attempts at humor the revolting special effects the gratuitous nudity all female of course the bad acting and the bland direction the plot simply geared at getting the alien species back on planet earth so that it can reak some more havoc involves three astronauts landing on mars and inadvertently bringing some alien slime in soil sample back aboard their shuttle the slime well sort of jumps out at them and the screen turns black that should have been the end of the movie right there back on terra firma at least one of the crew is now carrier of alien dna and as you will remember if you saw the first movie driven strong urge procreate on parallel track government scientists have cloned version of sil from the first now called eve again played natasha henstridge and are keeping her around for some testing this apparently includes observing eves reaction the dukes of hazzard tv show she appears enjoy eves biorhythms go off the scale each time one of her kinfolk mates we are forced witness in grossout detail but otherwise there does not appear be whole lot of reason why henstridge is in this unless it was written into her contract let us hope it cited one sequel and one sequel only eve finally breaks free of her confinesand her brafor the finale but the effects are so messy you cannot really see what is going on peter boyle is totally wasted as an institutionalized scientist who screams told em not go at the top of his lungs referring the mars mission but more likely aimed at the makers of this piffle michael madsen reprises his role of press lennox so that he can enter high security areas flash badge and claim be press maybe as does marg helgenberger as dr laura baker the one subjecting eve the tv reruns they are both unbelievably wooden what is talented filmmaker like peter medak the ruling class the krays let him have it doing directing this tripe wonder it is an unfortunate trend this oncetalented directors throwing in the towel and lending their names unchallenging horror flicks like species ii last year peter hyams gave us the relic no thanks necessary there and the first species was helmed roger donaldson who although certainly no genius behind the camera had demonstrated much better judgment his previous choice of projects is it just that there are no better offers out there species ii is worthless worse than that it is also exploitative offensive and insulting the intelligence at every turn it is not that there is not anything positive say about the there is after minutes it ends

something is fishy in the state of universal about ten years back the unexpected success of mad max and the road warrior postapocalypse nittygritty survival yarns became popular at the movies we have always had movies of this nature on the beach the end of the world damnation alley the ultimate warrior and so on date the most smoothly done were straightforward haircuts of the classic western plot like the lone gunman who comes town and protects the widow and the son against an evil organization usually one in possession of some critical resource like water feed range or mining claim most of these grew out of venerable but solid hero yarns like the virginian and shane my personal favorite is patrick swayze movie called steel dawn was fairly well made on small budget now we have waterworld again brings the traditional lone gunman town rescue the young widow and her daughter well she is not widow and the kid is not her daughter but you get the idea the lady is helen played the stunning jean tripplehorn who is not given chance be stunning or even interesting the mediocre and unimaginative script the child enola played tina majorino is living proof that child actor need not be bad thing have in movie she outshines her material all the way through in simple the scene is earth hundreds of years from now the polar ice caps have melted and somehow produced enough water inundate the entire planet the few remaining people live in boats and floating colonies and survive trade theft or piracy somehow an oil tanker has survived the centuries and its inhabitants called smokers are able keep gasoline engines running despite the dearth of replacement parts and raw materials so the bad guys have outboard engines and fastmoving boats airplanes and jet skis enola found at sea as young girl has mysterious map no one can read tattooed on her back we suspect early on that it is the way the mythical dryland the place where trees crops and animals grow and what plot there is hinges on who has enola the psycho ruler of the smokers the deacon is trying get her and find his way dryland played typical selflampooning rugchewing histrionics dennis hopper deacon is the only thing in the movie that is close amusing his performance is almost laughable but there just is not enough there be funny the star and coproducer is kevin costner he is playing an unnamed lone denizen of the sea man called the mariner who turns out be gilled waterbreathing mutant webbed feet very little is done this the script ignores the ineffectuality of gills in supplying enough oxygen support human metabolism it ignores the fact that even both ice caps completely melted much of the earths surface would still be above water and it ignores the blatant impossibility of the cultures and technology shown canned meat does not last for centuries ammunition does not fire after it is more than few decades old and so on and so on am quite fond of tina majorinos previous work very impressed jean tripplehorns past accomplishments and still speechless over costners dances wolves but this movie could destroy the careers of anyone associated it this movie cost one hundred and eightytwo million dollars and there is nothing in it we have not seen before done better on only few percent of the cost of this turkey at minutes of material this movie cost over one point four million dollars per minute make the budget of this movie could have given us over thirty movies it could have paid for six years of primetime sf tv series expensive fx work or ten years of an sf tv series good digital fx in sum this movie is beneath contempt it has nothing new offer it has script that could easily have been bettered the people who write comic books for dc and it spent more money than the national budget of small nation if you have go see it see it on fourdollar matinee otherwise you will find yourself sneering at you every time you pass reflective surface for weeks

this season needs another serial killer movie like kathie lee gifford needs more public devastation but lo and behold here comes switchback and fast on the heels of such stalker fare as kiss the girls and know what you did last summer but switchback is an undoubtedly weak genre entry as the material it covers is old and tired and the filmmakers rarely sustain enough energy make any of the proceedings interesting switchback opens the murder of babysitter and the abduction of the young child she is watching we learn late in the game that the kid belongs fbi agent frank lacrosse dennis quaid and that the kidnapperkiller is nameless fiend that lacrosse has been tracking across the country for quite while he is promptly removed from the case but this conflict of interest does not keep him from offering pursuit lacrosses most recent trek takes him bloodsoaked hotel room in amarillo texas where the local sheriff lee ermey is torn between his reelection campaign and helping his new ally catch his man in related aside former railway worker bob goodall danny glover is cruising through the snowbound west in his pinupplastered even on the seatbelts el dorado along the way he picks up and subsequently saves the life of hitchhiking loner lane dixon jared leto this tangent is not random one as bob or lane will end up either holding piece of the puzzle or turn out be the killer himself or is the villain in fact lacrosse only pretending be after the coldhearted murderer he knows so much about in sense that is half of the basic problem switchback for its first hour the movie presents evidence that any of these three men could be the perpetrator so we are given little insight into who they are likely for fear that we will learn too much too fast and therefore be able make the proper deduction but switchback then decides explicitly reveal the killers identity at its midpoint and the following contradictory character motivations muddle both the pacing and the generation of suspense some of the acting is burdensome area as well probably because the performers were instructed build personas that are the exact opposite of their true selves what is danny glover doing here grinning and yeehawing his way through the messy plot and dennis quaid that monotone stop it ermey is solid in supporting role that is more interesting than the two leads thrown together but the charismatic leto claire danes object of affection in my socalled life is scenestealer tried and true from material standpoint switchback is pretty empty but even when firsttime director jeb stuart who wrote the fugitive and die hard does not know what do he knows what he wants it look like the movie provides some great visuals the setonatrain climax looks good even though the action is illogical and the beautiful crisp cinematography captures the rockies in all of their icy splendor still that is not enough turn lump of coal into diamond and more than the movies look will end up leaving you cold

some talented actresses are blessed demonstrated wide acting range while others almost as gifted have more limited types of parts for they are suitable as was amply evident after basic instinct sharon stone can play sensual roles great abandon rejecting her natural abilities she has spent the rest of her entire career trying little success play against type gloria is her latest disaster babe ruth did not quit baseball after one season play football in quixotic quest prove his athletic dexterity and neither should stone reject what she does best janeane garofalo for example is no less wonderful an actress because she could have never pulled off stones part in basic instinct neither is stone any less talented because she could not do garofalos comedic roles gloria directed respected director sidney lumet and adapted steve antin from the screenplay john cassavetes was not screened in advance for critics almost always sign that the studio is not behind the picture after seeing it in nearly empty audience after it opened it is clear why they held it from the press it is more be endured than enjoyed as the story opens an angry gloria stone is being released from prison after years confinement she is got bad attitude and big mouth she also has bad case of wavering and overblown new york accents disease suffered much of the rest of the cast an annoying child actor named jeanluke figueroa plays soontobe orphan named nicky just before his whole family is gunned down hoods working for glorias exboyfriend kevin jeremy northam nickys dad gives him banana yellow floppy disk secrets about kevins operation and offers him piece of fatherly advice be man his father lectures him sternly do not trust nobody not no broads nobody most of the films leaden dialog is delivered the emotive power of the automated time and temperature announcements add in the movies almost nonexistent background noise and the excruciatingly slow pacing and you can hear the sounds of the lines falling the ground like stones lumet places his actors in the frames like fruit in still life painting they stand awkwardly mouthing the stiff sentences that pass for discourse say you are my baby kevin coos demandingly am not gonna gloria pouts back the movie has plethora of logical flaws and implausibilites the kid rarely seems the least bit worried or scared no matter how many people are after him guns trying kill him and in one key scene the yellow floppy he holds is assumed be the right disk without checking it and is further assumed never have been copied gloria who keeps saying how she hates kids takes nicky under her wing and protects him from kevin and the bad guys think her maternal instincts will show up before the movie finally and predictably ends if you do not know the answer you may be just the right viewer for this you have say this for stone she can keep straight face when explaining life yearold kid she says utter seriousness you got lot of love making make you got lot of boozing do gloria runs it is rated for profanity violence and brief male nudity and would be acceptable for teenagers

susan grangers review of ghosts of mars sony pictures entertainment horror auteur john carpenter halloween vampires strikes out this scifi ecofable that is so bad it boggles the mind imagine how the project ever got greenlit the script carpenter and larry sulkis appears have been lifted directly from last years pitch black involving violent prisoner who must be released from bondage so that he can help small band of humans protect themselves from bloodthirsty marauding aliens in the year there are earthlings on mars living in matriarchal society led commander played pam grier grier pillpoppin natasha henstridge and some rookie mars police officers clea duvall jason statham travel the remote mining town of shining canyon fetch desolation williams that is ice cube bring him back chryse city stand trial for murder but when they are besieged demented zombielike bodysnatching miners they readily free the scowling ice cube since they need him for protection it seems red cloud was released from shining canyon cave and soon after most of the miners went bonkers as longdormant remnants of an ancient martian civilization took over their minds and bodies lopping off heads as vengeance for anything that tries lay claim their planet according scientist joanna cassidy carpenter uses so many flashbacks tell the night of the living dead like story that the idiotic plot gets incomprehensibly confusing but you can easily predict each of the supporting characters who will be killed along the order of their elimination on the granger movie gauge of ghosts of mars thuds laborious bottomofthebarrel perhaps indeed there is curse on mars films if you recall two other duds mission mars and red planet

plot based on the wildly popular jerry springer tv show this movie follows the lives of two groups of people before they make their bizarre appearances on the infamous program one posse comes from the trailer parks and are be featured in the slept my stepfather segment and the other is based on some flygirl whose girlfriends keep sleeping her undevoted dog boyfriend critique the truth is that if did not have day job would probably watch the real jerry springer show every day find it quite entertaining despite its complete lack of redeeming value having said that the show itself is outrageous funny and always filled goofy surprises as opposed this features no laughs is this comedy or drama uninteresting and completely unbelievable onedimensional stereotypes and contrived plot bores us stupid all the way never thought would utter the word boring in the same sentence as jerry springer but this is an absolute yawnfest despite offering various scenes featuring simulated blowjobs lesbians ta and tv violence who would have guessed that wish they would have either made this movie much much funnier or turned it into complete drama and given us real perspective as why people like this actually put themselves through these public forums of embarrassment unfortunately it does not seem as though screenwriter jon bernstein spent more than drunken weekend watching real jerry springer reruns complete his script leaving us boring featuring no laughs onedimensional characters and no fun whatsoever little known facts about this and its stars jerry springer used be the mayor of cincinnati ohio for this he won the razzie award for worst new star tied joe esterhas from an alan smithee burn burn

i never understood what the clich hell on earth truly meant until very recently have just never experienced anything in my life was so terrifying so horrible so monstrously deplorable that it justified being termed as hell on earth after all have never been war have never been the victim of any violent crime have never really been broken hearted and have never been audited so really had no frame of reference as people meant when they said that something was hell on earth then saw cruel intentions in perfect world would be in charge of all the movie studios the very first thing would do in this perfect world would be take every producer who thinks that setting any story in contemporary america something cast playing teenagers and featuring soundtrack ripped directly from mtv and throw them in jail but it would not just be your average jail not even maximum security installation would have these producers and everyone else involved in the production of these films put in front of war crimes tribunal and forced beg for mercy for their crimes against humanity now you are probably thinking yourself is this really how bad cruel intentions is the answer is no it is actually much worse watching the cast of this motion picture atrocity try act their way through roger kumbles awfully written script is probably lot like stabbing yourself in the arm chainsaw and then pouring salt on the open wound and then pouring acid on the salt do not know if kumble was trying evoke comedy or tragedy out of his opening scene where marci greenbaum tara reid whines about having nude photos of her posted on the internet but the only emotion felt was sheer boredom from that opening scene where boring actor ryan phillippe tries seduce tv actress swoosie kurtz the conclusion do not remember because had practically fallen asleep cruel intentions is truly hell on earth right up there war and tax audits

about an hour or so into the jackal character wandered around as people were being shot at in big suspense sequence and one of the audience members in the theatre saw it in shouted out hope she gets killed now at that point it hit me did not care for any of the characters being played actors did not really like when the sole reason you care about character being played sidney poitier in suspense is because he is being played sidney poitier you know somethings rotten in the state of denmark every year couple films like this are released you know the cheap action packed international espionnage featuring semipromising premise some bigname actors usually bruce willis and the hopes that some audience members will forget the cold war ended several years ago this was the third one of following the very lackluster the saint featured an amoral costume changing bond wannabe and the surprisingly fun the peacemaker featuring clooney and kidman trying stop an almost untraceable villain the jackal tries mix both elements and you thought the saint was bad the jackal is loosely very loosely hope based on the fred zimmerman classic that have yet see the day of the jackal featured apparently suave hitman called the jackal played edward fox trying assasinate charles degaule well welcome the where sorta suave hitman also called the jackal bruce willis trying kill the head of the fbi or is he after being hired russian mob lord as bit of vengeance for the murder of his brother killed in the opening scenes the jackal romps all over the northen hemisphere from helsinki virginia setting up an elaborate scheme wherein he will be able assasinate this person and still get away live in seclusion and like the saint the jackal changes his look over and over and over again elude people the agent working on the case cater preston sidney poitier yes that sidney poitier working russian agent valentina koslova diane venora lady capulet from romeo juliet gives up early on and meets an exira man declan mulqueen richard gere putting up some tight competition between himself and brad pitt for worst fake irish accent of who is in massachusetts jail but who has apparently seen the jackal who has been eluding the law forever soon he is out working the two untrusting agents and trying help them catch him there are numerous problems the and one is the biggest one is pretty impossible put finger on the is supposed be big suspense thriller but save couple moments the never achieves suspense or even sense of intrigue sure the big assasination attempt is bit cool looking and even slightly tense but every other scene in the is too short and too dull register the never picks up enough become thrilling experience or even an entertaining one it does not help that the plot is designed be complex but falls into so many problems like plot holes and unbelievable circumstances the script of the jackal is complete mess mostly because it cannot decide what it wants focus on is this about man trying find redemption catching nasty killer is it about nasty amoral hitman who is in everything for the money or is it combination of both the jackal aims for the latter but never focuses in on either character the connection between the two feels completely edited so much that in scene when the jackal turns around and notices declan you wonder how he recognized him so fast the worst part is the little past they try give declan most notably his relationship an old girlfriend isabella mathilda may given so little screen time that you almost forget her character exists until she pops up every now and then the supporting characters are worse sidney poitier is given completely unplayable role that of man who is just stern sometimes and other times more giving and likable what is poitier doing here he is one of the best living actors does he really need waste his time doing drivel like this diane venoras russian character is almost as bad cigarette perpetually in her mouth and plastered on expressionless facade it is not that anyones bad here it is that they have nothing do the plot is joke feeling like it was pasted together someone in postproduction who dropped each scene on the floor and pasted them together quickly so it could be released on time the jackal himself is not even much of an international villain there are several times where he is in tight situation and makes things worse for himself the only explanation being that the filmmakers wanted toss in cheap thrill take scene where he is being followed some agents into parking garage he quickly sprays his car another color and adds solvent that if touched kills the person who touched it does not killing someone attract more attention than it does distract and does he think dying his hair bottle blond makes him fit in in public place geez is there anything good here well couple things did like williss icy expressions he may not have been real suave or anything but some of his looks are worth chuckle richard gere has couple of good moments making his character as likable as he possibly could have and couple sequences are kicky in that kind of proposterous completely inane but fun kinda way most notably sequence where he tests out new gun on an annoying gun builder jack black and bit where he seduces gay washington man has its share of couple good jokes most particular kiss willis but none of these elevate the any higher than it could go they are just little distractions along the way amuse us mildly then toss us back into the world of dullness and stupidity that is the jackal director michael catonjones who directed the far superior rob roy has made that is made very couple months one that is unentertaining unintriguing and pretty much cold but will nevertheless make money because hey the trailers do make it look like it may be fun in that kind of retroclancy kinda way every now and then the filmmakers get it right clear and present danger was enormous fun in that smart kinda way but the jackal is an example of when they go completely wrong

showgirls is the first bigbudget bigstudio receive an nc rating and its release last year came at time when senator bob dole and other politicans chastised the entertainment industry for promoting sex and violence but if showgirls is any indication of hollywoods future the folks in washington should focus their attack on more dangerous threat american valuesbad moviemaking showgirls is relentlessly exploitive look at the las vegas strip scene and the turns out be just as trashy as its subject matter director paul verhoeven and writer joe eszterhas who collaborated on another shockvalue project basic instinct follow the plight of young woman teen tv star elizabeth berkley determined make name for herself as topless dancer it is hackneyed premise begin so not surprisingly all of the stock characters are trucked out there is the demanding producer the loyal friend the bitchy competitor lest forget the scummy club owner of course any attempt at character development or coherent storyline is just window dressing for the films main attractionan endless parade of fullfrontal nudity unfortunately showgirls does not satisfy in this department verhoevens slambang inyourface style of direction proves neither arousing nor erotic make matters worse you will be forced sit through the movies clothed scenes do not cover up for laughable acting and some of the most absurd dialogue ever spoken in history verhoeven and ezsterhas deserve credit for trying break ground but if it is adult entertainment you want stay home and watch the playboy channel you will be the wiser for it

heres concept jeanclaude van damme gets killed within the first ten minutes of the movie now if that is not enough get you finally see van damme movie do not know what is all sarcasm aside it is certainly different way start movie of course few minutes later we find out that the newly deceased had twin brother so lucky us we get see more of jeanclaude van damme works for the russian mafia in the united states and is killed some of their operatives van damme is police officer in france who finds out that he had twin brother he never knew about after gets killed in france the remaining twin the french cop goes the united states find out who killed his brother and avenge his death once there he hooks up his deceased brothers girlfriend played natasha henstridge and the two of them set out discover who the murderers are jeanclaudes acting abilities do not seem be up the usual lackluster standards in this movie in other words just in case you missed the sarcasm his acting is worse than normal on the upside natasha henstridge is in this and she does what she did best in species she gets naked sadly this is probably the high point in the movie she is actually decent actress but did not improve as much as thought she would after species this is the typical van damme movie jeanclaude doing variety of high end martial arts moves on his opponents nothing new here and certainly nothing we have not seen in every other van damme movie simply put there is absolutely nothing new about this movie it has retread plot this is not the first time jeanclaude has played twins he still cannot act we all saw natashas breasts in species although this is one repeat performance am not complaining about this is pretty much like every movie that van damme has ever been involved in sub par

what makes reindeer games even more disappointing than just predictable lifeless action flick is the cast and crew who signed onto the project most of the people involved in reindeer games just came off terrible slumps excellent comeback performances in their most recent films john frankenheimer who made the unforgettable cold war drama the manchurian candidate way back in the early recently showed critics and fans alike that he still had some magic left in his directorial skills when he created the brilliant car chase scenes in ronin screenwriter ehren kruger gave remarkable first impression when he wrote the script for the underrated arlington rd ben affleck displayed his comedic talents in dogma and boiler room and even on saturday night live directly after the horrible forces of nature and cigarettes even charlize theron who was convinced could not act did decent job in cider house rules when all of these bright stars come together one would assume that the movie will have great potential be entertaining after coming out of the theater showing reindeer games disbelief was my first reaction then frustration the movie could have premiered on cinemax at two in the morning starring an allrookie cast and still would have been equally lacking in entertaining the acting is so pitiful and the script so dull may have rethink some of my opinions on how talented these actors actually are it seemed like everyone was restricted just the script and not given fair amount of improvisational rights we have all seen ben affleck have some fun on the set it is so apparent in number of scenes in good will hunting when he exchanges jokes his friends at bar the actors in that movie were having fun and from that the audience had fun reindeer games is the complete opposite the actors do not seem want be their characters even danny trejo who will do practically anything does not look like he is enjoying himself causing the audience quickly lose interest evidence of public disapproval was noted when woman behind me yelled boy this movie is horrible and when there were scattered giggles during the most dramatic moments the story follows man rudy ben affleck who is leaving prison in few days along his best friend and cellmate nick james frain nick has been exchanging love letters beautiful woman ashley charlize theron and cannot wait leave prison and meet her in person when nick is killed in prison riot rudy decides pretend be nick and take ashley out on date for the christmas holidays unfortunately ashleys brother gabriel gary sinise interferes their relationship thinking rudy is nick he kidnaps rudy and threatens kill him unless he helps rob casino nick use work at as security guard now rudy must pretend be nick so he can protect ashley from her brother gabriel confused the movie only gets more complex as it goes on until it gets way way too complex at its climax but reindeer games makes its first serious mistake during the first half an hour the hero commits greedy selfish act when he decides pretend he is his dead cellmate in order date ashley some hero the point of hero is do the morally correct thing person for the audience relate or admire when rudy lies and cheats his way into trouble instead of gathering support from me for him ultimately succeed in getting the bad guys felt more like he was getting what he deserved and even wanted see him fail at times the most irritating part of the besides the fact that this is christmas movie released in february is the number of chances the bad guys get kill rudy but fail or delay for some idiotic reason the routine in the bad guy must explain his genius plan the hero before attempting kill him some elaborate machine is getting so tired nowadays especially when eagerly want see the hero dead the only saving grace keeping this movie from receiving zero stars is an amusing but pointless cameo from isaac hayes as prisoner upset his food why he was in this movie for such pointless role beats me why any of these people had anything at all do this movie beats me

dreamworks skg running time hours starring robert duvall tea leoni and elijah wood directed mimi leder the first of the two asteroid movies coming out this year the second is the macho armageddon is actually dull affair elijah wood plays leo biederman who during astronomy class discovers that large asteroid is heading for earth tea leoni plays rather crap news reporter jenny lerner who soon discovers about this asteroid through very long winded and boring way and robert duvall plays the leader of space crew spurgeon tanner who are planning blow the asteroid out of the path of earth also featuring is morgan freeman as the president and maximilian schell and vanessa redgrave as jennys father and mother while many people will walk into the expecting big special effects fest the asteroid blowing everything up as the trailers seem promise the is actually more of character study if very poor one the main problem is that there are too many characters in the and not enough time explore them all only the space crew are given any depth jenny lerner leo and the president are surprisingly and we never get know these characters and because could not care for them did not really give crap if the asteroid killed them or not the script bruce joel rubin and michael tolkin is horribly simple and never really makes any interesting statements mimi leder the former er director and director of the average the peacemaker again directs in hohum style and never really gets any emotion out of scene is shame the cast are seemingly on autopilot although tea leoni does gives rather good performance even if she acts bit too dorky for her own good she seems uncommonly stupid for journalist robert duvall is on autopilot underwritten role he just seems be in this for the money elijah wood one of the best child actors working today is surprisingly average although his choice of roles lately have not exactly been brilliant e flipper his role is also vastly underwritten morgan freeman again is utterly wasted ridiculously underwritten role like duvall he just seems be in the for the money the supporting cast are all k none making much of an impression ok so deep impact may have messed up character wise but surely the special effects are good well yes and no although the special effects should be impressive massive tidal wave destroying new york the special effects look like well special effects sadly the waves looks like it is been drawn on computer and does not look too good at all surprising really when the effects are done industrial light magic who did the effects for the lost world and twister in the end deep impact is wasted opportunity what could of been moving movie good effects turns out be dud in both characters and effects the hours the had could have been used much greater effect once again dreamworks has churned out another average movie let us hope armageddon is bit better overall rating review david wilcock web space provided geocities

seen may at m at the crossgates cinema theater chris wessell and sean oshea for theater rating very good sound picture and seats the bigbudget megahype event movie is becoming so trendy now it is becoming weekly routine instead of seasonal one gluttony is hollywoods favorite sin but it is the moviegoers who pay the price being dealt the same things over and over on an everworsening basis lost in space is the latest such offering so poor it would be twice as good if it were mediocre it is made up of every element of science fiction but at no time does it evoke the slightest amount of wonderment the genre was meant for audiences attention spans are rapidly decreasing and as is the trend such films this one opens fastpaced space battle serves not only as the most interesting scene in the probably because it has star wars written all over it but as the producers way of showing off their budget through the special effects battle scenes are worthless without tension and since we have no idea what the setting is it is impossible care about anything that happens in essence the entire segment works like teaser for an arcade game not piece of filmmaking we meet the robinson family family of five that does not get along but has been chosen act on earths behalf in effort find another planet worthy of colonization due the exhausting of our natural resources each member of the family has special trait and personality and yet none of them seem like actual people professor john robinson hurt is the intelligent quiet leader who has devoted so much time his work his family and marriage are suffering without his realizing it it is obvious what role this aspect will play of course this is all established through extremely melodramatic scenes such as the children and parents arguing and bickering among themselves and each other while the necessary problems are resolved at the right moments the only thing worse than the screenplay is the fact it is presented in completely serious manner without trace of satire and is so pathetic it is laughable the first act is not building of story but juxtaposition of scenes that serve no purpose other than plug in all the required elements such as plot conflict and characterization god forbid we are provided the minimum amount possible of these elements keep the from being completely silent in fact it might as well be since the dialogue is virtually nonexistent yes the characters do speak but they do not talk they say things that only relate the conflict but they never really interact unless it is the cartoony flirting scenes between arrogant major don west leblanc and uptight unemotional judy robinson graham it is amazing that after an hour of trite dialogue and generic plot devices that so little happens eventually the pacing rapidly increases but the amount of genuine interest does not the story finally gains some prospective living up its title as the robinsons find themselves lost in space after narrowly managing defeat dr smith oldman the cartoony villain and his plans for sabotage what ensues is series upon series of completely unrelated conflicts the first such scene takes place on an abandoned spaceship and what ensues could best be described as alien lite the story changes again when the robinsons crash land on an alien planet and must act quickly escape it and survive but there is never any real notion of suspense here because the script constantly wanders aimlessly plotlines are developed but each becomes totally irrelevant as the story changes from scenario scenario the atmosphere attempts be surreal incorporating time travel and various time paradoxes but it is presented in such ridiculous way it is utterly boring the time the last act rolls around there is no sense of payoff building the ending does not go out on high note any kind of climax instead it seems come sudden halt but at least it ends at all lost in space is major production at its worst it is frightening that so poorly written directed and acted might be considered mainstream entertainment

the only thing worse than watching bad movie is realizing that the had lot of potential and could have been effective such is the case _urban legend_ the new horror from first time director jamie blanks the idea behind the movie is that the mad slasher of the muders people according various urban legends examples include the killer in the backseat of the car and person getting calls from inside her house the killer wears one of those l bean parkas the hood drawn completely up so you cannot see the face guess halloween masks are out of style for psychos these days anyhow the premise is certainly nifty one and the opening scene is spooky and atmospheric it is very good setup that promises more chills come unfortunately the never takes off from there the movie takes place on peaceful new england college campus like most slasher flicks this one also centers around young female main character whose friends are slowly killed off knife wielding maniac or in this case an axe wielding maniac have always wondered why these killers do not save themselves lot of time and trouble and just go after the person they ultimately aim kill after the fine first scene the movie degenerates into monotonous series of those annoying youthoughtitwasthekillerbutwasjust someoneelse scares these are always accompanied loud bursts of music guess sudden sharp music chords are what passes for terror these days the actual killer will attack at about every third music blast the slasher appears attacks the victim is eviscerated and the tedious cycle appears anew false scares should always be used in moderation someone needs tell director blanks that things like this just are not as scary as they used be this movie commits the biggest sin horror can commitit is not frightening remember the horror movie cliches that were so mercilessly mocked in _scream_ and _scream _ this movie still adheres them tons of illogical moments about more than really have the inclination list and do not mean illogical in the summer popcorn movie sense that type of illogical can be fun this insults your intelligence more times than care remember the last minutes especially degenerates into such lunacy that you will be laughing more than you will be screaming actually you will not be screaming at all at its best the acting can barely be called adequate and the script could have definitely used rewrite or two the still manages have some strong points the killings are certainly inventive and plentiful enough satistfy most gore fans there are some intentionally funny moments these were exceeded the unintentional ones the is well made from technical standpoint besides the first part there is also another good scene prolonged cat and mouse chase inside radio station if there had only been more sequences like this that relied on tautness and suspense rather than loud bursts of music _urban legend_ might have been worth your money

my opinion on can be easily swayed the presence of actors love love ralph fiennes love uma thurman love sean connery hell am even big fan of jim broadbent and fiona shaw saw the fantastic preview for the avengers nearly eight months ago and have been eagerly awaiting the ever since few months into the summer however noticed that its release date had been changed few times and that it had ended up in the midaugust dumping ground then in this final week before its official release learned that it was not be screened for critics and that the actors had not been plugging the on late night programs and that it was directed the same man who brought us the remake of diabolique my expectations fell pieces when learned all of these things the saw today did not even meet those expectations this is lousy incoherent mess would slam it harder if it were not for the nifty sets and the mere presence of all these fine lovable actors but sets are ultimately empty and the performances are completely uninspired that is the main problem the avengers for all it is hiphop flash and tidal waves none of it feels the least bit energetic or inspired it is like chore bland exercise in superhero making it also feels like its been cut pieces clocking in at minutes and forgetting close some of its own subplots this is just plain depressing the avengers is version of the popular television show frequent readers of mine will not be surprised learn that have never watched an episode was not alive then do not even watch television now am very sorry that do not have this perspective but judging from the reviews have already read knowing the tv show just makes matters worse did not know and love john steed and emma peel and therefore was not as upset see how these actors love have managed thrash their roles also doubt that familiarity the series would allow me understand more clearly the chain of events that do take place in this based on what the told me gather that steed fiennes is some kind of british super guy somewhat like james bond and that dr peel thurman is just really smart doctor who also happens know lot about weather and about beating people up while limited tight leather suits they are work together under mothers orders mother is played jolly jim broadbent while his coconspirator father is played the equallytalented fiona shaw it seems that there is man out there controlling the weather his name is de wynter connery he is crazy scottish guy our heroes had better stop him or else the weather will keep getting colder until they have go hell warm up one of the films few funny lines along the way there is subplot after subplot hinged sloppily together scenes that go nowhere feel perfunctory and ultimately make no sense for example our heroes are eventually attacked swarm of giant mechanical insects machineguns attached their torsos now killer bugs do not really go the weathercontrolling theme of the the purpose of the bugs other than annihilate our heroes is never established they are never even directly connected de wynter they are controlled his crazy henchman played eddie izzard the special effects are not bad but they are loud obnoxious and intrusive like so many scenes in the it seems present only keep your attention from waning and guarantee you it will wane stopped thinking about the story when realized it did not do any good think the avengers has clearly been chopped up and reassembled so many times that even the people involved could not tell us what happens there are several scenes in the preview that did not make the final cut in addition many of the sequences have irritating grainy quality makes it feel lowbudget the last scene is particularly bad the scenes that do not feature action should be electric thanks our wonderful cast they are not the action scenes should be electric because this is an action they are not either and what about this wasted cast oh it makes me weep disappointment we are talking ralph fiennes here one of the best actors working today one of the best actors ever love the guy have loved all his films until this one he seems like he wants understand the but he is as lost as we are and thurman in all of her spectacular beauty and talent cannot manage look at home here do not blame her completely for there is strange subplot involving her evil twin that is never explained in any way and it cannot be easy deal such terrible screenwriting connery however seems the most out of it totally lacking any kind of focus or interest for that matter who is blame is it the screenwriter don macpherson perhaps although can see shell of story here that could have been good superhero movie had it been handled right is it the actors for gods sake no these people clearly lost interest when they saw the inevitable path of destruction on this was travelling blame director jeremiah chechik who should not have been given the task begin his best benny joon is quirky in the same way that this one was supposed be but here it mostly seems like lot of failed attempts at wit and humor add that lack of experience in bigbudget action and you have the worst choice for director this side of james ivory if the avengers has saving grace it is the set design the sets stuart craig are big colorful and often pleasing look at like the final setpiece on de wynters island even if none of it makes bit of sense admired the overhead view of the stairs showing dr peel running around in circles and never getting anywhere also enjoyed michael kamens music score particularly in the opening credits but this stuff is routine good sets and music are nice but there is lot more that needs be here inspiration for instance would have been really nice maybe little bit of cohesion in the story or sense of purpose most of all though would have liked see these actors relish in their roles damn this movie for not giving them the chance

if snake eyes were dog you would put it sleep if it was couch you would put it out on the sidewalk where it would sit for week if it were your child you would be reading military school catalogs if it were ship no it would not be the titanic that would imply glamor and tragedy it would be the exxon valdez personal side note saw this movie on the road during houston business trip for whatever reason my hotels cable system was not showing the astrosbraves game featured randy johnsongreg maddux matchup this forced me pay full price for snake eyes instead of watching perfectly good baseball game for free so the invective deserved as it is should be seen in that perspective snake eyes is supposed be mystery movie and good mystery movies are supposed leave you asking yourself questions on the way out of theater snake eyes is not good mystery movie but had some questions where is the manager and how do get readmit pass if fall asleep on the drive home and wreck my rentacar can sue brian de palma is it too late for the academy revoke nicolas cages oscar will someone please am begging you give gary sinise role worthy of his talents and how exactly does cage end up wearing the exact same shirt and tie as sinise does the first and most glaringly wrong thing snake eyes is the trailer if you have seen the trailer without seeing the movie consider yourself fortunate the trailer is work of sheer genius it manages convey everything worthy of the movie the noteworthy steadicam work the exuberance of cages performance as thoroughly corrupt atlantic city policeman the essential elements of the marginal plot the expert craftsman who pieced together fairly good trailer out of snippets of wretched movie deserves praise and percentage of the gross is best trailer category at the oscars that farfetched after all but all it does is set us up for an overwhelmingly disappointing movie the trailer sets up what should have been promising plot detective ricky santoro cage must solve the mystery of who shot the secretary of defense at an atlantic city payperview boxing match unfortunately there are multiple problems afoot the trailer gives away much too much of the story the shooter is killed instantly so the story revolves around why the secretary was killed and who is involved in the conspiracy the films secret is hohum at best and anyone who has watched the trailer and is aware of the law of economy of characters can figure out who the top conspirator is without an interesting plot without interesting dialogue and without much of reason care about the characters or the story snake eyes is failure on almost every possible level as much as hated this movie must give brian de palma one tiny bit of credit de palma is maddeningly inconsistent he can on his day create amazingly welldone movies the untouchables carlitos way on offdays he can be well just horrid the bonfire of the vanities raising cain snake eyes falls into the horrid category but there are couple of moments that are worth seeing strictly for their filmschool degreeofdifficulty value the steadicam opening scene does good job of introducing the cage character and is virtuoso technical job both the director and the actor there is splitscreen chase scene that looks pretty good and it is followed gods eye view of bank of hotel rooms that is imaginitively done this is what is called giving the devil his due but the technical skill does not even come close making up for the sheer evil of this movie placing plot holes one side for moment snake eyes features easily the worst boxing match in cinema history george foreman is in better shape than the movie boxers hurricane that exists for no other reason than punctuate significant plotlines portentuous thunderclaps and perhaps the worst most overly drawn out ending in years snake eyes is criminal act an evil waste of time and talent cage sinise and yes even de palma deserve better the audience deserves better but no refund no readmit pass no free popcorn coupon can ever restore us the time we have spent or wash the awful images from our mind however we are left one consolation that we were warned the movies title because snake eyes is nothing more than roll of craps

writers dennis feldman and jonathan hensleigh based on the comic book chuck pfarrer starring jamie lee curtis william baldwin donald sutherland joanna pacula sherman augustus marshall bell cliff curtis julio oscar mechoso suppose am not extremely surprised that virus comes us from deciple of james cameron john bruno and if strain real hard could even say that it is an obvious given particuarly looking from the standpoint of mr camerons early works in fact virus is yet another in the long line of actionhorrorparanoia thrillers from the aliens vein group of people are dropped into mysterious situation only find mortallythreatening entity is out get them textbook example hailing all the way back the early talkies and maybe even the first pictures albeit redeveloped cameron in his blockbuster that earned him esteem and bigger budgets come in his future no such thing will happen bruno whom believe worked in some capacity on that quasilandmark feature while bruno may have studied under camerons wing for years and years am beginning wonder at what capacity and what exactly did he learn from him in fact virus should at least be mediocre the fact that bruno could have worked under man like cameron director who if anything just knows how make movie and then make like virus is just another detraction fairly aimed at this zgrade schlockfest of albeit zgrade schlockfest respectable budget the seems not only borrow it is plot from last years similarlyfated deep rising but also from clunkish bmovie from the called leviathan an underwater thriller starring peter weller richard crenna hector elizando and daniel stern about group of miners who stumble upon an alien lifeform that was part alien part john carpenters twisted remake of the thing virus again has similar uh selling point group of sailors on boat stumble upon russian cruiser that is dead in the water they get on they break up into pairs and investigate and they find an alien lifeform on board that comes in the form of energy has taken over all the machines on board have meshed the machines parts from corpses and have deemed humankind their enemy because of misquote in the dictionary ha ha not that any of this is for second scary or the least bit involving not only does this start off chintzy bondian opening the destruction of the cruiser via satellite transmission from mir destroying any of the suspense in what could happen but it also fails bring us any interesting chracters of its motley crew it only choses as its potentially eccentric cast of characters lead woman skipper masculine potentialromanticinterest drunken captain black technician tatooed aborigine manic russian survivor and couple other candidates for alien food none whom are the least bit interesting or more dimensional than thin plain piece of writing paper and it is not the traditional argument for films like these where you may in fact want them all be eaten even aliens played the karma of the arrogant soldiers but this was more of plusside for the as whole than the opposite instead as another cliche goes you just do not give damn almost do not even have say that the acting from everyone ranges from subpar horrific the former being jamie lee curtis in the lead showing off what strong female lead she is and she is just not really here and the latter being and it pains me say this as he is particular favorite of mine donald sutherland who plays the captain so poorly and without second of credibility that this will go down as the performanceofwhichheshouldbeashamed like anthony hopkins for legends of the fall the line scrooooooo em has been thus embroidered upon my membrance or peter otoole in caligula great actor horrific performance it happens every now and then and it only helps sutherlands career that no one except for an elite few even bothered see this though it has sat on the shelves of universal studios for about two years waiting until it can be released and make as much money as it possibly can read early january when everyones still trying catch up on the potential oscarnominees it does show that universal shelled out pretty penny make this it is laden complex machinery boasts respectable production design and it may even feature believable special effects if of course or anyone else could see them virus mostly takes place on large abandoned cruiser and mostly at night until the dawn and mostly without the use of lights not so much for the productivity of the alien creatures in their pursuit of their human prey but more so because as the cliche seems go if it is dark enough then the special effects will be more believable and if you do not believe me go back and rent godzilla and tell me if there is even one shot where we see godzilla either in his entirety in one wide shot or n the light so that we can at least see him well you do not really have sit through it again just take my word for it but all of this does not matter since virus is basically just one loud cluttered mess of movie the action scenes are muddled and as difficult follow as any action movie have ever seen my um favorite part was the scene where trio of them end up somehow on the outside of the ship during five minute bouillabaisse of tidal waves rain and any other oceanextremeties the can cook up then end up back in the ship when one of them is revealed have apparently drowned well must say thanks for telling me afterwards because sure could not figure it out when saw it imagine the first attack of the aliens in aliens shot from the pov of the soldiers and then the authorities in the battle car if it was all hard follow and done without any dramatic intensity and that is basically the whole of virus one horriblydirected action scene after the other capping it off proposterous gadget that saves the day and at least couple of the original cast members and my god it is long damn sit no interesting characters no dramatic urgency no tension not one good moment of action and no mesmerizing visuals it is wonder that it even got made we already know that big movie studios mentality is shallow at best and movies like out of sight and saving private ryan give you more faith in them but movies like virus manage drain little more out of the pool almost wish that instead of making this movie john bruno had gone cinema verite and captured the meetings universal heads when they gave this green light they read the script they knew they were entrusting millions upon millions of dollars into director who might have very well been cameron hack and he is and they still went ahead the project only have bruno and company shit back in their face even though hold universal in contempt for making this horrible movie would say even more contempt should be aimed at mr bruno for making movie that could be this bad in fact shouts of egad man what were you doing when you worked for cameron anyway are not only justifiable but encouraged

deuce bigalow rob schneider cleans fish tanks yeah did not know that was real job either one of his customers is antoine leconte oded fehr successful gigolo when antoine has go sweden for three weeks he lets deuce use his house look after an ailing fish fooling around deuce sets fire the kitchen and smashes fish tank after taking try at one of antoines clients and earning deuce decides prostitute himself raise the money replace the fish tank before the fierytempered antoine returns enter j eddie griffin pimp for manwhores who arranges for deuce service an assortment of women whose imperfections keep them from dating there is an enormous woman played transvestite porn star chi chi la rue who hides food in her clothes there is claire gail ogrady whose narcolepsy causes her fall asleep every few minutes tina torsten voges is so tall her face does not fit on the screen and ruth amy poehler has tourettes syndrome and shouts obscenities without warning finally there is kate arija bareikis whose sorority sisters secretly paid her fare she seems perfect and deuce quickly falls in love her she does we discover later have an imperfection but deuce decides it is not important deuces life is complicated bothersome cop william forsythe looking for information on antoine and kates discovery of his manwhoring however neither threat generates much suspense the formula is so familiar that we know how it will end from the start deuce bigalow is the first project from adam sandlers company happy madison the formation of assures that we will be seeing the sandler style of comedy massproduced at an increasing rate in years come be afraid be very afraid the good news is that sandler does not actually appear in deuce and that rob schneider and eddie griffin are funnier than sandler schneider has sweetness that makes the clueless but goodhearted deuce believable griffins delivery is deadon especially in the coining of technical terms for j profession as in do not make me hebitch manslap you there is the expected amount of toilet humor in deuce for one thing deuces dad is mens room attendant does anyone over the age of eight actually find bowel movements that funny for most of us think that childhood fascination bodily functions disappears when we hit the farside of puberty and discover how funny sex is for one will be glad when the toilet trend is finally flushed bottom line deuce does not offer anything new but it is intermittently funny

this is your definitive movie extremely predictable following the basic formula horrible ending overzealous writing meaning the writing was bad and seemed as if it were trying too hard make it exciting therefore making it look as if many things were merely tossed in there fill space and if tommy lee jones and his lovable wiseass character of we have seen before in the fugitive and quite frankly was not used enough here am afraid the would have been completely unbearable in this ashley judd plays women who is wrongfully convicted of killing her husband while out sailing for weekend while in jail she finds out that her husband really is alive and that he framed the murder on her over money how original while in jail she works out exercises and basically does her best get into near perfect condition now she has learned about law titled double jeopardy stating that if she serves her full sentence and get out she could kill her husband and the law could not touch her although there has been talk that this is not the way the actual law works now her po parole officer and bunch of cops are chasing after her and are conflicted whether or not believe her claims skipping over the acting the fact that judd is more of looker than an actress no offense she has been good simon birch and even very good great kiss the girls at times in the past and believe may have the potential be better but she is terribly unconvincing in this and her performance seems stale and unsatisfying does not really add the movie at all just takes away as would said jones was fine although he did not have much work he was much more of supporting character is fine and he handled it well especially considering the material he had work feel this had alot going for it originality not being an issue the acting was the only thing as said keeping it alive the plot seemed pretty intriguing and could have been as well if applied better the action scenes were well made however sometimes out of place was just left unsatisfied in the long run so basically some of the action may have been exciting but genuinely overthought the plot has certainly been done before generally speaking the movie moves way too fast for us get involved in either the characters or the plot and is basically that was almost saved tommy lee jones who if he had some more screentime could perhaps have earned the higher rating in my book anyway keep this in mind if you are in the mood for good action rent the fugitive

deadbang an action thriller starring don johnson lives up its dumb title or at least half of it although deadbang is definitely dead it is anything but bang in fact they should have called this one dead bore in the johnson plays you guessed it cop the role must have been really challenging for johnson since his character jerry beck is gritty los angeles homicide detective real stretch from the slick vice detective johnson portrayed on miami vice la mel gibson in lethal weapon beck is an emotional wreck complete violent outbursts unscrupulous police methods and bleak outlook on life becks wife has just divorced him and she is cutting him off from their children she will not even allow him wish them merry christmas telephone but becks family and emotional problems take back seat the action and thrills in deadbang beck is investigating the brutal murders of shopkeeper and cop his investigation starts in a and finally culminates and climaxes in oklahoma where he has violent showdown the killers at white supremacist camp virtually every aspect of deadbang is inept and ineffective the plot is incoherent and full of holes the movie depicts becks investigation so clumsily that you never see the connections between his clues and his conclusions the action sequences in deadbang are strictly thirdrate and the movie has absolutely no momentum or suspense certainly expected more from longtime director john frankenheimer who directed the classic political thriller the manchurian candidateas well as black sunday seven days in may and the french connection ii in all fairness frankenheimer however should note that most of deadbangs shortcomings seem stem from its shabby script rather than from the direction deadbang tries don mask of social relevance incorporating themes of racism and white supremacy but its efforts are nothing more than token gestures and nothing less than insulting according the movies production notes deadbang is based on the reallife experiences of stillactive detective jerry beck you would never guess this from watching deadbang however since the totally lacks credibility it is utterly unconvincing and unbelievable most of the characters in deadbang are either atrociously acted underdeveloped superfluous or all of the above william forsythe for example is painfully bad as arthur kressler wholesome bythebook fbi agent who is offended becks foul language and unorthodox methods forsythe is lame performance and corny dialogue makes his character unbearable deadbang marks the motion picture debut of tim reid wkrp in cincinnati and franks place but his talents are completely wasted in cliched and contrived role he plays the chief officer of squadron of black cops who help beck nail the villains the sole function of penelope ann millers character is give deadbang an excuse include gratuitous love scene between characters about whom you could not care less guess the films title refers this love scene since it is definitely dead bang the only real virtue of deadbang believe it or not is don johnson who tries overcome the limitations of the movies pitiful script johnson succeeds in giving his character sarcastic sense of humor and hint of depth and his pessimistic wisecracks occasionally bring the life and must admit that deadbang does have one or two amusing moments the funniest scene has johnson throwingup all over criminal as he interrogates him but when barf is the highlight of movie you know the movies in trouble the other amusing scene involves psychological examination of beck in he cannot keep straight face because the psychiatrist resembles woody allen but two funny scenes and couple good wisecracks do not movie make

it was once said that in order truly enjoy some of todays movies or novels you must suspend disbelief however there is distinct separation between opening your mind ridiculous situations and believing bunch of flat lies it came as no surprise me learn that huntingburg indiana where the is set does not have mcdonalds sears store statue of man on horse nor even dam close even if you can ignore these somewhat white lies even though the dam is crucial hard rains plot there is still bunch of things that just dont gel firstly morgan freeman possibly the greatest actor alive after such films as driving miss daisy the shawshank redemption and seen was cast as shifty goon intent on stealing enough money for healthy retirement he _should_ have played the town sheriff an experienced and somewhat intriguing policeman as massive flood started dam accident overwhelms huntingburg its residents presumably flee as the water level steadily increases say presumably simply because we never know what happened them and it seems tad strange that an entire town the exception of some folk who get introduced along the way can vanish before the flood has actually started but nether the less armored guard couriers tom christian slater and his uncle are carrying three million dollars in the back of their van heavy rainstorm causing depressing conditions and slippery roads it doesnt take long for the van end up stuck amongst mud and water off the side of the road jim morgan freeman and small gang of thieves locate the van and attempt steal the three million dollars but of course tom is more than willing save the day so he takes the money and hides it elsewhere in town the local sheriff randy quaid whom most will remember as the drunken pilot in id and couple of police men investigate the situation but their morals are soon overpowered greediness as each character contemplates what heshe would do their share of the three million dollars director mikael salomon has made sure that hard rain ends up turning everything topsyturvy and whilst the may at first appear be definite goodies versus baddies there are numerous twists in its plot that make this slightly more enjoyable experience but the time these interesting changes occur its far too late in the for them have much affect hard rains continuos corniness and lack of originality washes out whatever hope the script may have had and although its cast is somewhat appealing most of its stars act well below par not at one stage capturing what could have been fabulous on screen battle between slater and freeman we are left reminisce on films that dared do something different and achieved more than what was expected such titles as broken arrow slater and john travolta and faceoff nicholas cage and john travolta come mind as films that have mastered silver screen confrontations strangely enough they were both directed john woo and both star john travolta we can forgive morgan freeman for giving slightly disappointing performance since he is newish the action genre but christian slater could have achieved so much more had the amount of crummy one liners been reduced and some personality added his character if you had asked me whether slater could perform well enough substantially boost movie prior the release of broken arrow my answer would have been definite no now know that he has no excuse and _can_ do better if you dont believe me rent copy of broken arrow from your local video store although hard rain never really works from the start somehow felt feelings of missed opportunity when the credits filled the screen the addition of an enticing subplot would have given the time breathe rather than try cram minutes of action and disaster into story that cant handle anything else despite the fact that hard rain fails on almost every account if your standards are low enough you may find this be mildly enjoyable no creative flair and no inventive scenes means that hard rain does not stand up well against its many competitors but it doesnt really matter since the last thing you would want do after shelling about is compare this other films

some houses are born bad goes the hauntings tag line must add some movies too nothing short of hiring new cast more literate screenwriter and new director could have saved this tragically misguided adaptation of jacksons meritorious novel the haunting is late entry summer dreck too slick be creepy and its seemingly endless stream of digital trickery and spooky ooky sound effects do not frighten so much as numb the audience into submissionthe is like rube goldberg contraption rigged shout boo fragile nell taylor bisexual theo zetajones and smiley luke wilson are three insomniacs who gather at the reputedly possessed hill house for an extended study on sleep disorders hosted professor marrow neeson marrows secretly gathering data on their respective paranoid responses his recount of hill houses bleak history he is not prepared for the very real apparitions that terrorize the crew nell especially who has some ancestral connection the manors previous inhabitants taylor is thoroughly insufferable in her first bigbudget lead for starters her consistently dour expression sucks the life out of even the early scenes when we are introduced the mansion and all its funhouse trappings her character is supposed be depressed having tended an unloving mother for too many years but taylor plays nell as supernaturally lame alternately grouchy mopey wiggy and pathetic and kept wondering why the other characters did not just ditch this bitch as for the obscenely photogenic zetajones she breezes through her scenes wink and smile and takes the scenery her unfortunately she is saddled some of the most unlikely dialogue the screenplay has offer theos assessment of the house love it sort of charles foster kane meets the munsters who on earth would say that in place of citizen kane meets the munsters furthermore would you gladly spend single night in house befitting that description both actresses fare better than neeson who looks embarrassed be part of this ensemble and for good reason and his character is the most bland as luke puts it dr marrow pulls the old academic bait and switch on his subjects but he breaks down and confesses this the second he is accused later he risks his life climbing crumbling stairwell save nell it is amusing hear neeson shout nell repeatedly given his starring role in the jodie foster vehicle of the same name why was this nice helpful and redemptive researcher so absent of ethics at the start the haunting was well designed eugenio zanetti his sets are obsessively detailed and even before the cgi kicks in they seem alive never quite still do have one beef this aspect of the production the real life mansion used in exterior shots nottinghamshires harlaxton manor is so vast that one has trouble believing that nell and company no matter how much running away they do from ghosts and goblins always finish up in locations that were established in act one as if all the action has been confined one wing of hill house eighty million dollars was spent on the haunting and despite powerhouse box office debut doubt it will recoup its costs including marketing domestically thank jan de bont for that proving for the third time that speed was fluke in that it was actually enjoyable de bont has served up another ride sans thrill his images welllit though they are have an unmistakable been theredone that quality in fact whole sequences not mention the cloaked airy ghoul who owns the climax feel lifted from much smarter and infinitely more enjoyable spectacle from three summers back peter jacksons the frighteners do not mean suggest de bont is plagiarist mean suggest that he is hack having found no new ways give us chills

play it the bone is punchdrunk mess of movie containing good cast but awful acting an interesting premise but terrible execution ron shelton white men cannot jump gives us rocky story not one rocky but two rocky no is vince boudreau woody harrelson edtv bald tattooed newly converted christian whose idea of christianity is not using the name of christ as curse word something that he has not yet successfully achieved rocky no is caesar dominguez antonio banderas the th warrior best friend of vince who is currently dating vinces exgirlfriend grace both men are nearing the end of their almost careers when fluke provides them redemptive opportunity when both fighters of the undercard of vegas based mike tyson title fight become incapacitated the fight promoters need find quick replacement our boys are tapped fight each other the winner of is promised shot at future title fight the is divided into two sections at first we have buddy road picture as our two heroes in graces sassy grassy green muscle car travel through the desert vegas in order make the fight scheduled for that day along the way we learn about their pasts and the opportunities that have come and gone once in vegas the movie settles down the effectively staged fight sequences between vince and caesar both mr harrelson and mr banderas have provided us stunning characterizations in the past not that we would know it from their work here mr harrelson is uncomfortably awkward apparently never having gotten firm handle on vince the christian conversion angle simply falls flat and unbelievable mr banderas is uncharacteristically noncharismatic as caesar weak and ineffectual there is little life in his screen performance the other actors involved merely play stereotypes of one sort or another tom sizemore saving private ryan robert wagner austin powers ii the spy who shagged me and richard masur fire down below are crooked promoters lucy liu payback is sexstarved hitchhiker looking for good time and lolita davidovich gods and monsters is the shared girlfriend who cannot make her mind up boxer she prefers because of the weak characters and the lack of screen chemistry between them the flounders all the appeal of dead fish until the boxing match actually begins but even then because the outcome is so predictably obvious the suspense factor is negated and we are relegated just watching two men pummel each other writerdirector ron shelton clearly spent much time orchestrating the fight sequence as it is well photographed wellchoreographed welledited and wellperformed if only some of that same detailed attention had been diverted the remaining parts of the as it is the scenes require the characters actually talk one another are weak and laughable the title is actually the most interesting aspect of the the phrase play it the bone is reference seeing something all the way through or not quitting until you have achieved your desired goal that is biblical principle know ye not that they run in race run all but one receiveth the prize so run that ye may obtain corinthians kjv achieving anything worthy in life requires playing it the bone we need develop fully persuaded mindsets and commitment levels in order endure and persevere past the obstacles and distractions lay between us and our stated objectives this is true in practical matters of our physical lives as well as the in the developing maturity of our spiritual lives as movie play it the bone is hardly worth our time but as principle of life the phrase play it the bone are words live

i have no real tangible proof of this but swear that there are lot of producers in who adamantly believe that if you take bad script written bad writer and give the project it an equally bad director then it is actually possible make good movie using their logic all that really needs be done change the bad movie into good movie is cast bunch of superfamous actors and provide an almost unlimited production budget this is the only way can fathom how th century fox hired jon amiel in order direct this eighty million dollar waste of my time not counting the time it took me get and from the theatre now before continue ferociously attack what is wrong this just want point out that one of the reasons it fails so miserably is because it does have the potential be an exciting thriller catherine zetajones plays virginia baker an insurance investigator tracking down an infamous art thief named robert macdougal sean connery if you have ever seen any blockbuster before really do not have spend too much time on frivolous plot details the two team up for various jobs stealing various things for various purposes the problem we come is that we have all seen this few billion times
