before and this does not break any new ground in the bigbudgethollywoodaction genre the result is that the entire production feels contrived am going be completely honest here pretty much the only thing keeping me awake throughout the runtime was looking at catherine zetajones now while this may be compliment for ms zetajones it certainly is not for either the writers or the director who are not nearly as clever as they think they are just about the most profound thought they can inject into this is when they have macdougal lecture baker on the semantic difference between entrapment and blackmail an eighty million dollar budget you would think that entrapment would at least feature edgeofyour seat action scenes or breathtaking special fx well you would be wrong the action that is present in this takes place in huge skyscraper and is relatively unspectacular unfortunately for all those involved entrapment die hard narrowly beat it the screen years the reality is that after minutes of watching this picture you know exactly what is going happen despite rather pathetic attempts in the screenplay throw in plot twists many scenes seem exist merely as reason outfit zetajones in extremely tightfitting clothing one particular scene features baker crawling around trying avoid laserbeams while she tries steal an ancient chinese mask nothing wrong that but she entered the room from the floor and knew exactly where the mask was so why did not she and macdougal tunnel in directly under the mask instead of the other side of the room will tell you why because it is great excuse photograph zetajones posterior as it slides underneath those beams and it also allows second scene of the exact same thing the rehearsal ving rhames also makes an appearance in this movie and though he has great screen presence although so do connery and zetajones and the most interesting character in the not even he can rescue this from the depths of the boring abyss concept invented just describe this picture one last complaint entrapment is littered of instances where macdougal will just slip into shadow or behind building or he becomes obstructed moving vehicle and then in the next shot he will spontaneously disappear in ninjalike fashion can picture amiel patting himself on the back thinking himself it will leave the audience wondering for days how did he do that we know jon it is called editing

when originally saw the trailer for analyze this few months ago must admit thought it looked kind of lame and then when the commercials started popping up week or two ago thought it looked outright bad but then when analyze this finally opened few days ago an odd thing happened it got great reviews critics were proclaiming it hilarious and deadon parody of mob movies well praise like that figured it must be good and so headed off the theater you know that expression that says always trust your gut instincts well turns out that expression is more valid than ever gave it credit for analyze this is slow unfunny and badly acted do not get me wrong think that deniro is one of the top ten greatest actors of the century but he is just out of his league here think the problem is he did not quite know how approach this material he plays his character mob boss paull vitti somewhere in between the realm of comedy and drama if he had played the character straight along the lines of leslie nielson in the naked gun series he probably would have been lot more successful as it is though he plays the character completely serious at some moments and for laughs at others this does not work it creates an uneven character that never breaks out of the deniro mold you always know it is him and the movie is badly paced too it never takes off it just crawls from one scene another without any forward momentum think the blame for this should be placed on the script it is obvious the writer had good idea for movie mob boss faces breakdown and needs the services of psychiatrist but once this is established the movie does not really go anywhere the formula of the seems be this billy crystal says no deniro deniro forces him and much wackiness ensues this formula of sorts is repeated several times throughout the movie have said it before and will say it again the only thing that matters me in comedy is whether or not it is funny if analyze this had been funny the pacing and bad acting would not have bothered me would have been too busy laughing notice but as it is only chuckled few times the only really funny scene is deadon parody of the godfather sadly though do not think anyone in the audience saw it realized it was parody because was the only one laughing but my sense of humour have come realize is vastly different from the general population loathed there is something about mary yet loved baseketball now if you want movie that think is funny go out and see office space it is full of genuine laughs and will not leave you glancing at your watch every minutes as analyze this did

jeanclaude van damme movies tend be if nothing else lot of mindless fun his latest knock off skips on the fun part leaving wildly incoherent exercise that is well simply mindless you cannot really blame van damme no one suspect has ever expected the muscles from brussels contribute heartfelt performance brimming introspection and delicate shades of gray and even his sidekick costar saturday night live alumnus rob makin copies schneider does what is expected of him although neither appear want the role of straight man no the problem the is its direction the first five minutes of the are incomprehensible and it goes downhill from there five hundred characters it seems are introduced within the first fifteen minutes van damme does not land his first kick until after thirtytoo late for most action fansand the time the hour mark has rolled around your jaw will be on your cup holder and you will be wondering why you elected spend seven dollars on this mess director hark tsui whose previous was the van dammedennis rodman teamed double team films at such frenetic pace that it is hard know what is going on who is on whose side and what the point of all this is faster than you can yell fruit stand we are watching crazed rickshaw race schneider being bounced along an energetic van damme when schneider starts whacking van damme in the behind fourfoot eel while enthusing move your beautiful big ass the movie takes an unprecedented turn the bizarre every now and again knock off will deliver some truly ingenious directorial flourishesinventive camera shots and angles wild rides down gun silencers and from the tops of buildings the sprawling street below revealing cutins within the framebut they all happen too quickly and within such furious frame of reference that they are wasted if only hark could have slowed things down just for minute if you are interested in the plot you are better off reading capsule review than trying extract any meaning from the onscreen shenanigans jeanclaude van damme plays shady bluejeans manufacturer who uncovers russian mafia plot terrorize the world nanobombs hidden in cabbage patch knockoffs maybe paul sorvino more accurate summary would be jeanclaude van damme bums around hong kong failing avoid large blatant cocacola product placements the fact that the is staged during hong kongs last days under british rule gets some lip service but does not figure in at all perhaps knock off most intriguing credit is that ron and russell mael composed the frenzied music score some of you might remember the mael brothers as the synth pop duo sparks their contributions here are as confused as the accompanying action kimono my house indeed like the cheap jeans and pumma sneakers manufactured in hong kong van dammes latest is real phony

in twilight exalcoholic excop exhusband exprivateeye harry ross paul newman works for pair of aging actors catherine susan sarandon and jack ames gene hackman jack is being blackmailed and he asks harry deliver the payoff instead of the blackmailers harry finds dying excop emmet walsh as more bodies begin pile up harry realizes that he will have solve the disappearance of catherines first husband twenty years earlier find out who is willing kill keep that secret buried newman sarandon hackman an alist cast of oscar laureates like that twilight would seem very promising however the script is tired and predictable it would serve well as tvmovieoftheweek possibly some detective hero reprising his role the appeal of the project for its stars and its director robert benton is nostalgia twilight wants very much be s noir alan ladd or dick powell all of the standard tropes are here hardboiled i among the rich and beautiful whose glamour hides sinister secrets femme fatale who tempts and confounds the hero shadowy figures shooting from doorways dead bodies confronting the hero at every turn cops dogging his path and interfering his investigation the script offers little originality and coauthors benton and richard russo seem unaware that what was original in is clich in elmer bernsteins score is hauntingly melodic and could have been drawn notefornote from vintage noir the lead actors try hardnone of the three has every made less than full effort even when burdened bad script they try invest every line and gesture meaning and they create convincing sense of the relationships between the main characters harry is fond of jack but is in love catherine jack is dying of cancer and is jealous of harrys love for catherine catherine teases harry and enjoys his attention but her real feelings are hidden beneath carefullymaintained veneer twilight wants be characterdriven like nobodys fool also directed benton also starring newman based on novel russo was but the tired script gives the actors too little work twilight also squanders fine supporting cast stockard channing harrys friend on the police force reese witherspoon jack catherines bratty kid giancarlo esposito the humorous sidekick john spencer harrys nemesis on the force liev schreiber and margo martindale the blackmailers and james garner cop who bailed movie stars out of trouble

there was probably good reason that the warner bros studio chose not allow critics view this steven seagal when it first opened and after seeing this piece of toxic waste now know why this movie is far the worst offering that has hit the screen since possibly those ernest movies years ago fire down below centers its story on little mining town in gods country somewhere in eastern kentucky it is beauty and natural goodness is being slowly destroyed an uncaring mining magnate kris kristopherson who constantly looks like he wants kill his agent for getting him this role it turns out that he is filling the mines throughout kentucky toxic waste for tidy profit seagal plays jack taggert an aikidoversed fighting machine who is an agent the epa no not the cia nor the fbi nor the nsa it is the environmental protection agency had no idea that epa agents were trained be killers taggert is sent find the perpetrators and bring them justice written someone named jeb could already envision the stereotypes of incestuous relationships banjopicking preachers and dumbasnails rednecks but the script puts seagal right smack dab in the middle of all of these scenarios as he tries discreetly fit in seagals idea of disguise is longlength leather jacket but get closer the kinfolk he will fix peoples porches for free that is another great epa asset teaching agents how fix porches slow and plodding this project is total mess the sometimes allure of watching seagal is watching him outmaneuver enemies that outnumber and outgun him like in under seige here his bravado basically turns into bullyness townsfolk who are foolish enough challenge seagal are quickly subdued fight scenes are quick and senseless and offers no enjoyment value whatsoever and his soap box message wears thin within the first minutes the most annoying moment comes when he barges into the middle of sunday church ceremony gets behind the pulpit and beseeches the townsfolk take control of their lives and help clean up the environment but the epitome of how moralistically mushy this gets happens when the person responsible for the toxic dumping kristopherson meets up seagal kristopherson asks seagal how much it will take for him go away seagal gallantly replies will leave when you take the poison from the streams and the earth was expecting patriotic music start blasting and show of fireworks in the background this is truly nothing more than pompous showcase for seagals righteousness and narcissistic arrogance seagal has been vanguard in trying bring new genre into the filmplace that of the envirothriller on deadly ground however the message will never come across through poorly developed vehicles like this still believe in preserving mother earth so save your and please donate it instead some worthy environmentally conscious charity

tom dicillo directs this superficial comedy about superficial people in superficial careers all searching for deeper meaning however they will not find much meaning in the real blonde and not enough real humor either joe matthew modine is struggling actor or he claims be one even though he has no credits under his belt his girlfriend mary catherine keener has no pretensions about her career she is makeup artist working for the eccentric fashion photographer blair marlo thomas and supermodel of the month sahara bridgette wilson sahara who has acquired new age spirituality from repeated viewing of the little mermaid has an onagain offagain relationship joes best friend bob maxwell caulfield however bob has gotten his biggest break yet starring role on soap opera opposite the beautiful kelly daryl hannah who may be that illusive woman he is always pursued real blonde there are some moments of good humor in the real blonde but not enough the best stuff is in throwaway details in the background such as saharas perfume ads depression it is not just state of mind but find humor in the superficiality of models and actors is shoot fish in barrel and unfortunately the films forays outside the realm of comedy are pathetic take for example the films framing device of an old lady and her dog the story serves absolutely no purpose makes little sense and is completely tangential the main plotlines of the movie matthew modine and catherine keener have the most sympathetic characters in the but they are stuck in the most boring plotlines modine whines and complains and would be completely pathetic if he was matched against someone stronger than elizabeth berkley who appears as another struggling actor keeners character has stronger edge but the insult selfdefense class taught denis leary no less she is stuck in makes little sense the movies running time is under two hours but it seems like it is well over it there is just not enough humor speed things along and not enough meaning propel any drama

the ads for batman and robin scream the event of the summer is here and that is the problem the producers were apparently so intent on creating spectacle that they forgot put an actual movie inside of it batman and robin is minutes of lavish sets flashy costumes and big confusing fight scenes barely hint of substance it is like one of those cheesy kings island stage shows bright busy and visually diverting but not very much fun it was not always this way tim burtons batman was an epic story of obsession and duality of darkness and revenge the while far from perfect was striking mood piece an otherworldly feel batman was creepy brooding creature of the night the joker brilliantly overplayed jack nicholson was at once charismatic and repellent batman and the joker were opposite sides of the same coin battling inner demons and one another over gotham citys breathtaking gothic skyline those days of the dark knight are gone replaced psychedelic ice capades run amuck batman and robin has far more in common the campy batman tv show than tim burtons tale of darkness the blame lies director joel schumacher former windowdresser schumacher is adept at decorating sets and dressing people in exotic costumes unfortunately when it comes time have those people walk and talk he has not the faintest notion of what do batman and robin is overstuffed intricately choreographed fight scenes so poorly edited that it is often difficult tell who is whacking who while the characters flail at each other oneliners and bad puns are tossed about like confetti few carefully placed jokes can set an action movie sailing but too many wisecracks can undermine the momentum of batman and robin does not merely lose momentum it stalls out completely on several occasions it is rare see an action flick as sluggish as this one ironically the parts of batman and robin that work are the ones showing the characters in street clothing and most of those succeed because of george clooney as bruce wayne easily the best batman yet clooneys expressive eyes and weary smile gives the character sense of depth that the script does not even hint at the films most effective scene is tender quiet exchange between clooney and alfred michael gough bruce waynes butler and surrogate father as for the other heroes chris odonnells robin is enthusiastic perky and horny as hell while pudgy alicia silverstone is hard accept as an athlete in her debut as batgirl in movie filled the brim major characters the decision add the entirely unnecessary batgirl and elle macpherson as bruce waynes girlfriend is puzzling suspect the producers inserted the women in an attempt convince audiences that two guys who run around in rubber suits builtin nipples shapely buttocks and huge codpieces are actually straight of course the real stars of batman are the villains and that is where batman and robin really suffers as mr freeze arnold schwarzenegger gives his worst performance in years spitting out stream of lame catch phrases in wooden fashion laboring under ton of appliances schwarzenegger looks as if he is having trouble even moving in his suit let alone trying act uma thurman fares somewhat better as poison ivy she overacts terribly in the early establishing scenes of her character it is apparently rule in the batman series that before person becomes villain she must be cartoonish bumbling nerd once thurman transforms into the ecopsychotic poison ivy she does nice mae west impersonation as classic vamp who can seduce men her breath and kill them kiss thurman fails maintain the characters maniacal sense of style though and ends up merely sputtering her way through the latter scenes of the the biggest lesson be learned from batman and robin is that more is not better joel schumacher fills the screen eye candy but the technicolor overkill merely emphasizes what trifle the really is some critics suggest that the batman series has run out of steam do not think so my prescription fire joel schumacher but offer him ticket rubber fetishists convention so he will understand that there is no hard feelings give alicia silverstone her walking papers while keeping clooney odonnell and michael gough call jack nicholson and michelle pfieffer and beg them reprise their roles as the joker and catwoman then ditch the campiness and for the love of pete lose the event mentality and make movie instead of spectacle next time

gordy is not movie it is minutelong sesame street skit and very bad one at that this movie is so stupid and dumb that it is depressing think that some executives actually gave this the green light and even more surprising is the fact that this is disney movie am sure children are the target audience of this movie but only kids under the age of five may be able tolerate it it is the story of farm piglet named gordy voiced garms whose family has been taken away up north we know means death of course we can hear the animals talk each other and they actually went the trouble of attempting sync the voices their mouths but it comes out terrible actually it is almost funny in way the only remotely interesting and likable character soon appears little girl named jinnie sue macallister young who sees gordy on the back of truck and essentially steals him jinnie is country singer and the goes off on huge tangent show her little concert and the people dancing it what is the point of this maybe she is one of the producers relatives and they wanted show her on camera promote her or something we then cut huge social gathering and drop in on another young kid named hank royce roescher who is sad because his divorced mother is dating he leaves the party and meets jinnie sue but he accidentally falls in pool probably because he was sitting on the diving board suit on nah did not see that one coming starts drown and is miraculously saved as gordy pushes an inflatable float over him and saves him if this had not been insanely stupid already the story quickly changes when jinnie gives gordy hank who then ends up becoming the ceo of food processing corporation when hanks grandfather the original ceo dies and leaves his fortune hank and gordy of course there must be villain but even this villain donadio as sipes is not that evil he never raises his voice or becomes angry and of course he has the typical idiot goons kidnap gordy but this is just so beyond stupid and cartoony we are constantly two steps ahead of the story it is hard tell whether the overall corniness and cheesiness the movie is intentional because it is family or if the filmmakers are just this untalented and stupid at times gordy is tolerable watch thus earning it one star and not the dreaded but it is just so unbelievably boring cliche dumb unfunny corny and just plain bad it may scare children it certainly disturbed me see also babe

senseless marlon wayans is very talented physical comedian and it is that gift that brings senseless moments of life alas moments are simply that moments are not enough lift this fantasycomedy above its onejoke premise granted that one joke is initially amusing when wayanss darryl witherspoon an economics major at stratford university hits some dire financial straits he becomes guinea pig for experimental drug that heightens all five senses after some initial side effects and problems controlling his superhuman senses darryl learns enjoy the benefits of his abilities and uses them land position at highly esteemed corporate firm at this point the sounds more like senseful than senseless but through some turns of the plot darryl finds himself only able use four of his five senses at once essentially leaving himyessenseless this sets up some showcase moments for wayanss gift for physical comedy especially when darryl loses his sense of feeling and his body goes completely hilariously limp but these gags and the gag behind the entire movie quickly grows stale once darryl is shown without the use of all of the senses instead of exploring any new comic territory director penelope spheeris and screenwriters greg erb and craig mazin take the easy way out and simply recycle each form of senselessness wayans approaches each goround gusto but this point he is simply treading water for the rest of the films unfunny duration senseless would not be as problematic as it is if it did not strive be anything more than comic trifle however the raucous and often raunchy comedy is wrapped in blanket of bogus sincerity darryl goes through the experiment in order help his cashstrapped family and this serious angle seems come from an entirely different movie unlike wayanss last starring vehicle the surprisingly effective and serious the th man the emotional content of senseless is forced and unconvincing any attempt at anything more substantial than broad comedy fizzlesdarryls romance janice tamara taylor young woman who yearns for man who is true himself does not generate sparks of any kind once his wb television sitcom the wayans bros comes an end the genuinely funny marlon wayans has promising bigscreen future ahead of him but if he continues associate himself projects as flat as senseless his career could go the way of his oncepromising older brother damon who is now set make his comebackon television

a slight romantic comedy feminist bent but one no edge it it turns out be conventional filled the usual clich and stock characters of this genre though it is wellwritten and wellacted fluff piece it still does not have too much say that is surprising it is made for the gentle arthouse set those who do not want something too disturbing think about it is about critically successful writer husband alec pryce who is so selfabsorbed that he is threatened his department store floorwalking model wife kate bouquet who wants be writer she meets his crass publisher vanni corso walken another selfabsorbed man and predictable relationship occurs the fireworks occur because she outgrows her husbands first impressions of her as someone who was impressed his genius and worships at his feet she now wants her own identity and her independence the looked like the usual sitcom stuff and is plagued the cheap set design features reserved for tv movie the sagged in the middle of the story from the weight of its tedium and eventually landed on its rear end its unspectacular climax it is set in london and it opens as model kate rebuffs sexual advances wealthy american shopper vanni she later meets him as her hubbys new upstart publisher who seeks have her intellectual author husband in his stable in order give him credibility as publisher of quality and he quickly wins favor her publishing her vanity novel alec who is an obnoxious grouse someone whom it seems it would be impossible live tries do everything stop his wife from having her book publishedwhich only pushes her into the grasping arms of vanni the publisher is proud that he is mammas boy who never married and is selfmade man who has earned millions he has recently acquired failing old london publishing house and plans revitalize it as he proudly tells kate if my father could sell pizzas in harlem could sell culture in europe the only thing that could not be sold is this stiff story and tired plot line the mystery me is how the lovely kate could like either man unless she was an insensitive dummy she soon divorces the beleaguered alec and marries the soontobecomebeleaguered vanni when she writes second novel he rebuffs her the same way her first hubby did it ends the same results that happened hubby number one as its story of ambition and lust winds down in whimper business affair was loosely based on the reallife literary and romantic travails of married authors barbara skelton and cyril connolly in their celebrated love triangle

if you are the kind of person who goes see movies just because you long for some of that overpriced theatre popcorn butter optional then this is the movie for you indeed this has got be either one of the most unimaginative ripoffs of other recent action movies or an incredibly unfunny spoof of them it is difficult fathom such insipidness unless you actually watch this but at least we are warned very quickly that we may regret our ticket purchase giving us an opportunity sneak on out and into the adjacent show what are the four ingredients of really bad action movie first the movie gives us an introductory premise huge caverns exist deep beneath the ocean floor and in this area many ships have disappeared oooh scary secondly cheesy soundtrack tries connote tone of mystery but only succeeds in drowning our ears an abrasive musical score third the main character is mercenary that delivers goods without asking about the contents of his cargo treat williams he operates sophisticated militarystyle pt boat and every word that comes out of his mouth is awash in comical flippancy finally in the cargo hold we see those that hired him they are also mercenaries that have toughlooking haircuts talk accents and try show how macho they are during their trip across the stormy sea their boat suffers an incident and requires repairs spotting cruise ship in the distance they make their way the ocean liner and devise plan raid the machine shop take the parts that they need and then continue on their merry way little do they know that this cruise ship has become infested some kind of ocean monster yet they board the ship armed the hilt grenades and machine guns that can kill dozens in matter of seconds this is nothing more than bythebook action their realization of the situation that they are in does not happen until they are in the bowels of the boat those who are dumb enough stray off on their own will ultimately get killed the corridors on the ship are narrow misty and provide the kind of atmosphere that all scarefests must have yet despite the predictable nature of this there are some scary boo moments but most of it is just outright silly and this is unusually gory too monsters basically suck off the flesh and spit out skeletal remains there is one particularly neat scene where monster has been cut apart and reveals victim that is still alive he screams horribly as the monsters digestive juices continue slowly eat him away additionally it borrows heavily from speed alien and bunch of other recent films the mercenaries even run into lone surviving passenger femke jannsen who looks amazingly like sandra bullock be honest when left the theatre just had laugh at how witless the was it is moronic fun at best so if you are hankering for large bucket of popcorn served side of silliness then this might just hit the spot

synopsis when meteorite crashlands in the arizona desert community college professors ira kane duchovny and harry block jones are first on the scene they discover that an alien lifeform has arisen from the rock and is evolving at an amazing rate soon the army advised dr allison reed moore moves in and forces kane and block out but when the aliens begin menace society it may take the scientists combined efforts stop them before they terminate the evolution of another lifeform humanity review evolution certainly has the ingredients for decent comedy it is directed reitman clearly trying parlay his ghostbusters success into twentyfirstcentury counterpart it stars duchovny and although one might question his judgment in lampooning his xfiles character so soon after leaving the tv series it should certainly provide him plenty of ammunition and then there is moore who may not have much prior experience in comedy but who has certainly proven her ability as an actress shame then that it all deteriorates into such hopelessly unfunny morass evolution is movie more concerned its special effects are quite good than anything resembling consistently funny script it has its moments scene in jones body is invaded an alien is particularly entertaining but there are embarrassingly long stretches that are utterly devoid of humour moore is totally wasted her clumsy shtick getting very old very fast duchovny has stunningly little in the way of material work and the story is so formulaic it could have been written monkeys part of what made ghostbusters so wonderful was combination of great script and characters the audience could root for evolution is so mindnumbingly tedious that it is difficult not start cheering for the aliens

deceiver is plot twist in search of movie this overly constructed succeeds in having many surprises and being true its title being deceptive but there is little in the that is worthy of deceit braxton chris penn and kennesaw michael rooker are two cops investigating the brutal murder of prostitute renee zellweger their lone suspect is wayland tim roth wealthy young man whose phone number was found in the hookers pocket however routine lie detector test turns against the investigators as the crafty wayland somehow turns the tables braxton and kennesaw are forced confront their own troubled lives braxton is gambling addict in deep mook ellen burstyn local bookie kennesaw is bitter about his marriage socialite rosanna arquette believing his wife be unfaithful the plot is twisty and complex lots of lengthy flashbacks and plenty of surprises however there are times when it is needlessly complex and at least one instance the storytelling turns so muddled that the answers important plot points actually get lost take look at a confidential or the films more likely inspiration the usual suspects for how complex plot can properly be handled the dialogue in deceiver is as overcrafted as the plot for example the tells few substories such as the tale of woeful absinthe bender or an alternative telling of how van gogh lost his ear but they are so flat and so plastic that they come off as prefabricated and unbelievable there is never the sense that these are real characters engaging in conversation they appear be nothing more than words on screenplay the characters themselves are rather pathetic and despicable not one of them is an ounce sympathetic and as result the labyrinthine plot is all for naught what does it matter who is guilty of what and why writerdirectors josh and jonas pate seem desire emulate the coen brothers masterwork blood simple or the wachowski brothers less worthy bound but while they have got the plot twists down cold they need work on characterization and dialogue

this is the kind of movie that makes one appreciate disneys live action george of the jungle tarzan and the lost city the latest attempt bring edgar rice burroughs legendary hero the big screen is one of the most inept and illtimed of any tarzan adventure so far badly conceived and poorly executed tarzan and the lost city appears headed for quick trip video store shelves have no idea why the producers chose now bring back tarzan it is not as if there are legions of new fans clamoring for his next movie furthermore it is even more curious that this is rated pg definition rules out any sex or explicit violence and while am not advocating the excesses embraced the bo derek version of the story tarzan deserves slightly more adult approach than the one used in the embarrassing production of course no tweaking of the content change the rating could have saved tarzan and the lost city since the films troubles originated the script and were propagated all the way down the line imagine george of the jungle stripped of all intentional humor and you have fair idea of what this tarzan is like its uninspired action and tepid adventure sequences the barely registers pulse anyone in search of relatively entertaining family jungle adventure should check out the version of the jungle book uses the same basic elements much better effect the only worthwhile element of tarzan and the lost city is the pretty scenery unfortunately includes the two lead actors the does not attempt retell the origin story the thinking is that it has been done often enough instead tarzan and the lost city introduces us lord graystoke k john clayton k tarzan the ape man casper van dien several days before his marriage lady jane porter jane march he is living happily in england enjoying the benefits of being landowning noble meanwhile in central africa the dastardly nigel ravens steven waddington selfproclaimed scholar and explorer believes he has found the way the lost city of opar he calls the cradle of civilization on the way there he and his band of mercenaries do all sorts of nasty things like burning native villages earn the wrath of the locals one shaman determined stop ravens from unearthing opal sends mystical message tarzan for help lady jane following close behind he returns the jungle where he was born its patently obvious that casper van dien one of the prettyboy heroes of starship troopers was not hired on the basis of his acting ability his plastic facial expressions monotone voice and complete inability make convincing animal noises his range rivals that of steven seagal his pecs however are impressive and director carl schenkel makes sure that he is given every opportunity show them off jane march on the other hand has keep her shirt on may be first for her some six years ago march give solid performance in jean jacques annauds steamy the lover since then she made the careerkilling decision of appearing opposite bruce willis in the color of night exploited her every acting defiency tarzan continues this trend march may be attractive but at least judging this performance she cannot act meanwhile steven waddington has serious trouble summoning up the menace necessary be really detestable bad guy instead he turns out be little more than nuisance the story line is pure formula has largely been true throughout the years for almost all of the tarzan movies the problem is that this one seems so childish and lifeless the romantic elements are all contrived in fact lady janes presence is necessary only so she can be captured and subsequently rescued her buff fiance the special effects are truly bottomofthebarrel including some laughably bad men in ape costumes apparently animatronics were too expensive for this production and of course as all jungle movies there are the obligatory cute animals over the years the legend of tarzan has been one of the most popular sources for series material the most famous ape man was johnny weismuller but no less than two dozen other actors have essayed the part including gordon scott who is widely believed be the best actor tackle the role weismuller made tarzan features van dien will probably fall short of that number and having seen tarzan and the lost city would argue that the moviegoing public would have been well served if he had missed

desperate measures is generic title for that is beyond generic it is also depressing waste of talent the solid team of michael keaton and andy garcia unthankfully thrown thankless lead roles not mention oncecool director barbet schroeder sadly continuing his string of notcool flicks this thriller is more before and after than reversal of fortune the movie is big disappointment and yet it is somewhat easy see what motivated such big names attach themselves it the premise is both promising and intriguing too bad the executions all wrong though because the setup of desperate measures boasts some rather enticing elements that deserve be put far better use san francisco cop frank connor garcia is single parent troubling dilemma his son matt joseph cross is stricken cancer only bone marrow transplant can push into remission even worse the only compatible donor is violent sociopath peter mccabe michael keaton currently serving life sentence for multiple murders and other various crimes against society connor tries his best convince mccabe go along the surgery he is at first reluctant but reconsiders after he realizes he can plan his escape at the hospital when he does make run for it connor offers close pursuit but for different reasons than his superiors including the crusty brian cox they want take mccabe down while connor needs keep him alive or all hope is lost for his little boy one misstep desperate measures makes is in its underdevelopment of matts illness what is needed are more details as exactly why mccabe is the only bone marrow match that works there would seem be other possible contenders somewhere in the country and thus many of the ways that connor endangers the lives of himself and those around him attempting keep mccabe alive are just little too hard swallow take for example scene where mccabe is trying make getaway climbing over an elevated passage tunnel connecting two sections of the hospital the police have their spotlight and guns aimed right on him and what does connor do he shoots the spotlight out so that mccabe can continue his flight connor knows very well what dangerous deeds this guy is capable of and yet never seems think that mccabe will eventually get and try harm his son whatever be fair though the lack of story background is the least of the movies problems first and foremost is how cheaply desperate measures trades the potential of it is opening scenes for the routine action ballistics of its final hour once mccabe escapes the becomes the fugitive in reverse and no thrills there are countless scenes where the good guys catch up keaton only have him grab hostage and get away also the movie is so intent on giving you hootinducing lipsmacking villain the ads have compared peter mccabe hannibal lechter natch that it completely casts garcias frank connor the dullsville wayside desperate measures appears like its antagonist so much more than its protagonist and the movies headscratcher of sendoff confirms this there is some good be found amongst this mess particularly in the acting department cast against type michael keatons understated menace is highly effective although he is not given much believable work andy garcia plays off taut emotional chord joseph cross as garicias ailing son is surprisingly unsentimental and marcia gay harden lends solid support as doctor who becomes major player in the unfolding chaos this cast does its best camouflage the sorry plot as it chugs towards an inevitably happy ending but most is lost it goes without saying that desperate measures needs an operation of its very own

robin williams is comedic genus that is he is one when he is in that allows him space move flubber straps him in straitjacket covers him duct tape stuffs him in coat closet and piles furniture against the door make sure that he does not get out in remake of its own absent minded professor disney offers us proof that more is definitely less recycling old films that darned cat dalmatians dressed up as new is the newest money machine from the home of the mouse that roared professor phillip brainard williams is terminally forgetful scientist teaching at small college his fiancee sara jean reynolds marcia gay harden president of the college is none too happy him because he is left her waiting at the altar due his lack of shortterm and longterm memory she is giving him one more chance he blows that chance when he invents flubber flying rubber and is so excited his discovery that sara jean is once again awaiting him in her white dress his tardiness is helped along his jealous flying robotic assistant who wants him all herself it is not all bad news flubber is green jello that can magnify and reflect energy that is applied it brainard realizes the commercial potential within the goo can save the school from bankruptcy and being taken over the towns evil industrialist charles hoenicker raymond barry while he is busy his new breakthrough the slighted sweetheart is being wooed his sleazy rival wilson croft christopher mcdonald there is flying car flubberenhanced basketball game and an assortment of broken lab equipment none of are the least bit interesting or funny at one point my son looked around the audience and asked why are these people laughing although williams turns in one of his least inspired roles he is easily the most lively of the actors everyone else comes across as halfasleep the remake is successful in that respect it feels like bad disney movie from the sixties remember the original as being charming but my guess is that the memory from almost four decades ago has been artificially enhanced the years there have been some updates fred macmurrays flying model has been replaced tbird his faithful dog charlie is now weebo the hovering robot the biggest change is that sophisticated computer animation we now can have films show off special effects without being at all entertaining flubber is anthropomorphized into being supposedly personality the gloop has little arms and legs and splits into tiny little gloopettes for big dance number this has nothing do the story the only possible reason is create merchandising opportunities so that kids can badger their parents into taking them mcdonalds for the toys not that contributing little the plot is big problem there are very few aspects of the that move the story and those that do do not make sense the discovery of flubber is going save the college because brainard can sell his flying car ford anyone half brain would be able see that his intelligent flying automaton is worth billions it is unbelievable that his lover well probably not lover after all this is disney starts dating croft after the aborted wedding there is not one appealing component of this man after the professor discovers that smearing golf ball the gunk causes it bounce uncontrollably around his lab wreaking havoc cringed as he picked up bowling ball this guy is beyond forgetful venturing into the certifiable cowriter john hughes used direct lightweight but thoughtful teen films the care behind pretty in pink and the breakfast club all went out the window after his home alone franchise heated up the box offices looking much like home alone flubber even features couple of vapid goons who get banged around and cute little boy who screams lot in some ways it is difficult judge this have suspicion that am not it is target audience after all measure my age in two digits

ever watch very young child try and tell joke that is beyond his or her sophistication it is full of stops and starts and usually the punch line is ruined felt the same way watching drowning mona skip stone across water and you approximate the depth of this attempt at an ensemble comedy there are some slightly successful attempts at humor but they only serve as window dressing there is running gag about the town verplanck y being test town for the then new yugo everyone drives yugo differentiating their cars personalized license plates even the police chief drives one there is certain sublimeness the image of lights and siren decked out yugo skittering its way through the town streets there also is running gag about one of the characters jeff missing hand and how it occurred it pokes gentle fun at the notion of urban legends it turns out the truth is more horrifying than any legend there are some sight gags that pop up as well such as monas tombstone reads demoted instead of devoted still the core of the story maintains the flatness of still pond the lynchpin of the falls on the redundant and sporadic scenes involving mona midler each scene her is the same scream at someone hit someone then scream some more there is no uniqueness or modulation her or explanation for her meanness anyone off the street could have played the role such as it is the other characters are walking cardboard cutouts each one is defined one trait and no further attempt is made at deeper characterization there is burly female car mechanic so of course there is forced lesbianism gag monas son jeff marcus thomas is simpleton hence you can predict his dialogue before it even plods its way from his mouth chief of police rash devito likes broadway musicals and loves his daughter there is nothing more him elle the chiefs daughter campbell is bland personified dutiful girl no higher aspiration than have child and be married monas husband phil fichtner jeckle and hydes from shirking coward reptilian letch bob affleck elles betrothed and business partner jeff is mumbling obvious dullard there is no contrast any of the characters having at least one character some wit or wits serve as counterpoint the others perhaps steinfelds attempt at satirizing small town infested ambitionless people might have come off better ostensibly murder mystery drowning mona gives you almost all the clues immediately then lets you sit back and feel superior as you watch the cast of paper people fumble their way finding the killer who could be anyone due monas loving manner everyone on town even that aspect of the fails throwing in convenient ridiculous and unsatisfying wrap things it is been while since walked away from movie theater in an angry mood what makes it all the more remarkable is that rarely remember comedy making me so angry for wasting my time at it is ineptitude

what are we going do jim carrey viewers of televisions in living color know this oneman cartoon from such characters as fire marshall bill viewers also know that in living color is skitshow and that little of jim carrey goes long way unfortunately this fact was forgotten the makers of the carrey comedy ace ventura pet detective three writers including carrey worked on the slapstick story sends selfstyled pet detective on the trail of stolen dolphin the missing mammal belongs the miami dolphins who need their mascot for the upcoming superbowl for plot porpoises this story works as well as any three stooges short carrey gets do his official schtick as he snoops around greater miami he leers and sneers craning his neck funny effect he even does his captain kirk impersonation again all of this is pretty harmless stuff up until the point that you realize that the writers have absolutely no intention of focusing on anyone other than carrey suggested alternate titlejim carrey will do anything for laugh export it france and you may have hit as it stands ace ventura is not even good kids stuff the profanity count alone is too high is ironic since children are probably carreys best audience the does not even have the goofball charm of chris elliotts recent nobrainer cabin boy sure carrey has his moments but what can you say about whose highpoints include watching carrey slink around the theme from mission impossible ace ventura has one glaring incongruity amid the buttjokes and doubletakes the script takes great pains setup an elaborate and rather funny crying game gag and for this intended audience that takes ahem cojones

there are some pretty impressive stars in lost in space it is just that none of them happen be actors the stars am referring are the computer generated ones that make up the movies outer space the stars that the less impressive actors hurtle thru as they try find their way home yes in terms of acting the star power is well more like falling star kinda pretty shortlived and pretty much dead lost in space as if you really did not know is based on the scifi television series of the same name it is the year and earths precious resources are quickly being usurped the needs of its massive population john robinson william hurt is the scientist leading mission program colonize foreign planet earths entire existance is contingent upon successful mission but nobody whether it be johns family or hired battle pilot don west matt leblanc seems too enthusiastic about leaving their home planet for several years johns family consists of his wife maureen mimi rogers his atypical teenage daughter penny lacey chabert his ingenious son will jack johnson and his beautiful scientist daughter judy heather graham despite everyones reluctance the jupiter spacecraft abandons planet earth and makes its way into the vast eternity of space unknown anyone but the audience there is an evil doctor stowaway determined sabotage the entire mission dr smith gary oldman has been hired group of rebel conspirators turn the expedition sour and dr smith has reprogrammed talking robot destroy robinson family when everything that could go wrong does go wrong for both sides the spaceship is warped an unknown destination and now the premise of being lost in space is complete as for the audience you will likely be lost in boredom this point wondering if the plot like the jupiter will ever get off the ground it is hard tell who deserves the most blame the incredibly bland and corny characters or the horrifically lame script chabert is basically the only one overdo it sounding like whiny munchkin on helium if you like me were convinced commercials that her voice was altered for some sort of plot twist where her body would be taken over aliens you are wrong that is just her normal voice in yet another example of friend faltering on the big screen leblanc is so incredibly dull and yet so obviously trying so hard be so incredibly charming make sense it makes you want shove his ass out the escape pod corridor without an escape pod graham is babe thank goodness there was something for me think about during this hurt the black hole of excitement sucks up any energy that might have been left if hurt were available in tablet form he would be prescription strength sleeping pill johnson is not dull he is just lame as the young know it all who winds up saving everybodys ass all the time want an example of how cool this kid can be how about when he convinces the robot think its heart and reconsider killing the family hey do not laugh the thing actually listened the mr rogerswouldbeproud sentiment but alas if you thought character could not be much worse there was rogers as the epitome of generic or mother as she was known why hire an actress they could have had white cardboard cutout the word mom printed on it now that would have had some pizzazz lost in space luckily does not suffer in every single category that it could have the special effects are crisp clear and at least mildly captivating unlike any of the presences onscreen save it be oldman who plays his evil character great deal of fun and finesse unfortunately oldman is locked away for most of the giving us nothing but ample mocking opportunities enjoy while the special effects are pleasing the eye they are nothing you could not find in most modern scifi films contact for example far exceeds this in terms of imagery and imagination lost in space just has too many shortcomings ever be considered work of cinematic art numerous contradictions the time travel aspect was horribly flawed wooden and corny acting worse dialogue and an ending so disappointing you would be happier have seen the entire robinson family get blown smithereens then again an ending like this has it is obvious sequel is already being considered what an awful note end on knowing there could be more of this in year or two the attempt be family oriented is commendable but lost in space is lost the illusion that special effects and the nostalgia of classic tv series being revisited is enough satisfy all age groups well danger potential movie goers danger this movie crash lands without ever breaking thru the atmosphere of mediocrity

so it is thirty years later and oscar and felix are together again that might have been an exciting notion if it was not for the fact that the odd couple of jack lemmon and walter matthau have been reunited in several recent movies grumpy old men grumpier old men and out sea e grumpiest old men so the odd couple ii e the grumpiest old men of all really seems just another entry in tired series the plot is even similar that of grumpy old men in that lemmon and matthaus mismatched characters are brought together romance between their children oscars son jonathan silverman and felixs daughter lisa waltz are getting married and former roommates felix ungar lemmon and oscar madison matthau meet at the airport and decide share car then hilarity ensues well few chuckles ensue anyway neil simon the awardwinning playwright who created oscar and felix provides the screenplay is shock because the script is piece of talentless hackwork from beginning end unlike the original playmovie odd couple ii does not find its humor in the personality conflict of its characters instead it depends upon series of humorous situations oscar and felix lose the car over cliff are caught smuggling mexicans over the border take up two women on the run from their violent husbands the women are played christine baranski of cybill and jean smart of designing women and hitch ride man who dies in the desert the original movie the odd couple remains classic comedy it introduced the motif of roommateasspouse that has provided gags for movies and sitcoms ever since it was the second outing for the lemmonmatthau team debuted in the fortune cookie and they made couple more worthwhile comedies the front page and buddy buddy before going their separate ways the reunion of lemmon and matthau in grumpy old men six years ago was delightful and its sequel seemed appropriate because it tied up some loose ends from the first movie but out sea and the odd couple ii are just beating grumpy old horse you can add lemmons my fellow americans e grumpy old presidents that list too let us hope that offers these two actors something fresh do let us hope also that we see neil simons name on movies that do it justice this is his first since lost in yonkers

except for few bright moments of good verbal comedy that old feeling is embarrassing sit through bette midler and dennis farina play lilly and dan actress and author once married now violently divorced and back together one last time for their daughter mollys paula marshall wedding lilly and dan hate each other passionately so passionately that they have sex at the wedding and fall in love again each ditches his or her current spouse of years and runs off the other molly married now only hours runs off in search of her irresponsible parents while her husband keith jamie denton tries console the abandoned spouses in mollys search for her parents she somehow falls in love lillys paparazzo joey danny nucci meanwhile the newlywed keith ends up consoling dans wife rowena gail ogrady in bed the audience saw this apparently thought that all the adultery was hilarious am no dan quayle but thought it was bit creepy the message seemed be ignore your responsibilities unrepentantly and have fun fucking who you wish family values aside there is something cruel about all this perhaps this movie would have played well as black comedy but the movie is romantic comedy we are supposed be rooting for these creeps reiner and screenwriter leslie dixon tried make it easier on us making the victims unlikeable lillys husband is newage flake who rambles about emotional valet parking so we can write him off as irrelevant dans wife is vain manipulative and jealous so we can write her off as bitch mollys husband is careerconscious selfcentered republican politician who thinks she is too fat and just for good measure he also fucked dans wife so we can write him off as prick everyone else falls in love but still that somehow does not justify the actions of the movies main characters he is prick or she is bitch is no defense the movie is somewhat redeemed some funny dialog often during heated arguments and aboveaverage performances midler and farina breaking out of his characteractor mold other than that it is standard romantic comedy very substandard gimmick

maybe this mission should have been scrubbed mission mars review michael redman copyright michael redman there is world of difference between artists and technicians the artist has vision create something new he may not do it well it might be sloppy but it is something you have never seen before good technician can make it look good but without direction from his own inner artist or someone else it is going be just xerox obviously successful films need both skills brian de palma is masterful technician he is spent his career copying others most notably hitchcock he usually knows exactly what do make scene work but only because he has learned it rote aside from rare flashes of originality his films are often souldead in de palmas latest he turns his attention stanley kubrick tell the truth enjoyed portions of this movie but liked it lot better over years ago when it was called enjoyed it even more when it was titled close encounters nasa has set its sights for mars when the first crew meets disaster rescue mission is sent the red planet they do not do so well either but eventually meet up the lone surviving astronautgonerasta and solve the mysteries of the universe and it is all so boring there are so many scenes that just do not work it is difficult begin when the first crew is few feet away from raging massive upsidedown martian tornado looks remarkably like sandworm from dune destroying everything in its path they just hang out watching error the most interesting character and that is not saying much is killed off error the alien is laughable error the rest of the characters are the dullest people imaginable error there is some nice eyecandy the face on mars turns out be giant metal thai buddha head looks cool threedimensional holographic planetarium is more fun watch than anything at disney world maneuvering in space suits outside the ship seems realistic but there is so much more that feels as if we have been there before from there is the rotating space station the blinding white room from close encounters they solve sound puzzle and play it the aliens the list goes on the actors are mostly mobile wooden statues even gary sinise and tim robbins cannot muster enough emotion convince us they are breathing no one seems care about anything that happens you will not either the absolutely worst sin is the blatant product placement as dr pepper foot tall logo saves the day they should save the commercials for those insipid bits before the

mulholland drive did very well at the cannes festival as you can see from the rating it did not do very well from me at the toronto international festival it may not be clear the viewer why am so negative on this for most of the running time in fact it is an interesting mystery story told on the backdrop of the industry toward the end of the think everything that has been built falls apart the was be pilot for tv series but writer and director david lynch did not sell his tv pilot and think he decided that he wanted do something else it something else is what he did the opens woman played laura harring about be killed in car when car crash saves her life she crawls away from the accident concussion and finds herself bungalow an unlocked door sleep meanwhile young vivacious betty naomi watts arrives in from canada she wants build career as an actress betty is little surprised find woman sleeping in the borrowed bungalow she does not know who the woman is she is even more surprised when the woman awakes and does not herself know who she is they fix on name rita for her but are not sure if this right or not meanwhile local director adam kesher justin theroux has problems of his own he is trying cast one actress for his new and is getting pressure from the producers and from crime figures cast someone else cammie rhodes melissa george these two threads are joined third one in there is strange and comic murder that goes terribly wrong there is also strange character called the cowboy monty montgomery adding the confusion in what was probably intended for the television pilot the opens great vibrancy showing dancing style under the credits lot of mulholland drive starts out fun lynch wants you know he could make an enjoyable stylish he just chooses not as any david lynch there is strange material added for little reason there are no earthworms but there are some decidedly strange david lynch touches the is little long for the subject matter toward the end it gets into some heavier violence and sex scenes clearly not intended for the tv pilot unfortunately some of the most important comments make about this would be spoilers will not mention them in the main body of the review but give mulholland drive on the scale and low on the scale mulholland drive spoiler warning have rated this fairly low you should read this only after seeing the or deciding that you will not see the david lynch is in large part dark satirist most of his work is done in familiar genres but in some way shows their underside in mulholland drive think he is having laugh at the expense of the crime genre what he does this is are you sure you want read this playing off the audience expectations that there will be simple explanation for what is going on the first of the he tells simple multithread crime story clues sprinkled throughout then suddenly at the end he turns the story on its ear large number of clues that appear that they should add up something the audience expectation is that they will add up but he has given clues that are selfcontradictory lynch wants the audience argue about what they have seen afterward and come up theories in fact the pointers are noticeably contradictory and until hear better explanation think lynch is merely playing joke there is visual curiosity that was popular in the sixties mad magazine called it poiuyt other sources called it tri pronged ubar look at small portions of it and makes sense look at the whole figure and it does not this is in my estimation the cinematic equivalent of tripronged ubar

ingredients possessed plastic dolls in love plastic dolls having sex starring jennifer tilly voice of brad dourif katherine heigl nick stabile john ritter synopsis this is the fourth in the chucky series debuted in the late basically chucky is plastic doll that can walk and talk because it is possessed the spirit of slain murderer in bride of chucky chuckys longtime girlfriend tiffany jennifer tilly dies and her spirit inhabits female plastic doll through voodoo dolls tiffany and chucky get married and embark on quest reach cemetery in new jersey where mystical gem might enable them be humans the dolls stow away in the back of vehicle driven newly eloped couple so in the side plot the couple suspects each other of being murderer opinion bride of chucky is an attempt at horror humor but does not succeed somehow chucky moaning about mid life crisis and how he should have gotten married does not make for very scary chucky and tiffany harping about mid life crisis and how she should have gotten married does not make for very scary tiffany the suspenseless bride of chucky relies mostly on jennifer tillys cleavage keep attention during the first half and on occasional puns keep attention during the second half the best that can be said about bride of chucky is that it is sarcastic

watching the movie vowed subtract half star from the review because the filmmakers included saccharine syrup cute cuddly computergenerated monkey if the monkey died the movie got an extra half star alas the monkey showed up at the end unharmed the wet sickly sound of gagging and rolling eyeballs what that means is that lost in space actually deserved stars that is pretty generous considering the movies camp lacked any hint of tongue in cheek when will robinson jack johnson teaches his pet robot about friendship you are actually supposed buy it so why such seemingly high rating there are few reasons that made me unable throw away the experience the garbage first we saw the movie on opening night of the first day of operation of brand new theater the sound and screen kicked ass nobody in the country enjoyed the movie as much as my audience did and do not necessarily mean that in good way also there were more than zero scenes where found myself rooting for the robinsons or getting caught up in the movies tension even liked the computergenerated settings usually prefer see models or sets but the cg was more detailed than have seen in lot of movies it looks like someone spent little overtime render some of the futuristic cities also gary oldman is never bad actor even though he is typecast as villain william hurt is not too bad either neither actor had great role but their performances were watchable and perhaps should not admit this but something about the tone and outlook of the movie brought me back my childhood there is very little swearing or blood there is strong moral message saccharine though it is there is bit of romance whose culmination after hours is real kiss no sex it felt like one of those disney movies that so looked forward when was six those movies were probably as bad as lost in space but at the time they were manna from heaven that type of moviemaking is lost art now for the bad news worst and most unforgivable was the incredibly bad dialogue it is squeakyclean family fun trying hard be as hip as pulp fiction you better hold on your joystick is one such line and when robinson is called upon deliver line about warp conduit thingamajigs they inevitably stumble badly enough embarrass even the lowliest star trek ensign second worst and closely related is the screenplay the storys exposition takes place at press conference allows the writers explain what is happening the least amount of creativity effort or interest once the story gets going do concede momentary burst of interest once in while but on the whole the situations that arise are silly and contrived when gary oldman easily reprograms wills pet robot kill the robinsons my friend summed it up perfectly he flipped the switch evil then there is the tone of the movie the colorado daily said the would have been more interesting if the central character was will robinson and not his father john robinson then it could be an adventure movie they are mostly right except that johnson will was not good enough actor carry it off still that the has the robinson patriarch as our hero shows lack of imagination just because movie is tame enough for kids does not mean that we have bow promise keepers notion of who is the center of family many quality family films have been made nontraditional family structure fly away home comes mind much better effect and the politics of the time seem bit conservative and regressive for futuristic movie in star wars the rebels were the good guys we were rooting for those who were fighting against the system in lost in space the rebels are the bad guys terrorist force that must be killed crushed and silenced so that our children may live free that ominous excuse for violence almost makes me sympathize the terrorists finally few specific details deserve criticism the movie tells us that the setting is the year why why bother saying what year this is just tell us it is the future bring it up because the tv series was supposed take place in setting specific date only dates the movie and guarantees that it will not be timeless not that this movie was really in the running anyway then there is scene that shows john robinson checking one of his controls on chair that rises about fifteen feet on pole this silly waste of money reminded me of bugs bunnys barber chair and only shows that the future is time when spaceship designers have not learned thing about ergonomics one vaguely redeeming quality is that the end credits succeed where the rest of the failed it made lost in space look cool the strong techno beat sampled the cheesiest dialogue and out of context made it sound hip this is overlaid on cool jumpy credit sequence interesting distorted clips from the movie but if that is the best part of the movie cannot in good conscience recommend it still if you get stuck seeing it as we did you might be able appreciate it if you keep your distance think of liking bad movies as child and bring along your bad movie bingo cards

i was going see ram shrasta on the big screen last night but before that stopped into my video store rent some movies luckily my video guy was in the middle or recording ram shrasta knew it was going be bad print only halffaces and poor sound quality but could not help myself got it well after watching it it indeed was bad print was glad did not dish out waste three hours of my time sitting in bad theatre watching bad movie this movie really sucks it had so many inconsistencies it was driving me crazy for example how can jackie shroff grow two feet of hair in just three or four days jackie shroff looked really stupid his steven seagal ponytail the songs are bad the acting is bad especially deepti bhatnagars and the direction is the worst of all the comedy scenes jagdish and johnny lever just made me want throw up did not even finish the movie could not take it anymore note but if anyone out there liked aatish the same director guess you would like this movie it is practically the same except that sanjay dutt is replaced jackie shroff aditya panscholi is the sidekick again was going give it zero but personally like jackie shroff so loosened up little he looked fresh wore good clothes as always and his performance even though it was not his best was the only saving grace of the movie

starship troopers is bad movie mean really really bad movie not only does it cross the line of bad taste when it comes blood gore and body parts shown on the screen it blissfully jumps over that line apparently unaware that the movie trailers appeal an audience of five fifteen year olds of saw many in the theatre looking past the appalling sight of overdone violence we are left movie thin plot at best no strong lead characters blatant disregard for physics and very obvious naziesque theme that being said onto the review the movie starts propaganda message from the federation who is logo bears strong resemblance nazi german eagle urging the populace go off and fight the bugs who are attempting destroy earth the shows large rallies young children in attendance pledging allegiance the federation again sound familiar as the movie progresses we are shown terror tactic training as drill sargeant very graphically compound fractures one recruits arm and throws knife through anothers hand eventually the recruits embark on journey location two thirds of the way across the milky way galaxy fight the bugs on their home planet as our faster than light travelling heroes arrive on planet they drop onto the planet and burst our of their craft brandishing what you say laser beam weapons sonic weapons phasers photon cannons nope they hop out brandishing good old machine guns pump action rifles and tactical nuclear weapons guess lot of physics money rd went into travel and not weaponry as the assault begins our group of troopers are seen walking in straight line through box canyon two members of the group notice rocks slipping and falling above them and one even sees streak fly but disregards it as nothing this of course leads more massive carnage blood shed and graphic depictions of limbs and heads being ripped and severed from their bodies again see that military tactics in the future must have evolved at about the same pace as their weapons in the end we see neil patrick doogie howser harris burst onto the scene in what could accurately be described as nazi ss trenchcoat hat and gloves he does vulcan mind meld on the giant slug and then proclaims that the bugs are scared this sets the troopers into frenzy as they are now one step closer completing their goal total genocide of species again sound familiar have tried very hard not step on and spoil the plot this review but given it is nonexistence may have anyway could go on for pages ripping this movie apart but do not want bore you too badly in short felt as if were subjected mix between pronazi war bugs substituted for allies drivers education accident scene and complete blank screen the plot of course would not recommend this movie anyone anywhere under any circumstance copyright tim jandt

capsule one of the ten worst movies ever made christopher lambert vs evil ninjas in modernday japan and nobody wins the hunted is such bad movie so completely inept and so totally braindamaged that could almost feel affection for it could see myself showing this movie friends and getting good jolly guffaw out of it if it were not also insanely xenophobic and insulting christopher lambert plays computerparts salesman who is on business in japan he meets slinky young woman joan chen and has torrid night of lovemaking her and then manages witness her death at the hands of an evil ninja clan and their leader john lone apparently they had some unfinished business that could only be concluded her getting slaughtered since lambert is witness he is of course the next one die let us stop and think about this for second if lambert were in real life being chased fanatical devotees ninja secret society he would have lifespan you could only measure an atomic clock in this movie the ninja manage kill just about everyone except him imagine the japanese gods smiled down on lambert and provided him goof field that radiates out about ten feet from his body you know what goof field is that invisible zone in anyone who has intent do harm you becomes klutz no matter what their real dexterity is this is of course only the beginning of the movies problems lambert eventually finds pseudosafety longhaired modernday samurai yoshio harada and his partner yoko shimada who you may remember as lady toda buntaro in shogun they are the two best things in the movie in every scene they have authority and presence and they actually look like they belong here even when dressed in full samurai armor and wielding bows the script does not know what the hell do them lone as the bad guy is zerodimensional the only badguy cliche he has wallow around in is the one about how the bad guy always has exotic women dripping off of him in the hunted this is elevated the level of an insulting stereotype what is funny is that the peripheral characters in the hunted are not sterotypes there is nice little scene tokyo cabdriver and girl in pachinko parlor but many of the main characters are unsalveageably hateful also the phenomenal instrumental troupe kodo has assembled superior soundtrack get the cd that manages survive despite the drek it is been designed accompany there is an extended battle scene in the middle of the movie that is almost reason enough watch the whole thing gory excellently staged fight on the bullet train that shows some real imagination for moment and then smothers it trying clumsily recouple the whole thing the movies relentlessly stupid plot the time we get the final showdown lambert getting wield his own sword judging from the hamhanded editing of one scene was forged in seven hours or so we no longer care we are not even given any definitive information about whether or not one of the key characters lives or dies someone once said that the key good art good movies good books whatever is start somewhere interesting end up somewhere interesting and show respect for the audience all along the way this movie bungles two out of three badly

hello kids today the movie studios want take over my critical review and somehow persuade you that _armageddon_ the summers biggest blockbuster is for everybody and remember if is for _everybody_ and if it makes the most money for the summer it _must_ be good right armageddon is comedy capital it stars bruce willis who has hundred oneliners it has tiny rock land directly in the middle of heated argument in new york city and chuckle chuckle one of those new yorkers _survives_ charcoal all over his face snorkle sniff hiccup and it has steve buscemi as _genius_ who wants work for an oil rig kneeslap is not this just so so funny armageddon also has romance capital it has tender moment between forbidden lovers ben affleck and liv tyler animal crackers and it has will patton as long lost husband trying reunite his separated wife and child who thinks he is salesman gurgle sniff awwwww and it has steve buscemi spewing more oneliners about minors and strippers umm moving right along armageddon also has lots of action capital not just any action sequence would do it must have _original_ action sequences that are designed thrill like drill darn it drill and let us have inept people destroy the mir space station cannot you hear your heart beating and steve buscemi goes crazy and starts shooting at people what drama lastly armageddon is out there save the planet capital this cannot be any old thrillerwe must have an asteroid the size of texas head straight for earth and and we must have beautiful scenic worldwide shots like paris blown up and and we must have peoples of all colors nations and religions join hand in hand for one final hopeful hug the final sequence where muslims in prostrate worship stand upin domino fashionto cheer the victory filled me such
