emotional goo that wanted rip the screen into shreds mean mean cheer for ecstatic joy it was over comedy romance action planet okay kids what does that spell seriously folks any that could take the indiefilms most valuable talents and throw it all away bruce willis vehicle hundredmillion dollar budget but have cheapo sets and lousy special effects is bottom line living proof that hell exists and has made multipicture deal universal in the midst of all the action the terseness the oneliners the fake sets the overall waste of time recognized matt malloy playing an underwritten nasa technician malloy give me reading remember him he was principal player in last years _in the company of men_ that was more powerful shocking terrifying funny and shocking than _armageddon_ could ever aspire be _armageddon_ cost over million make _itcom_ cost paltry need say more

deserves recognition for achieving the nearimpossible task of making grander monument selflove than steven seagals on deadly ground capsule review question after the floating baby ruth that was waterworld what in the were the execs who gave kevin costner the money make another postapocalyptic movie thinking in this hour advertisement for his new hair weave costner plays nameless drifter who dons long dead postal employees uniform and gradually turns nukedout usa into an idealized hippydippy society judging the costuming at the end of the movie the main accomplishment of this brave new world is in reinventing polyester when he is not pointing the camera directly at himself director costner does have nice visual sense and it is undeniably fascinating see such an unabashedly jingoistic in the trustnoone but the time the second hour rolled around was reduced sitting on my hands keep from clawing out my own eyes mark this one return sender

starring ben stiller elizabeth hurley maria bello janeane garofalo screenplay david veloz based on the novel jerry stahl directed david veloz permanent midnight is pretty bad movie though it took me few days conclude this the is more masturbatory than bleak its main character intent on confounding us his stupidity he has a week drug habit ultimately as adapted veloz jerry stahl comes off as one of those playground braggarts who chainsmokes at the age of twelve you are less mystified his selfdestructive nature than bored into stupor yourself ben stiller plays stahl young author who arrives in a ambition and nasty drug habit he eventually gets gig for week writing for sitcom called mr chompers thinly veiled standin for alf chompers looks just like alf except he is blue marries producer hurley so she can get green card and hooks up spanish mother liz torres who shoots heroin him in the afternoons insert proverbial downward spiral here permanent midnight is structured mostly as flashback recovering addict bello meeting stiller at fastfood restaurant where stiller works the drivethru as part of rehab taking him back hotel and between bouts of serious screwing listening his life story have spent the last week trying figure out why stiller never seemed find the frighteningly gorgeous hurley attractiveworse have been trying figure out why hurley did find stiller attractive as stahl stiller displays none of the charm or wit one would expect postthere is something about mary of either the actor or comedy writer what separates stahl from the hundreds of other punkjunkies it seems is that stahl wrote book about his idiocy watch stahl shoot heroin next baby watch stahl spoil numerous pitch meetings smackfueled babble stiller gives technically flawless performance the could double as documentary on how be junkie but permanent midnight is mostly soulless when the movie poses the question will stahl be saved and then answers it in the form of bellos character basically shrink in black panties could person care less in the version of his autobiography of the same name stahl does not need saving he needs someone who will sit there and listen him go on about himself if you learn anything about the other characters in this movie it is that they are the most incredibly tolerant hollywoodtypes known man stahl also seems be the only person at schmooze parties doing drugs is this california learned very little about the entertainment business from permanent midnight and whole lot about an egotistical lunkhead of course you know that stahl triumphed because he lived talk about his problems so basically his drug habit got him book deal movie based on his life and now he is apparently collaborating stiller on future projects so much for the moral of that story temporary midnight is more like it bill chambers september

the camera zooms in incredibly close it focuses on the closed eyes of person presumed dead all of sudden thunderous sound effect and an eerie sounding musical pulse his eyelids open the camera zooms in incredibly close it focuses on one of the characters desperately running for her life then thunderous sound effect and an eerie sounding musical pulse she bumps into the killer the camera zooms in incredibly close it focuses on door from where seemingly strange sounds emanate all of sudden thunderous sound effect and an eerie sounding musical pulse the doors swing open reveal what is inside closeup thrillshots such as these seemed elicit more laughter from the audience rather than genuine fear is pretty good sign that you are not watching the thriller that the director had originally envisioned rather you adopt the opinion that the characters are so goofy and so unaware of the trouble that they are in that you stop caring about who lives who dies and where the story goes instead you become more interested in how the characters get killed off the four young teenagers who are the potential sacrificial lambs for this movie are helen and barry and julie and ray two couples and dear friends one another during the summer just after high school graduation they take fateful drive down dark mountain highway suddenly without warning their car hits someone whom the teens presume was killed as result of that collision fearing jail time and possible manslaughter charges if they confess they instead decide dump the body into the ocean and make pact never discuss the episode again year goes and things among the four friends begin change relationships fizzle future dreams crumble and attitudes change but they can not forget what they did and apparently neither can someone else someone begins send letters all four of the teens the frightening message know what you did last summer the letterwriter figure in rubber slicker wielding large metal hook soon makes his presence known and begins hunt down the four teens it is now up the four of them try figure out who the killer is before it is too late while this movie has some nice visually eerie effects too much of it is impact had be generated extreme closeups while the level of suspense was choppy at best there is so much more that this movie could have been but decided give us nothing but cheap thrills it could have been clever whodunit but discovering who ultimately was the killer made me just shrug my shoulders it could have explored the changed friendships after year of adulthood but seemed only include that aspect add more minutes the it could have given us smarter characters who knew that anytime you are alone and you see shadowy figures moving about you do not walk towards them yelling hello once you yell hello you can expect an extreme closeup thunderous sound effect and an eerie sounding musical pulse it is difficult be in suspense when you know what is about happen the only redeeming aspect of the movie is that now have neat idea for halloween costume but am not sure if the local costume store sells rubber slickers and hooks the horror that experienced from this is realizing that actually went see it

goodbye lover sat on the shelf for almost year since its lukewarm reception at the cannes festival last may and one look will tell you why it is mess and that is way before ellen degeneres shows up the is one of those torrid doubleindemnity crime stories that in this case required the services of three screenwriters suspect that one wrote sexy thriller one wrote murder mystery and one wrote comedy then director roland joff tried piece it all together in the editing room while scratching his head in bewilderment did not laugh at ellen degeneres much think was supposed degeneres is horrible and her character is even worse toughtalking vulgar cop bad wardrobe and bad hair either degeneres is wearing wigas most of the actors appear beor she does not yet have enough clout secure hairstylist every single word out of her mouth is supposed be racy and hip but her incessant wisecracking is poorlywritten and merely stupid her reaction the brutal killing of jogger is at least she died healthy and that is one of her wittier asides degeneres sgt rita pompano is called in investigate the allegedly accidental death of wait give away too much of the plot would all but ruin that has very little going for it outside of its numbing plot twists and multiple triplecrosses it is best described this way sultry sexpotreal estate agent sandra dunmore patricia arquette is married jake creative yet unfocused and alcoholic advertising rep played dermot mulroney sandra likes act out her deepseated sexual fantasies and jakes brother ben the suaveasever don johnson likes help ben is also coming on his petite mousy coworker peggy blaine marylouise parker and someone somewhere is planning cash in on that huge life insurance policy of his the is ripe cheating lovers cheating on each other and back again although there are some genuine surprises the plot twists get too contrived too quickly probably around the time degeneres gumcracking gumshoe appears at least the former ellen star is going for something little different arquette turns in yet another of her stilettoheeled platinum blonde bombshell roles see lost highway true romance while quoting embarrassing lines like am not wearing any underwear hope she got paid lot of money do this heres an example of some of the films flatout stupidity sandra purchases used car and disguises herself in red wig prior stalking two of the films duplicitous lovers she drives the motorbiking couple off cliff while blaring her favorite the sound of music on her car stereo intent on identifying herself her hapless victims so what was the point of the wig and the car the sound of music stuff might be reference the wizard of oz allusions in david lynchs wild at heart but if so joff must have forgotten that wild at heart was despicable movie it is hard believe that goodbye lover was directed the same person who made the killing fields and the mission it is not however hard see why it sat on the shelf for so long it should have stayed there

as any genx mtv movie like last years dead man on campus the movie is marketed for primarily male audience as indicated its main selling points sex and football those two items wrapped in guiltypleasure package are sure snare sizeable box office chunk initially but sales will decline for two reasons first the football sequences are nothing new nor can they be the sports genre is not mainstream and it is been retread death second the sex is just bad despite the appearance of whipped cream bikini or the allnight stripclub party there is nothing even remotely tantalizing the acting is mostly mediocre not including the fantastic jon voight cultivating his usual sliminess voight gives an unexpectedly standout performance as west canaan coyotes head coach bud kilmer kilmer is the driving force behind the coyotes twentytwo conference championships and two state titles in thirty years this year he plans make it twentythree unfortunately when his star quarterback lance harbor paul walker goes down for the count he is got rely on the unreliable abilities of backup john moxon james van der beek moxon leads the team through its last four games and then must cope his newfound stardom the effect it has on his relationship girlfriend julie amy smart and other temptations that abound in footballcrazy west canaan most regions of the country are not nearly as footballcrazy as texas and so the atmosphere is likely be lost on most similarly the set design is wrong for high school setting the teams are decked out sparkling uniforms radio headsets never seem work however and instead require coaches signal plays manually and even giant bronze statue of coach kilmer these elements as well as the heavy drinking and carousing might be more appropriate on college campus but mtvs core audience is the high school demographic this focus is further emphasized the casting james van der beek of tvs dawsons creek is an understandable choice for the reluctant hero although he never manages do anything the role other stars are similarly young and unmemorable there is not much that goes right about varsity blues and there is not much like about it either everything herein has already been done and if it has not the movie manages botch it one way or another this is certainly missable

nicolas cage comes up an ingenious survival mechanism for his role in the winkandaconcussivenudge bombastorama con air the opening credits sequence introduces us cage as cameron poe gulf war veteran convicted of manslaughter and serving eight years in prison after an illfated barroom brawl the prison scenes are accompanied voiceovers in poe in languid southern drawl describes prison life his wife back home and offers simple homilies for the daughter he has never met if the scene gives you tickle of familiarity it probably should cage appears realize that con air is going be utterly dimwitted and ridiculous and that he is going have do something keep himself entertained and thus he slips into familiar surreal role as his own commentary on the proceedings cage plays cameron poe as buffedup version of raising arizonas i mcdonnough cage should have known what he was getting himself into he got paycheck from jerry bruckheimer last year for the rock and if there is one thing you can count on from bruckheimer production even without his late partner don simpson it is that you can count on seeing everything you saw in the _last_ bruckheimer production the critical difference between the rock and con air is cages performance in the rock cage appeared be having the time of his life jumping into the action fray for the first time that sense of discovery has been replaced wry selfawareness while the plot of con air finds poe parolee on board hijacked prison transport plane whose goal is just get home cages goal is different but just as simple get out of the some measure of dignity intact audiences too should know what they are getting themselves into bruckheimer production in fact the marketing people are counting on it no one who loathed the rock for its sweargruntblast repetitiveness will be converted con air no one who loved the rock for exactly the same reasons will be dissuaded director simon west yet another tv commercial auteur plucked bruckheimer from the advertising equivalent of the schwabs soda fountain delivers exactly the kind of adrenalinetestosterone cocktail could launch an endocrinology lecture it is perversely appropriate that one sympathetic con spends most of the flight nearing diabetic coma like insulin con air does the work of gland what he does not deliver is moment of suspense bruckheimer has no use for hitchcocks notion that showing you the bomb under the desk creates more interesting scene than just blowing up the desk really _really_ big desk and really _really_ big bomb will serve the purpose nicely if either west or bruckheimer were interested in genuine tension they might have done something con airs creepiest setup at desert stop for the planeload of convicts serial killer garland greene steve buscemi wanders of into trailer park where he meets little girl having tea party in drained swimming pool their teteatete is eerie and menacing providing welcome shift in tone and giving buscemi chance stand out in cast too many villains danny trejo ving rhames and characteristically reptilian john malkovich among them in fact con air usually opts for too much of something when the tiniest measure of restraint would have been an improvement too many characters too much editing too many dopey punch lines too much of the cheap ugly appeals machismo characterize too many bruckheimer efforts it is that kind of exhausting excess cage is responding his detached performance while malkovich goes for the outrageous and john cusack as u marshal goes for earnest cage looks like he just wants go sleep his recycled raising arizona performance is means of escape his chase after stuffed bunny continuation of his pursuit of that big box of huggies it does not bode well for cages appearance in faceoff later this month perhaps he already realizes that all he can do in action films is more of the same over and over there is word for people like you nicolas that word is called recidivist repeat offender

a big house big director jan de bont of speed and twister fame big star catherine zetajones hot of the heels of entrapment and zorro big remake of the haunting and big special effects so what do they all amount unfortunately for us big bore plot hotshot doctor brings three insomniacs an old spooky mansion for controlled testing unbeknownst the patients the good doctor is actually conducting his own cover project that has do the psychology of fear critique this movie just did not scare me one bit sure it creeped and spooked me out little here and there but on the whole it took waaaaay too long get going provided very little meat in the plot went way past its own bedtime and basically relied on grunts the muttering of childrens voices and overthetop special effects scare us well this did not do much for me and they might as well have called it the haunting of lily taylor since she is basically the only character who had any real depth background or reason be in the house in the first place do not get me wrong catherine zeta was sweet window dressing despite my continued perception of her faint mustachesee entrapment and owen wilson was good as the standard comic relief but come on people if you are going have us sit through two hours in theater these folks how bout giving them little more than oneliners as dimension neeson was also wasted as the smart british guy it is all too sad cause certainly the idea seemed like good one see the shining for close perfect example of creepy gone awry but the story was thin the conclusion was laughable be gone poof and the special effects well they sure were nice look at but not for moment did one of them scare or even for splitsecond have me believe that they were anything more than special gadgetry see it for zetajones or if you like special effects and scary movies that take forever get going and provide very little payback otherwise skip it and check out the original or the ultimate movie about spooky homes from the netherworld the shining little known facts about this and its stars goofy actor owen wilson coscripted indie favorites rushmore and bottle rocket director wes anderson his brother luke wilson is also an actor who once dated drew barrymore for year or so brother andrew is also an actor singer lisa loeb is listed in the credits as having portrayed the character of olivia morice but personally did not notice her she is well known for her number one single stay missed you and goofy glasses the creaks and moans heard throughout the house were prerecorded and played during filming in order get more natural expression of fear out of the actors catherine zetajones is currently dating flabby ass actor michael sex is my life douglas she stands in actor michael rapaport pleaded guilty the aggravated harassment of lily taylor he was ordered stay away from her and undergo counseling for one year actor bruce dern who plays the throwaway role of the gatekeeper in this was once nominated for an oscar for best supporting actor for his role in coming home director jan de bont was born in holland and began his lengthy career as cinematographer on films as die hard hunt for red october and basic instinct directed another dutchman paul verhoeven actor todd field also played small but pivotal role in stanley kubricks last eyes wide shut he was nick nightingale the pianist this was originally titled the haunting of hill house

it is always bad sign when the core audience of children are either walking out early or are halfasleep when the credits roll at the end of that about sums up the dreadful ugliness of dalmatians cold pea soup of cute animals stupid home alone antics boring puppy love subplot between dumb humans and glenn close reprising her best joan crawford impression indeed walt disney is rolling over in his grave again cursing john hughes name for making the original liveaction dalmatians one of the worst kiddie flicks of all time and now its sequel the main culprit behind the hideousness of dalmatians is its predecessor dalmatians the original made more than million dollars at the box office spawned torrid collection of collectible items that ended up months later in the discount bins of walmarts across the country and generally made every kid on the planet want damn dalmatian pup for christmas well it is been about four years since then and dalmatian fever is coming back and this time it is digitally enhanced heres the story cruella de vil glenn close is released from prison due the cure of her puppy homicide urges one dr pavlov oh how witty she rejoins the world as dog lover and is assigned probation officer who oddly turns out be her victim from the original cruella then becomes ella dog lover until the plot twists like dog his leash caught on the back of moving truck and she becomes the evil vixen again kidnapping plot unfurls again as cruella decides she still needs her dalmatian coat but she now needs dalmatians instead of the commonly used dalmatian formula at this point was envying those kids filing out of the theater how low have glenn close and gerard depardieu as the films villain sunk in the business it is almost laughable in sadistic way watch close walk around in costumes that seem be pulled from the wardrobe of flash gordon and depardieu how can french guy have bad french accent and never mind the toilet brush haircut the only minutely positive selling point can even think point out is the talking bird british accent courtesy of eric idle that thinks he is rottweiler now that is funny

the animal is marginally inspired comedy that only manages lumber along generating just enough momentum keep it from stalling it is clunky and slow like watching an wheeler trying accelerate up hill there are certainly better things you can do your time actually if you have seen the trailer then you already know the plot and have seen its funniest moments the story centers on bland marvin rob schneider who is an evidence clerk at the local police department that yearns be real officer but he is afflicted loseritis dogs attack him neighbors torment him children bully him and his coworkers ignore him truthfully his bad haircut seemingly modeled after weird al yankovic little richard and giant poodles and his unenthusiastic demeanor we would probably throw tomatoes at him just for fun this is actually bad because you cannot like character if you cannot develop sympathy for him we never do and it may be just as well that he drives off cliff and plummets the canyon floor however marvin is found an eccentric doctor michael caton who uses radical and experimental procedure save him implanting our doofus various animal parts and organs as result marvin develops heightened senses and increased agility and speed he can smell drugs hidden anywhere on body swim the speed of dolphin and can run as fast as cheetah imagine the comedic possibilities that arise from this operation his enhanced abilities he could now reap vengeance on all those who have shunned him however the spirit of the takes raunchy turn and instead marvin spends most of his time trying subdue or satiate his voracious appetite and his animalistic sexual urges goats beware he also chases cats urinates mark his territory or growls at his enemies what he should have done was stick his head in the sand like an ostrich equally tenuous is its other running joke involves one of his friends guy torry who constantly complains that everyone is treating him too nicely because he is black it is reverse racism he declares as he blows smoke into the faces of strangers but none of them says anything this element does not work the first time it is mentioned and it becomes increasingly trite every recurrence you do not have be as wise as an owl realize that the animal is tame if there is any reason see this it is see colleen haskell who makes her big screen debut remember her she was voted off in week of the week program survivor here she plays marvins sunny love interest while her role required very little actual acting she seemed very comfortable even when marvin licks the side of her face like lapping dog yuck her adorable disposition radiant smile and playful innocence she could be meg ryan in the making it is too bad that she is in such mediocre offering

romeo is bleeding wants carry the unusual flavor of reservoir dogs or bad lieutenant director peter medak whose previous credits include the good films let him have it and the krays and topnotch character actors gary oldman and lena olin they seemed likely be successful combination those mentioned films however brought something the screen that romeo is bleeding did not solid wellwritten screenplay call me cynical but the jobs of writer and producer do not seem mix well gary oldman plays jack grimaldi good cop turned bad selling information the mob and cheating on his wife his cheating is obvious enough obtain his nickname although the name does not provide any insight or analogy the shakespearean character jack has become addicted feeding the hole hole in the ground where he stores his payoff money when he realizes his colleagues are being shot he feebly attempts get out gary oldmans performance is disappointingly weak he seems nearly bored in the process he also gets tangledup mona demarkov russian mobsterette who wants take over the territory from top boss falcone played adequately roy scheider demarkov played lena olin is tough but tremendously sexy woman seemingly no problems maneuvering within the mob world this character is combination of both linda hamilton and arnold schwarznegger from terminator cannot remember seeing character quite like her after being shot handcuffed and thrown in the back seat of car she still manages cause an accident kick out the windshield her legs grab suitcase full of money plus some important documentation climb through the rubble land on her shot leg and still succeed at running for safety what woman lena olins performance is the only glimmer in this dismal anabella sciorra is wasted in her role as romeos wife there is little insight into her character she is depressed she makes obvious references she mopes around the house juliette lewis as romeos girlfriend is treated the same cliche attitudes although ms lewis portrayal certainly did not improve it both women were anything but sexy or attractive poorly developed characters aside the screenplay also suffers from several logistical problems it is so discouraging watch and want shout at the main character not do something for example jack and his friends attend funeral hang in the background scopeout the mob scene fine jack spots the big boss his goons the gravesite fine what does jack proceed do he brushes his friends off telling them he is not feeling well then strolls over the boss why the boss had all ready threatened him falcone simply takes the opportunity issue more threats ordering his goons take off some of jacks toes the gravesite guess they were not worried about any federal agents lingering around after the funeral or heres another demarkov setup her own death cutting off her arm circular saw she proceeded set the place on fire would not the flames burn off the fingerprints are not dental records more important as bright and resourceful as she was supposed be could not she come up better plot and it took her no time at all get goodfitting functional prosthesis lack of attention detail certainly adds up in this does not even add up the large details there is little or no consistency in the storyline not much makes sense the direction lacks cohesion surprising from director whose previous credits are impeccable the moods shift the styles shift and no one can seem decide if it is serious or satire of one so while it certainly is not reservoir dogs it certainly is not diva there is plenty more tear apart in this my advice someone who has not seen it wait until it comes on video there are some quotable lines that would provide campy evening if not taken seriously it is not boring just not good one or an intelligent one

is dull perfunctory uninspired and boring greater writer might have created lyrical sentence for each of those adjectives flowing in lovely arangements soaring metaphors however would rather cut the chase is dull perfunctory uninspired and boring there is nothing in it not glimpse of depth nor shimmer of intelligence or insight there is no electricity in any of the scenes or moment of interest in the story or its subplots and it is underdeveloped and features an array of bland characters played actors who think they are in this years boogie nights they are so wrong the picture has been assembled mark christopher based on this do not know how he got job in the business is supposed be an amazing insight into the world of the dance club of the same name originated in the and closed down in the i do not know if this went into production after boogie nights was released but christopher has managed plagiarize paul thomas andersons brilliant work in every possible way from the framework of the plot down the style of the cinematography what it lacks is everything that made boogie nights great depth intelligence energy fascinating characters and challenging themes cannot even measure up the last days of disco is flawed but still smart and entertaining it is remarkably bad timing would say release this tedious after couple of noteworthy pictures of the same kind have exaggerated though there is one interesting character and one terrific performance that character is steve rubell played more perceptiveness mike myers than this limp production deserves steve rubell is the owner of studio and if christopher had focused on him then myers could have forced good out of this wreck all himself alas we are instead guided endure the trials of young man named shane ryan phillippe goingnowhere new jersey teen who gets job in the club thanks rubells homosexual impulses it is here that he meets his friends the array of uninteresting characters his coworker greg brecklin meyer his wife anita salma hayek and of course the love interest julie black neve campbell shane is just an innocent young fool in the beginning and he has reasonably sturdy home life some of the scenes his father border on interesting while heather matarazzo who plays his sister pushes phillippe off the screen but he decides envelop himself in the disco scene and succumb peer pressure and drugs why his friends push him into drugs is never really explained but the fact that they are friends is questioned only is superficial ways greg gets really mad at shane because he is been elevated bartender status there is not single conflict that takes center stage except that shane has some kind of unexplored reservation the business in he works most of the is dumb and most of the dialogue is inane there is scene late in the in shane confronts julie black and in the next scene they are arminarm without bit of development then they are kissing in bowling alley this is five minutes of material thrown into the picture at the last minute well past the onehour mark and this is not long begin campbell is talented actress but she needs role that gives her little depth this one does not and phillippe has almost no presence whatsoever this performance pales in comparison mark whalbergs starmaking role in boogie nights he seems dumb and misguided and his voice never changes tone guess he was picked for the color of his hair and the shape of his body but he seems pretty lanky me he is all wrong for lead role but it does not help that christopher has forgotten develop his characters the end of shanes most notable trait is his stupid fake accent the rest of the performances are wasted hayek is an energetic talented young actress and does almost nothing here meyer is endearing but allowed be no deeper than cardboard only myers sheer force of talent manages rise above christophers wadingpool of script rubell has been written just as depthless as the rest of the characters but myers is good enough inject subtleties that help round out the performance in fact myers is the sole reason see and all it really does is make you wish that the had revolved around him have read that studio has been recreated down the last detail frankly do not care it is easy recreate something technical like this fairly skilled production designer and few carpenters can manage such task besides christopher keeps the lights so low that the sets are invisible anyway aside from myers performance is complete failure it is dull perfunctory uninspired and boring some may find my comparisons boogie nights unfair but they are so obvious me in any event is pallid without the contrast it does not even work as mindless entertainment it is so shallow that the most escapist viewers are likely dismiss it so do not forget those key words dull perfunctory uninspired and boring everything else said was just padding

an experience like baby geniuses can have certain effects on an average moviegoer you may be scarred for life after seeing this petrified piece of garbage is so disarmingly horrible that it may cause you ponder it is existence when think of the screenwriters behind this picture room full of monkeys the monkeys are pounding on their typewriters while scratching themselves all of the monkeys combine their efforts hop in cab and take the finished product downtown director bob clarks office the designated monkey explains the plot jumping up and down on clarks desk while flailing his arms and shrieking the director appears be deep in thought until he slams his fist down on the desktop and exclaims i love it the writing behind this project is embarrassing for your amusement will explain the plot dr kinder kathleen turner and dr heep christopher lloyd are two of the coldhearted executives at the baby geniuses institute where peculiar studies are going on as the story goes there is an ancient myth explaining that babies ages and under know all the secrets of the world from previous life experiences when they move past this phase they become like any other drooling toddler kinder and heep want unlock the secrets using their test babies namely little sylvester sly for short who can break in or out of any given situation so efficiently that he would be right at home on the mission impossible team there is so much crap derived from this premise despite the fact it is virtually identical the plot in look who is talking far superior in any league you will be able determine the quality of the examining the opening scene sylvester has broken out and managed elude several security guards his amazing intellect and kungfu tactics question it is obvious the babies are supersmart but why are they able fight like jackie chan the adults in this are furiously beaten these youngsters in diapers it is shock when writers will stoop this low just draw cheap laughs using john hughes familiar home alone formula also found it disturbing that the babies in this have attitude and endless knowledge quoting numerous movies and insulting their adult captors the effects in baby geniuses similar the talking animals in babe are pathetic the editing is disaster and the jokes are never funny the only reason viewers may avoid vomiting is the argument that the babies are cute suppose they are can admit smiling few times because the babies were cute other instances though was howling in laughter due the inane stupidity of the script there are supporting characters who have no personality whatsoever their entire existence is based on punch lines peter macnicol and kim cattrall as an unwilling couple who have adopted sylvesters twin are both miscast then again do not suppose any performer could handle the uneven material without looking incredibly stupid meanwhile dom deluise plays fellow who gets hit in the crotch monkey wrench hahaha would avoid baby geniuses at all costs instead of watching this would recommended filling your bathtub cement and going snorkeling or perhaps you would consider going diving in sharkinfested waters anything avoid this painful movie the final line in the spoken the bratty sylvester is if they think am doing the sequel for less than mill they are nuts sequel please have mercy

houston we have serious problem after making mission impossible brian de palma has lot live up making an epic science fiction and inviting great cast and talented crew he hopes reach the modern audience and the possibilities are certainly there but the result is great disaster starting in near future prologue copied from apollo de palma slowly builds up his story the human race has already set foot on mars research expedition has vanished without trace on the red planet and another one has been sent find out what happened this is basically the whole plot so it is hard imagine that it can be stretched hours but de palma manages do that it is not very good achievement as we follow this expedition mars and watch them slowly float in space the hardest thing do is stay awake the films major problem is that it tries seem more clever than it is david mamets dialogue while trying seem natural is distant and simply fake de palma and mamet wanted combine action thought provoking plot the result is more like an unsuccessful mutation of kubricks space odyssey apollo and godzilla make time pass the creators have inserted several refreshing scientific details that would not convince halfcrazed frog it consists of multiple copies and direct rippoffs from several great science fiction films and stories when it finally presents an almost original idea it falls flat because of its uncovered stupidity cannot even call this predictable since no one healthy imagination can come up something like this sometimes it gets so cheesy that you will start laughing when you are supposed cry and cry when you are supposed laugh you will see enormous sandstorms hear mysterious sounds and last but not least on this constantly surprising tour you will see an alien it is really hard find comparisons such an experience and know that have never said that before thought never would but lost in space is actually better that is an achievement in itself director brian de palma has stroke gold untouchables that became an instant american classic it is for this that he will be remembered while all his other failures will be forgotten he will live fight another day send the actors my condolences since they truly do try transform into their undeveloped and dull characters and both the cinematography production design and art direction are very decent it is because of the achievement of people that rate this unfortunately their hard work was in vain if you have problems insomnia recommend you this if you are not asleep within the first half hour consult your doctor

gun wielding arnold schwarzenegger has change of heart the films end and becomes believer in god instead of skeptic going through an amazing transformation having christian epiphany in the final scene as he becomes someone who can now beat the devil his faith alone this is after two hours of throwing people out windows and shooting more people than your average serial killer nobody can save this bomb from it is own stupidity and arrogance in filmmaking and arrogance in believing that this is positive religioustype of it is just pile of dreck an illconceived exploitive project pyrotechnical end of days aims be an apocalyptic thriller it features an idiotic script hack director and onedimensional star who is past his prime makes this dumber than dumb plus it is not funny not campy or is it in the least bit entertaining it is just dreary and unwatchable bigbudget slasher arnold plays an alcoholic security guard who finds his new mission in life is stop satan occupying gabriel byrnes body and possessing wall st bank account from destroying the world the opens in vatican city roma where the pope is alerted young visionary priest tomaso looking out at the night sky and seeing comet whiz who proclaims after looking at his scrolls that is the sign for the eye of god reveals that child has been born who is being prepared give birth satans baby the antichrist in the hour before the new century begins when satan will fuck her and open up the gates hell on earth tomaso has some twenty years find this woman and save her and the world from doom but some in the popes circle want kill her if found even though the pope insists on having faith and letting her live as he lectures them even in the worlds darkest days doing evil does not stop evil but brings on more evil we saw the girl being born in nyc in seems be the logical place look for satan according the astrology charts of the visionaries the chosen woman is christine york robin it is now few days before the new year celebration for and arnold and his wisecracking security guard partner kevin pollack are hired guard wall street turd and when he is fired upon renograde priest thomas aquinas arnold saves him and through ridiculous chase captures the tongue less priest who fired the shot he nevertheless can speak and tells arnold an end of days is coming as prophesized in revelations but satan gets him in his hospital room and nails him the ceiling while scribbling latin warnings of the end of the world on his body it is now up arnold save the world and find the chosen woman he quickly finds christine and does everything protect her from all the evil forces around her as the includes ludicrous helicopter rescues people jumping out of windows satan taking piss and dropping match kill arnolds partner as the piss explodes like gasoline satan being fired at resulting in his sometimes experiencing pain and sometimes nothing as if the director forgot way he wants have it there is nothing spared in nyc from fire bombs including the subway churches and luxury buildings the only trouble all these highbudget action sequences was that it lacked purpose and even entertainment value the story was so terrible and inaccurate that it did not have an iota of value or credibility mercifully the movie drags final confrontation in times square trying unsuccessfully build tension the countdown toward the year why is the end of considered be the devils number well satans numeral is actually is upside down of accordingly you just put in front of it and bingo you get logic like that this might even think it pulled the wool over the viewers eyes and got away such febrile explanation of the occult this should become classic used schools in how not make horror highly recommend seeing it for that purpose

after enduring mariah careys debut glitter am reminded of bit from chris rocks bigger and blacker in response women saying that they can raise child without man rock says you can drive car your feet but that do not mean it should be done that say you can give mariah carey movie but that certainly do not mean it should be done sure there are plenty of pop star vehicles out there from the beatles hard days night the spice girls spice world but none have been so vapidly pointless or laughable as glitter everything about this complete tripe is ludicrous start off the story as gruesomely predictable as it is is the least offensive part of the movie the is inexplicably set in the a period piece that really shows no sign of its period except for few chicks in leg warmers worse yet everyones speaking late hiphop slang in what should be meant be partially autobiographical carey plays billie frank young singer in new york who struggles overcome rough childhood and abandonment her alcoholic mother influential club dj julian dice k lucky max beesley playing bad mix of puff daddy and robert de niro hears her sing on track and decides make her star in predictably rapid succession billie and dice fall for each other she starts hitting it big dice gets jealous and starts acting like an ass and suddenly billies on the roller coaster of superstardom in the meantime billie is on an emotional hunt for her missing mom will not give away the ending but honestly just think of unicorns and rainbows you will figure it out the movie screams be made camp and that could have been fun but the filmmakers thought making the bulk of glitter weepy and dramatic would be better what mistake the brief attempts at comic relief as in scene where an effeminate russiansounding director gets wacky filming billies first music video go over like lead balloons instead the audience at my screening tended laugh loudest during mariahs most dramatic scenes brings us the performances of there is nothing good that can be said mariah is primarily seen wideeyed deerintheheadlights look frozen on her face she actually looks scared during her one love scene but you have wonder if the writing is not even worse so much of the dialogue is so hackneyed and watered down for careys virginal target audience that it is probably impossible for any actor pull it off aplomb even the characters could not have been written more absurdly they are all members of barbie playset the important director who swoons billie would love put you in movie am making and the bigtime record executive who takes billies demo tape and says oh will make sure the whole team listens it in the morning everyone in the is device and it is painful keep watching just see another one appear say more would be waste there is so much wrong this and it pains me that mariah carey her ego and sanity in such fragile condition these days as evidenced her multiple hospital stays will have suffer through all the negative reviews she is likely get but then again had suffer through her movie

poster boy for codependency needs patching patch adams review michael redman copyright michael redman mediocrity is pox on civilization in our heavily consumer oriented society there is an enormous demand churn out stuff what would happen our economy if we did not feel the need have more things make us buy more businesses need produce ton of product the sheer volume of items necessitates that most of them are of dubious quality the industry is like any other in order for studios survive they have make money the prevailing attitude is that more films equal more profit some movies obviously exist only put wares on the screen and do that less talented people are used there are not enough great directors and actors create the number of films necessary for some reason it is never crossed anyones mind that the real equation is quality films more profit often mediocre films are more of pain for the audience than the horrendous ones at you can have good time making fun of bad movies am not suggesting that patch adams was tossed out just rake in the bucks my guess is that someone was asleep at the wheel it features an accomplished actor and potentially engrossing story but it is as dull as could be hunter patch adams robin williams desire become doctor has an unusual genesis checking himself into mental institute after suicide attempt he discovers that he can help the other patients clowning around patch could be poster boy for codependency he explains that he likes devoting himself others because then he does not focus on his own problems he decides that he wants be physician leaves the place and couple of years later enrolls in the medical college of virginia as med student patchs antics at the schools hospital catch the attention of his soon be archenemy straightlaced dean walcott bob gunton the dean is so opposed the goofiness that he wants patch kicked out of school although he is one of the top students he writes in patchs academic file that he shows excessive happiness walked into the knowing little about its history and wondered about its odd mechanical pacing there also seemed be no reason that it is set in the early seventies then it struck me it must be based on true story the movie is an adaptation of book hunter adams who founded the gesundheit institute free clinic robin williams is an amazing actor while he is adept at dramatic roles his forte is overthetop free spirits that is what makes his failure here so remarkable patch is exactly the character he should be best at yet even the scene where he and another mental patient are battling fierce imaginary squirrels falls flat something holds him back most of the rest of the cast is twodimensional for that champions seeing patients as human beings it is curious that the ones here are cardboard characters peter coyote as man dying of cancer is refreshing because he seems like real person unfortunately he is in the for only about two minutes the audience is blatantly lead ring in its nose from scene scene we are not left our own emotional decisions we are hit over the head them shavedheaded children cancer an elderly woman whom patch makes laugh beautiful woman who cannot love because of her abusive history when group of students fix up an old house use as clinic in the andy hardy hey let us put on play we can use the barn and my mom can make the curtains mode they laugh and roll around while painting each other there might as well be giant signs flashing feel good now feel bad now patch is good title for the it is patchwork of every manipulative scene you can think of the fulloflife student fights stodgy establishment types there is touching death then there is another the does not trust us get it the first time the dean tries kick patch out and later he tries again worst of all is the final courtroom bit scarylooking old men sit in judgment of man who only wants help people the room is packed patchs supporters williams makes supposedly impassioned speech about the humanity of all it has as much emotion as his earlier statement humans are the only animal that kills members of its own species contains truth most of the blame must be placed the director tom shadyac and screenwriter steve oedekerk shadyac also directed the first ace ventura movie oedekerk directed the second one need say more the real adams is be admired for his devotion treating patients as people rather than diseases the has number of worthy messages about the state of the modern medical business hmos and managed care the doctors are not gods theme will resonate number of people but it is so poorly produced that no one will care

young einstein is embarrassingly lame but that did not stop it from becoming phenomenon in australia where it became the third largest box office hit of all time in the s warner brothers is hoping the movie will follow in the footsteps of paul hogan inxs and shrimp on the barby become the latest rage from down under personally am hoping americans everywhere will rise the occasion and make young einstein box office bomb young einstein sprang from the twisted mind of yahoo serious who not only wrote produced edited and directed the but also starred and did his own stunts his creation is about as stupid and contrived as you would expect from someone named yahoo the movie takes substantial historical liberties in recreating einsteins youth whereas the scientist actually hailed from germany the finds him still living his parents on tasmania remote australian island in addition deriving the formula for energy and the theory of relativity albert invents surfing bubbles in beer and the electric guitar yahoo plays einstein as naive and unrefined country hicka clown an insatiable curiosity although yahoos performance is at first endearing the onedimensional characterization loses its novelty faster than you can say emc yahoo has created charming family for albert and the scenes on tasmania are often clever but after the first twenty minutes the movie quickly plummets and degenerates into poor excuse for comedy young einstein is hampered its lethargic pace and inane plot yahoo must be an mtv addict because his movie features an omnipresent soundtrack unfortunately the music is altogether gratuitous and quickly becomes overbearing almost every other scene includes blaring rock song that leaves you wondering whether you are watching movie or music video the instrumental score on the other hand is generally playful yahoo uses such classics as the overture and the theme from the good the bad and the ugly great comic effect halfway through young einstein knew for sure the movie was stinker but it was not until the very end that finally put my finger on why the comedy takes its roots not from whimsical fantasies such as young sherlock holmes but from cheesy primetime sitcoms in fact young einstein might have been more at home on network television where its sophomoric humor would not raise any eyebrows

this is the last carry on its almost intact regular cast and it is the swansong of hattie jacques and sid james dick turpin sid james and his gang includes harriettharry barbara windsor and tom doc scholl peter butterworth terrorise the countryside staging highway robberies stand and deliver owing the increased occurrence of turpins robberies captain desmond fancey of the bow street runners kenneth williams and his sidekick sergeant jock strapp jack douglas visit turpins area of influence bring him justice they are under the express orders of sir roger daley bernard bresslaw their intellect does not count for much and when they increasingly become suspicious of reverend flasher aka dick turpin sid james whom they confided in earlier they still cannot believe that the rector has any part in these robberies however once they catch harriett and put her in jail and sir roger daley takes complete charge it seems that there is no hope for dick turpin then again sir roger has assigned the dimwits fancey and jock strapp aswell as the old dithering constable kenneth connor keep an eye on their prisoner there is no doubt that this is sid james carry on movie he excels in double roles as in carry on do not lose your head and his performance as flasher and turpin is hilarious barbara windsor is also funny as harriett the sex mad housemaid and member of the gang and hattie jacques small but effective role as the rectors housekeeper martha hoggett is played perfection jack douglas plays milder version of his excruciatingly annoying onscreen persona and kenneth williams is given rather mundane part peter butterworth is not allowed shine in his boring performance as tom and bernard bresslaws character appears only briefly in the the only notable performance from the support cast comes from joan sims as madame desiree who is travelling around the country escorting her starlets the birds of paradise and sporting fake french accent when her girls and her are robbed turpin she is determined catch him and helps the reverend find the culprit carry on the numbers this movie is only notable for the great performance sid james in his last carry on movie the jokes are bluer the script is poorer it is the last script written talbot rothwell but the music is marked improvement although nearly all the regulars appear they seem be just going through the motions none of the high spirits of the earlier films are apparent here just selection of crude jokes and repititive doubleentendres

one of the first films of is this mtv pictures release marks the first leading feature role for james van der beek the star of the wbs runaway hit dawsons creek following in the foot steps of mtvs two other live action films joes apartment and dead man on campus varsity blues is bad and is unlikely cause much of sensation in the marketplace set in west cannan texas the examines the small town obsession high school football through the eyes of second string quarterback john mox moxon van der beek we know he is smart because he reads kurt vonnegut instead of the playbook coach bud kilmer jon voight has been around so long there is actually bronze statue commemorating him the star quarterback lance harbor paul walker is handsome blonde hero who has his own billboard in his front yard and dates the sexy head cheerleader darcy ali larter also on the team are an enormous guy ron lester some health problems and the token africanamerican team member eliel swinton whose only real dialogue scene deals directly the color of his skin when lance is seriously injured mox gets his chance shine and he runs it undermining kilmer his unusual playing strategies his relationship his dutiful girlfriend jules amy smart is threatened and there is big game at the end guess who wins nothing about varsity blues is inspired and the whole simply moves through the sort of conventional motions that coach kilmer would love there is chance for some smart satire on small town obsessions but the humor here is decidedly lowbrow van der beek does decent job of carrying his first although silly accent trips him up sometimes also the role is not very much of stretch from his dawson leary character he is still pseudointellectual whiny nice guy except here he also happens be jock voight is terror as he chews up every single piece of scenery and spits it out the other adults are all notably awful while the younger performers do not fare much better on the positive side walker is charismatic actor who is due for breakout role following this and his supporting turn in pleasantville scott son of james caan has some lively moments as tweeder the teams wild man larter as gorgeous seductress looking for one way ticket out of texas gets show off the films most interesting costumes including very eyeopening whipped cream bikini it is interesting note that the definitely earns its rrating lot of harsh language alcohol abuse and an unusually high amount of nudity including gratuitous trip strip bar that reveals not very surprising surprise all this is likely come as shock the young female fan base of dawsons creek presumably the target audience for the picture director brian robbins previously helmed the kids feature good burger from nickelodeon films sister company of mtv and changes directions here bit but still fails make much of an impression the look of the movie is as bland as the town and characters who populate it the football scenes are generally unexciting and the entire looks bit washed out there is an ok soundtrack featuring music from collective soul foo fighters green day and aaliyah but it is not as impressive as one would expect from mtv

susan grangers review of americas sweethearts columbiasony what waste of talented cast billy crystal and cowriter peter tolan have concocted sly provocative premise and as the opening credits roll it is obvious that they are attempting an oldfashioned romantic comedy the story involves veteran publicist billy crystal who is summoned orchestrate press junket in las vegas when an arrogant director christopher walken holds megabuck movie hostage in his editing room refusing show it anyone he figures that giving the journalists juicy hints of possible reconciliation between the films oncemarriedbutnowestranged stars gwen and eddie catherine zetajones john cusack they will be so distracted that they will not remember they did not see the movie or it was not what they expected and crystal thought of this long before sony exec concocted the phony criticdavid manning quote scandal for help he turns gwens personal assistantsister julia roberts but the laughs are few and farbetween crystals glib cynical flack is not wickedly funny enough few amusing oneliners after six months under the care of depak chopralike guru alan arkin cusacks characters too emotionally fragile lacking the necessary charisma zetajoness vain narcissistic diva is undeveloped and onedimensional only hank azaria as zetajoness muchmacho spanish lover and stanley tucci as studio exec and roberts manage whip up any farcical froth basically we do not like these egodriven stereotypical characters let alone root for them unwind their romantic entanglements and joe roths direction is predictable formulaic and telegraphic on the granger movie gauge of americas sweethearts is contrived shallow as screwball satire it is strictly superficial

susan grangers review of jeepers creepers mgmua entertainment this nasty little horror begins as bickering brother justin long and sister gina philips are driving through the desolate countryside on their way home from college and spy man dropping wrappedup bodies down drainage pipe when long decides investigate there is nothing but trouble you know the part in scary movies where somebody does something really stupid and everybody hates them for it well this is it philips warns what he finds in the basement of an old abandoned church is dying boy horrifying jaggedstitched incision from his neck his navel plus hundreds of other mutilated bodies stitched together on the walls and ceiling like disgusting tapestry long flees but now the monstrous winged creeper jonathan breck is after both of them eileen brennan appears briefly as the cat lady and patricia belcher is jezelle psychic who explains the evil creatures bizarre feeding habits on the granger movie gauge of jeepers creepers is fiendishly visceral an extraordinarily gruesome conclusion giving new meaning the old song jeepers creepers and now as paul harvey would say for the rest of the story what is more scary than the cruelty of the satanic itself is the fact that writerdirector victor salva is convicted child molester who videotaped himself having oral sex yearold actor in california sentenced three years in prison he served months and completed parole in when salva made powder the story of an albino boy supernatural abilities disney studio executives claimed that they did not know about his prior conviction as pedophile and now once again in this mgmua that fact is conspicuously absent from his press kit bio

this independent written and directed eric bross has the look and feel of all those other troubled bluecollar youth films that have inundated the market in recent times it is hard tell what is independent about this it might as well have been made in or on home videocam it is the debut for the director who tells his personal story about italians growing up heavy new jersey accents and remaining tight each other as they grow into young adults tale could have been rewarding see in the where the mindset of all the characters depicted is grounded but see it in the is different story it is old news the love story between the simple girl waiting get married and her luckless boyfriend turning nasty on her does not mean much since their relationship remained undeveloped the introduction of the wiseguy angle and the loyality among buddies bit are not moving enough emotional experiences or intelligent enough dramatics elevate this above its limited story line despite the tourdeforce performance the star of the adrien brody as ray ray is the only son of lowlevel mobster once arrested for running an illegal casino operation out of his bloomfield new jersey suburban basement ray sr vincent is now trying make go of it running small scale homerepair business his son lives him and works unhappily as shoe salesman dreaming of getting rich quickly so he can open business and marry his longtime waitress girlfriend joanne sybil the title of this refers the shoe size of paul newmanb really has nothing do explaining anything about the you should be aware that there are lot of things about this that do not make sense its constant brainless chatter between the buddies their uneventful growing pains and the despair of their lives make it very difficult feel any empathy for them desperate make his dream come through ray goes loanshark humorously and menacingly played james moriarty and borrows grand bet on sure thing at freehold raceway the horse loses and now ray has big problems as the loanshark comes after him his muscle get his dough there is nothing have seen so far like about ray he is undependable meanspirited and stupid so when his best friend mike gallagher the narrator of the gets chance sleep his girlfriendwho cares the director must be kidding himself if he thinks we do as for rays gambling debt and his dilemma of how pay it off the story is too predictable for anything other than what you would expect happen his buddies the college student mike and the dependable butchie gillan and his old man who he has this lovehate relationship rally his aid and the ends on an obligatory artistic note of ambiguity that seems be the way it is for all those wannabe artistic films as ray is off florida all his lonesome self try put his life together there was just no energy or spark or anything relevant in this superficial keep it interesting though adrien brody showed signs that he could be future star because of his intensity and looks he reminds me of sean penn

come on surprise me stop giving us these poorly written thrillers banal dialogue sketchy characters and plots as predictable as the sunset the always watchable morgan freeman plays detective who becomes personally involved in case involving missing girls personal because his niece is one of the victims it is slobbering psychopath of course but this time there is twist freeman notes that each of the young women who have disappeared are all strong willed assertive and more successful in their careers than the average girl we soon learn that the guy calls himself casanova whose aim is dominate these modern gals imprisoning them in some dungeon and keeping them as his personal harem anyway one of the women manages escape ashly judd and teams up freeman well you know the rest brief glance at the plot silence of the lambs this is constantly being compared the hype merchants may suggest lambs also has fairly predictable story perhaps but that also has superbly drawn characters and smart dialogue so lets not insult great movie taking the comparisons any further okay and as for comparisons seven oh please kiss the girls is based on the novel james patterson and written for the screen one david klass maybe the novel was stinker start but whatever the case it is the writing that is clearly at fault here one these characters have very little say that is engaging or interesting two the script has no sense of humour three while the notion of psychos victims being smart successful women is an interesting twist the execution is not even half as good as the idea thus ashly judd comes across all out of focus instead of being the heart of the story we cannot feel her rage some atrociously written casual exchanges between her and several male characters are supposed remind us that she is the nobullshit type but these conversations barely register and as for freeman kiss the girls is his second dog in year first chain reaction now this for an actor of his calibre this is most worrying young director gary fleder scored hit few years back his quirky pulp fictionesque things do in denver when your dead but what can he do material as resolutely mediocre as this not much and you can hardly blame him there is few wellstaged chase scenes through the forest where the camera whirls dives and jumps and the effect is startling but the script is beyond rescue what hurts most is that continues get away serving up this tripe safe in the knowledge that jaded audiences will lap it up complacency rules it is been so long since we saw mainstream american thriller that delivered juicy characters real surprises and consistently sharp dialogue the only consolation for this viewer is that my ticket the movie was freebie positive proof that the best things in life are not free

james brooks one of the developers of the simpsons and director of broadcast news returns the big screen this entertaining if slightly flawed comedy nicholson plays melvin udall probably the most horrible person ever on the screen he is racist homophobic and never has good word say anyone so nobody talks him except waitress carol conelly v sitcom star hunt who was last seen in twister naturally udall conelly and gay neighbor simon bishop kinnear who nicholson hates all hit it off in the end like good will hunting and titanic even though the outcome is completely obvious as good as it gets is an enjoyable funny and warm comedy nicholson is hilarious as melvin churning out insults superb relish only nicholson could get away the lines that melvin delivers hunt is also good as waitress carol and easily rises the challenge of nicholson there is also thankfully bit of chemistry between them kinnear as the gay neighbor seems have slightly underwritten role he is more of plot convience than character although his performance is good his character just seems exist help melvin and carol come together in fact the scene stealer is simons dog who is funnier than nicholson but then again pets are always cute on screen providing solid support is cuba gooding jnr jerry maguire and yeardly smith who is the voice of lisa simpsons in the simpsons although gooding is not as good as is character in maguire he is still fun he overacts little but not so much as be annoying smith is also good although she has fairly small role even director lawrence kasdan body heat makes an appearance as doctor but this is primarily nicholsons and every scene he is in he is steals it he is character is so hateful though it is amazing that anyone talks him at all especially carol and this is the films main problem it is totally unbelievable that carol would ever consider liking melvin she does not fall in love him naturally the forces her fall in love him also melvins character seems go too nice too quickly would doubt anyone character like melvins would be able turn back nice loving person it would take helluva long time much longer than this would like make out brooks direction is good though if bit average but he usually manages get an emotion out of the audience he handles the comedy scenes better than the sentimental ones he tends pile on much schmaltz but generally he is good there is also nice soundtrack veteran composer hans zimmer but generally as good as it gets achieves what it sets out do is make the audience feel good the end of the movie the movie is bit overlong but nicholson is such good fun that the running time passes pretty quickly overall as good as it gets is fun movie even though it may be unbelivable and certainly worth seeing if just for jack nicholsons performance not quite as good as it gets pardon the bad joke but still good fun

after stylistic detour mrs parker and the vicious circle despite its uncomfortable tone was close being conventional movie director alan rudolph has returned his unique brand of making afterglow romantic black comedy about love betrayal and selfabsorption while these may not be the most unusual themes fashion into motion picture rudolphs atypical approach the characters and their situations makes for an intriguing if not always pleasant movie it is said that rudolph is polarizing director meaning that most viewers either love his work or hate it until mrs parker had not been overly impressed his movies found equinox his last pre mrs parker effort be irritating and frustrating was somewhat surprised therefore discover that liked afterglow there are several reasons for this but the paramount one is that rudolph seems have muted some of the most strident mannered aspects of his approach the characters here are more like real people genuine problems the story is absorbing and the acting is topnotch in short rudolph has created world that it is worth spending two hours in afterglow introduces us two unhappily married couples jeffrey byron jonny lee miller is cold seeminglyheartless businessman who is sexually indifferent his young wife marianne lara flynn boyle for her part marianne is so obsessed having baby that she never attempts interact her husband on human level all she is interested in is seducing him during those few days when she is ovulating after he refuses make love she decides find someone else play the role of sperm donor the other couple lucky nick nolte and phyllis mann julie christie are an older pair but they are no more content than jeffrey and marianne mysterious fracture in their past relationship has driven them apart they remain married as matter of convenience but since phyllis will not allow lucky touch her they have an unspoken agreement whereby he can fool around as much as he wants provided that no lasting bond is established as result of these affairs the landscape of emotional pain between them is palpable the four characters begin interacting when marianne hires lucky as handyman fix up the inside of the apartment she shares jeffrey the two of them are immediately attracted one another and it does not take long before they are lounging together naked in her pool meanwhile jeffrey who is captivated older women runs into phyllis in hotel bar is smitten and invites her accompany him on weekend retreat the mountains the romantic couplings of the characters are interesting in that they illustrate the multiple faces of love sex means something different everyone jeffrey it is an unpleasant chore loss of control marianne it is means maternal end lucky it is an enjoyable distraction that blocks out his marital troubles and phyllis it is method of establishing or denying emotional closeness ultimately none of these characters appears love anyone else as much as they love themselves the greatest strength of the lies not in the script but in the performances jonny lee miller is perfect as the selfish callous suitandtie businessman those who recall him as sickboy in trainspotting will find that he is almost unrecognizable here as the image of conformity lara flynn boyle who was not impressive in rudolphs equinox is greatly improved making marianne jumble of sexiness and vulnerability nick nolte is delightful as the uninhibited lucky and he manages deliver some of rudolphs most pregnant lines practiced ease the clear standout however is julie christie who is nothing short of delicious as the worldweary phyllis her often wry occasionally cutting asides are the source of much of the films humor and there is hardly ever moment when she does not steal the spotlight from her costars do not know if afterglow is the convert rudolph detractors but it seems that this movie is little more accessible than some of the directors earlier productions enough of his trademark style remains however reassure his supporters afterglow is basically fourpronged character study the plot is not especially compelling but the character interaction is and that is the real reason see this motion picture rudolph has painted an able picture of the nonromantic side of love the one that has more do tolerance and familiarity than affection and attraction

the fugitive is probably one of the greatest thrillers ever made it takes realistic believable characters and tells an exciting story that is totally believable throughout this is not an overthetop action flick for the sake of action this is an intelligent adventure story real sense of mystery it and it works perfectly harrison ford stars as dr richard kimble man who is wrongly accused and convicted of murdering his wife the entire premise of the story revolves around this murder but is not told in straightforward manner we constantly see flashbacks the murder from kimbles perspective hints are dropped from various times of the night kimbles wife helen sela ward was murdered we do not get see who the killer is until much further into the story in fact we might even have little doubt about kimbles innocence ourselves the does not spend much time on the details of kimbles trial and conviction as it is not the point of the story one of the greatest action scenes ensues as we get botched escape attempt his fellow inmates leads fantastic train wreck but it does not at all seem gratuitous or formulated it is actually suspenseful watch this movie is so incredible because it is able take elements like these and make them wholly original and believable tommy lee jones almost steals the show as deputy sam gerard u marshall who is an expert in hunting fugitives from the moment he appears we know huge game of cat and mouse is about occur kimble and gerard are equally matched as there is no way tell how one is going outsmart the other most of the deals richards complex investigation as he tries find the onearmed man who killed his wife ford does not have lot of lines here so it is stuart and twohys script and daviss outstanding direction that make the as great as it is just watching richard use his keen intelligence and wits disguising himself and doing his own detective work is very interesting we know just as little as he does as why his wife was killed so as he learns more so do we meanwhile gerard and his staff are using all their skills hunt him down at one point they run into each other and great chase ensues but richard is just too smart for them he leaves clues for gerard show his innocence and help him solve the mystery one of the greatest charms the is its sense of humor there is great sense of comradeship between gerard and his two closest deputies cosmo renfo pantoliano and biggs roebuck they are trying catch what they believe be dangerous murderer yet they constantly start up small talk each other making funny wisecracks and oneliners but not in any kind of distracting manner the final act concludes another terrific chase richard figures out who the killer is and confronts him and although we get typical fight scene the case is far from solved the man who ordered the murder has been under our nose all along and we do not realize this until the end when both richard and gerard put the pieces together maybe the finally scene is bit much but it still has believable atmosphere it we are so relieved when justice is served it is not the plot is that makes the fugitive great it is all the motions the characters go through make for an intriguing story watching seemingly average man go through as much as this is what makes the movie so adventurous if only could produce more movies like this see also nick of time

i think that any competent member of the human race who is ever seen movieany moviecould probably predict just about every turn in the wedding singer even though try very hard not predict films as am watching them especially not romantic comedies the plot of this particular just advanced before me seconds and sometimes minutes before actually saw it happen on screen but do not care not even little my reasons for this are simple adam sandler is great drew barrymore is great the movie is so funny there are parts that left me gasping for air because was laughing so hard have not laughed this hard in movie since austin powers sandler plays robby hart wedding singer who once had dreams of being in rock band and writing his own music in the opening scenes he seems like happygolucky wedding singer
