at least partially enjoying his profession and doing rather good job of talking down really drunk individual steve buscemi who decides that his brothers wedding is good place tell the whole world that his life up that point was utter pointlessness week later at his own wedding he is left standing at the altar his exfianc linda angela featherstone his life in complete disarray he meets julia barrymore waitress she is engaged glenn matthew glave and is marry him in about three months julia and robby become good friends when she enlists him help the wedding plans soon and predictably it becomes pretty clear that glenn is jerk and that robby and julia really love each other oh sure it is trite and if anyone making this expected us like feel suspense or something while watching the wedding singer then they truly underestimated their audience what makes the story bearable aside from the terrific costumes and music are the performances barrymore is simply adorable here have never seen her look so close the way she did in et not only is she pleasant look at but her acting job here really is good oneand it does not hurt that the character is likable and adequately wellwritten and the jerk played in fullforce graves is just as despicable as any villain in any romantic comedy have ever seen naturally the true star here is sandler think the guy is flatout hilarious he can say something that just is not funny and his delivery makes me laugh his comedic performance here equals that of happy gilmore but in this he goes much further and proves me that he can indeed hold his own as leading man in romantic comedy whereas his roles in his previous films kind of had sandler playing sandler the wedding singer gives him character that for the first time he actually has fit into as far as am concerned he succeeded and this is testimony that he does in fact have some range in his talents and the movie is just so funny perhaps the best moment is when he sings song for julia that he claims is little uneven because he began writing it while in good mood and finished it after his fianc abandoned him this is the part that literally had me groping for breath of air and while the like all romantic comedies takes hiatus from laughs towards the end because the plot has finish up there are more than enough truly hilarious moments in the first hour that make up for any slumps in progress during the second half my formal complaints for the wedding singer are not very important the is predicable but who cares the characters are extremely likable the movie is ridiculously funny and the experience is simply enjoyable in addition this cannot imagine anyone seeing the preview and not wanting see the in that order conclude that it is pointless for me even have written this review just want everyone know that laughed lot

based on the boris karloffs classic the same name the mummy starts off the highpriest of osiris imhotep who murders the pharoah for his mistress and is punished being mummified in the most horrifying way possible bandaged up having his tongue removed and being covered in flesheating scarab beetles then entombed all while still alive recap few thousand years later where soldier named rick played brandan fraser aids young historian named evelyn played rachel wiesz and her brother jonathan played john hannah in finding the book of amon ra in the process inadvertently freeing the mummy problem is that the mummy wants revive his mistress using evelyn as sacrifice walking in relatively low expectations thought this movie was actually pretty good the visuals and cgi are astounding and obviously not cheaply done at all they pack ton of detail into the images especially during scenes involving mummies rendered completely cgi the computer special effects makes for some brilliant scenes such as unnerving moments involving flesheating scarab beetles and moments where the mummy goes after the people who freed him after all those who took his artifacts are cursed unfortunately the attempts be way too much in such short span of time becoming tug of war for control between genres on one hand it is fast paced action on the other it is frightening horror and on the side it is hilarious comedy ideally for it be successful the would have focus on one the more action oriented aspect one character serving as the comic relief that would be johnson the problem this is that it has at least three characters serving as comic relief rick occasionally delivering his witty oneliner if they were trying make horroractioncomedy it would have helped if it were established early on in the but unfortunately the backstory of imhoteps entombment that would be impossible and then there is the slapstick fight scene between swordwielding rick and an army of mummies while really well done it had the feel of slapstick comedy replace the sword chainsaw and you would effectively have ash fighting zombies in army of darkness while entertaining and funny it feels really out of place but at least it is break from the naive heroes that brendan fraser has been playing lot of on the whole the movie is pure popcorn fare from beginning end entertaining the audience but must end my review plea movie theatre owners turn the sound down while lot of theatres have good sound systems my ears were almost ringing as walked out of the theatre the sound is particularly irritating and will make you crap your pants if you are not careful when they were showing the trailer for the upcoming schwarzenegger end of days it was so loud could not make anything out

on rewatching italian writerdirector dario argentos much lauded murder mystery tenebrae was struck more than anything else how many sins he commits as storyteller and manages get away in emphasising style over matters of plot argento is somewhat notorious in cult circles but some aficionados still praise tenebrae as the greatest of his giallo murder mysteries while it is certainly not perfect repeated viewings reveal it be nonetheless densely plotted and terrifically stylish thriller the story follows promotional visit rome famous american mystery novelist peter neal anthony franciosa where he discovers that serial killer is on the loose inspired his latest book tenebrae the police on his back for leads he decides take personal interest in the case and he soon becomes drawn into mystery where all is not as it seems the benefits enormously from fine central performance franciosa he brings grace charm and deceptive benigness his character provides an interesting foil both the violence of the books he writes and the unfolding reallife horror around him the is awash fascinating psychosexual tension argento peels back the facade of showbiz and jetset lifestyles reveal an amoral ambivalent shadowy world where desire in all its forms has become dangerous business tenebrae is perhaps the most multilayered of argentos scripts date and there is much bubbling underneath the surface here it may take at least two or three viewings appreciate all the psychological themes at play in that respect it strongly recalls his previous giallo deep redprofondo rosso the fulllength italian language version and fans will enjoy spotting the recurring themes needless say for argento fans there is no denying the directors brilliance as stylist many of the action and murder sequences are directed his characteristic finesse and feature plenty of intriguing camerawork they are all the more impressive for the fact that in this argento creates mood filling his scenes light rather than the dark shadows and deep rich colours of earlier works like deep red and suspiria instead tenebraes set design and lighting paints sleek clinical chilly vision of vaguely futuristic urban world and the soundtracks mix of electronic atmospheres and gothic rock frequent argento collaborators goblin is the perfect accompaniment so tenebrae has much recommend it no question still constantly nagging at the back of this viewers mind is several lumps in the narrative some critics argue that logic does not matter in argento films but damnit it matters in all films the point where viewers do not deserve feel cheated the way if you do not want know the solution the mystery then skip the next three paragraphs about an hour into tenebrae the story takes an unexpected twist properly handled could have proved ingenious we witness the murder of the serial killer himself man who we later discover is none other than the author peter neal he is insane apparently the murders then continue for the remainder of the as neal decides it is time settle some personal business involving his neurotic wife he is finally revealed us as this second killer in the films bloody climax but argento muffs the twist both technically and narratively you see we are supposed be tricked into thinking that during this scene peter neal is actually an innocent witness who was crouching in the bushes nearby the whole time and spying on the killers house but thanks poor editing its had believe neal could have murdered the killer anyway bad cutting puts the timing way out in other words he is almost in two places at once during this crucial scene we are also thrown ridiculous red herring the films end you realise that for the sake of an alibi neal must have selfinflicted nasty injury in this earlier scene make it look like he was attacked fleeing assailant the injury he banged himself on the head bloody great rock thus the revelation of the hero as killer and antihero in the final scenes may still prove shocking but its all somewhat implausible the time the end credits have rolled helpfully in the end we do learn that the bizarre flashbacks of personal humiliation and murder that have permeated the belonged neal all along but there too is problem as the explanations offered for his motivations are psychologically fuzzy say the least the story owes us better understanding of franciosas mind his concealed madness and his sudden murderous rampage tenebrae is also marred annoying little inconsistencies for instance teenage boy and girl leave hotel room and minutes later we see the girl riding off on the back of motorbike we would assume the rider is the same boy but it turns out be some male character we are not even introduced too that is careless filmmaking pure and simple why you may ask do go on about the storys flaws because when it comes visuals and set pieces argento is one of the most exciting filmmakers in the world take one of the extended scenes in tenebrae an upset girl wandering the streets at night needlessly taunts guard dog the point where almost unbelievably it jumps high fence and chases her across town finally as she desperately seeks escape from this crazed canine she accidentally stumbles on the serial killers lair it is an absolutely masterful sequence tense and exciting and communicating wealth of information through visuals alone and that is exactly the kind of thing that makes the flaws so frustrating too often it seems argentos films as whole are less than the sum of their impressive parts mind you if you love murder mysteries then tenebrae is still worth look and if you are fan of argentos unique style of giallo thriller then it is essential see the uncut widescreen version if you can and drink in some of the wonderful cinematography luciano tovoli it is stylish greatlooking and quirky despite the problem narrative shame because it does not have be that way take argentos more recent stendhal syndrome where the aid of cowriter franco ferrini he fashioned solid storyline without sacrificing any of his surreal weirdness or visual panache proof that he can do it if he tries

as any sociologist will attest your childhood and the types of parents that you have will heavily influence your happiness as an adult parents that are supportive and environments that are nurturing will yield children who will embrace the values and norms that can allow them live healthy and productive lives but if your upbringing is marred violence hate and dysfunctionality then your journey towards happy adulthood will be saddled psychological obstacles almost too great overcome affliction explores how man never truly escapes the grip of an unforgivingly nightmarish childhood the man in question is wade whitehouse nick nolte here is man who is like any other citizen on the surface he is productive member of the community and goes about his daily routine much like you and me but as you scratch beneath the surface something scary and evil begins rear its ugly head we see that he is meantempered person he has hard time taking control of his emotions usually gets the better of him he is quick apologize for his actions and wants be gentle person but something is sparking tendency towards violence he also has tremendous problems relationships he is divorced and his only connection love is his daughter but his bearish persona and stature alienates her he is visibly shaken her rejection even though she says that she loves him his demeanor also puts his relationship local townsgirl sissy spacek at risk she tries remain true him and supportive but for women unlucky enough attach themselves this kind of person relationships will ultimately end like sentences ending an exclamation point finally he is spiteful and vindictive as rejected father he initiates custody battle that seems hopeless as the towns only police officer he issues speeding ticket man whose father has just died we can see that this is man that is both afflicted and living pain he is prisoner and slave it he is moving towards level of madness and insanity that defies comprehension what kind of force can move man the edge of his emotions and beyond the reach of people who genuinely care for him we learn that the answer is his father james coburn this is the kind of father that every son would be ashamed have and that any woman would be afraid meet he is an overbearingly misogynistic and frequent drunk who rules an iron fist we see his tyrannical behavior through flashbacks heighten the fathers churlishness the flashbacks are shown as home video footage taken very frightened person very effective today wades dad is quite elderly but still manages instill fear into grown man the influence that the father possesses is inescapable and its unsavory effect clamps down hard on the tortured wade the result is every sons nightmare becoming like the father that one has always dreaded be this is terrifically presented piece of psychological drama and nolte turns in strong performance as man whose pain seems become detriment as well as necessity he is hulking person who is still reduced whimpers when in the presence of his father coburn displays heft as the bitter dad but it is most certainly not saturdaynightfriendly fare there is nothing light or fluffy about this that may turn many moviegoers away but it is certainly worth noting that this is wellacted drama showcasing noltes and coburns raw acting talents

is evil dead ii bad movie it is full of terrible acting pointless violence and plot holes yet it remains cult classic nearly fifteen years after its release explaining why this movie stands out from others similar plots including the original evil dead is extremely difficult well what is it about five people stranded in log cabin in the middle of nowhere struggling survive vicious attacks from variety of ugly hairy wart covered monsters come on saw movie just like that on monster vision last week why should see it again no evil dead ii is different it is funny it is funny see people die are you sick or something maybe am and maybe director sam raimi is as well create such an enigma of movie his unique execution is as sarcastic as subtle as disturbing as it is hilarious an example of raimis odd approach monster formerly protagonist ashs girlfriend of all people is cut in half chainsaw and tidal wave of blood comes from the open wound sure it is overthetop but it is so overthetop that it is laugh out loud funny just try watching ash straight face as he unexpectedly is showered ten gallons of blood staining his face and knocking him back few feet the whole movie is like this watch ash get beat up watch ash defeat the monster watch ash get beat up again another even zanier monster the more repetitive and unrealistic the movie gets the more amusing it becomes no matter how sick it may sound it is funny watch bruce ampbells ash get his butt kicked every five minutes and raimi takes advantage he has ash tormented the head of his girlfriend the body of an old lady even his own right hand like the less superior idle hands we watch ash uncontrollably hit himself over and over again until he is forced cut off his own body part but it does not end ash now has fight his severed hand now moves the same celerity as thing from the addams family all of these events thrown at you from minute one roller coaster like camera movements at first become shocking then inexplicably funny raimi expects the audience laugh and as the progresses he seems be enjoying himself even more borrowing the classic mirror scene from the marx brothers duck soup then bringing more characters into the picture comically kill them off running time of less than an hour and half raimi gets away the impossible making horror more gore than plot and intentionally more laughs than scares ending evil dead ii an opening for the third in the series raimi obviously had lot of fun making this movie and could not wait make it is sequel

it is rather strange too have two computer animated talking ant movies come out in single year but that is what disney and pixar animation latest represents while bugs life is not nearly as deep as it is predecessor dreamworks antz it is just as funny bugs life centers appropriately around the life of an ant named flik flik cutely voiced newsradios david foley hates sticking too tradition and attempts too find new ways of harvesting food and other task when one of his inventions causes the offering too be completely lost the leaders of the colony send him out on mission too get him out of the way the offering is food that vile group of grasshoppers force the ants too harvest for them the leader of the grasshoppers is hopper who is fiendishly voiced oscar winner kevin spacey when the offering is lost hopper is very upset and he vows return shortly too retrieve double the amount of food when the leaders of the ant colony send flik out on his mission they never dream he will be successful they just hope they can get him out of the way so they can harvest the extra food fliks mission is too hire some warrior bugs too fight off the grasshoppers when they return instead flik accidentally hires circus performing bugs who he mistakenly assumes are warriors when he returns the warriors the town is ecstatic until they find out the truth about their heroes bugs life has animation that is simply stunning the sheer uniqueness of the day day bug life is very imaginative together the great voice acting this is the perfect holiday family its main weakness is that it could not beat antz the theaters making it seem like stale material

not since oliver stones natural born killers has there been movie this incendiary and not since david cronenberg has socalled mainstream director been this willing repeatedly tiptoe the fine line between pointed social commentary and outright social irresponsibility while finchers films have never suffered from lack of shock value his major character killings in both alien and seven are fine examples fight club marks the distillation of his pitchblack comedic sensibility see the game into something like definitive statement jack norton acting as both narrator and protagonist is your typical cubicle clone whose disillusionment is amplified seemingly incurable insomnia on the offhand advice of doctor he sits in on grouptherapy sessions for everything from blood parasites testicular cancer here he meets bob marvin lee aday aka meat loaf canceremasculated eunuch profound gynecomastia strangely the release he finds while sobbing on bobs breasts allows him sleep at night at least until fellow grouptherapy tourist named marla singer carter comes along ruin things for him forcing grudging compromise that recalls monty python in its dark hilarity later he meets tyler durden pitt soap salesman decidedly subversive outlook on life one night after his ikea furnished condo explodes do not ask you will just have see the movie awright he is goaded tyler into fight and damned if it does not feel good it is pure raw existence brief moment of clarity and purpose that makes his dreary workaday life pale in comparison he moves into tylers squalid abandoned mansion and they form the titular organization an underground therapy group where men bond bareknuckle savagery and very few rules the first two of are do not talk about fight club armed charisma and an attractive anticorporate philosophy tyler assumes leadership of the burgeoning membership of whitecollar slaves and deadend mcemployees resentment creeps into jacks heart made worse the fact that tyler is also regularly and noisily boffing the hated marla funded frivolous lawsuit tyler begins molding his devotees into an army dedicated mischief and mayhem their initially juvenile pranks like pissing in food and putting spike belts on roads quickly evolve into something more like sedition and jack fears that things have gone sour it is after this point when you are plenty uncomfortable and wondering just how far fincher will go say something original that the uncorks disappointing plot twist it is so contrived and so conventional compared what precedes it that everything follows including the ending becomes far less interesting it is major though not fatal flaw and for director as notoriously unpredictable as fincher it feels like copout fight club is going be misconstrued great many people in the early going it has downright dangerous feel it seems be saying that violence and civil disobedience are good for the soul and this is undoubtedly the message that few moronic punks are going take from it will be mightily surprised if imitation fight clubs do not spring up here and there and will be even more amazed if fincher is not vilified for it the same humorless witchhunters that are currently after oliver stone they need not bother because fight club is less message movie than finchers elaborate attempt at joke tyler durden for all his dionysian allure is really nothing more than the logical and far less hypocritical extrapolation of all those selfhelp gurus who constantly show up on oprah preach their mefirst gospel of selfactualization in this context the joke works but like the latest columbine joke some people will get it and enjoy good laugh and others will not hopefully though their silly moral outrage will not spoil the joke for the rest of us

plot bunch of bad guys dressed up as elvis impersonators rob vegas casino during presley convention the boys eventually get together split the money but as plans change doublecrosses occur dealing and wheeling goes down and the crew set up for the road who is on the up and up who is the real bad guy and who is gonna get bang courteney cox are just few of the questions will be answered the rest of this movie critique the funnest movie that have seen so far this year it is got style it is got tough guys talkin shite and it is got plenty of bullets go around definite hunkahunka burnin adventure guys guy movie through and through and one thatll set your jollies high if you dig on the rough stuff it is not very original it goes on for little too long but costner and russell make it happen as two shitekickin elvis lovers who do not stop till they more or less drop this movies got some pretty intensive shootout scenes one of the coolest robbery scenarios that have ever witnessed featuring several elvises guns blazin and the kings music playing in the background and decent helping of doublecrosses sharp dialogue and funny moments in fact even though the cast is filled many name actors bactors as they might be for the most part most of them do their bit and succeed well in passing the torch onto the next victim but the true glue that holds this together other than the spirit of elvis himself is costner and russell who play their badass characters the sure russells been down this road before but costner surprised me his nastiness guess he is pissed at all the boxoffice bombs that he is been in of late but he sure played great unstable elvis impersonating robber here in the end the bottom line this movie is having fun kickin ass and making sure there is enough bubblegum around chew afterwards and smoke em if you got em folks there is also this one really great showdown scene between costner and cop thatll have you crackin up and lovin it all at the same time the violent scenes in this movie are violent and the entire is wrapped in soundtrack thatll kick your arse from this end of the theatre the next it should actually come no surprise anyone that the director of this movie comes from music video background plenty and mean plenty of camera tricks cuts and edits but for this kind of flick it actually works the is not perfect though it starts off pretty big bang but then pulls way of the gun on us and slows the pace down somewhat in the middle while characters intermingle and disperse was personally kept in the game despite some soft spots and enjoyed the overall ride for what it was as well and did mention that courteney cox looked megahot in the movie no okay well just did coulda done without her whole romance angle but be honest it does not take up much of the is generally covered in blood explosions guts and elvis nods try see how many inside connections the king you can guess of course it is no secret that am quite big elvis fan myself so please take this whole review that grain of salt in mind also like these types of guy movies lot and even though the does not bring much originality the table it does offer pretty coherent story some nice twists and turns humor and big ol helping of whoopass coming straight from costner and russells respective boots probably not for everyone but definitely for those who enjoy the guns the charismatic bad guys and fun if entirely disposable adventure now see how many elvis songs have used pun my way through this phony review below the elvis songs also recommend this movie so whether you are lonesome tonight or any other night remember pack the teddy bear bullets leave your little sister at home bring your bossa nova baby and rock out of that jailhouse cause this movie as not one return the sender really beg of you whether you are stuck in the ghetto or crying in the chapel slap this cinematic ring around your neck and love it tender and no suspicious minds either folks cause got stung this movie mean it really shook me up and unless you are the devil in disguise himself think you will not be able help falling in love this lucky charm either so do not be cruel do not turn away do not curl up your latest flame tonite whether she be hardheaded woman or not and surrender the hound dog of movies that is this it is now or never folks trust me did it my way and the heartbreak hotel of crappy movies that would seen so far this year is far behind me joblo has now officially left the sanity of his mind and this building thank you thank you very much where is joblo coming from get carter heat honeymoon in vegas payback reindeer games reservoir dogs way of the gun

from the commercials this looks like mildmannered neil simonesque tale mary tyler moore baring her bra touted as the highlight instead it turns out be hilarious running in high gear from beginning end the concept is deceptively pedestrian an adult adopted son is looking for his biological parents and encounters eccentric characters along the way the movie demonstrates just how far good script and actors can take mundane idea the son and his wife take off on the search accompanied woman from the agency who located his parents following one dead end lead after another each funnier than the previous they eventually end up in new mexico his real biological parents alan alda and lily tomlin it is difficult condense the mileaminute plot seemingly hundreds of scenes jump on top of each other without giving you chance recover from the last one without giving too much away one of the better episodes involves gay federal alcohol tobacco and firearms agent attempting an arrest while tripping on lsd as his bisexual partner is upstairs licking the armpit of woman while her husband is in the next room seducing their traveling companion and it is all done in fairly clean almost well maybe not exactly family fare manner grand cast tomlin alda moore ben stiller patricia arquette tea leoni george segal interacts in seamless parade of laughs drawing from more hyper woody allen style the succeeds beyond expectations

i am not quite sure how best go about writing this review must admit that was little disappointed barry levinsons political satire wag the dog but in retrospect this has less do the itself than false expectations had going into it quite few of the reviews have read led me believe that this was absolutely hilarious and would make me laugh out loud the whole way through and it did not do that they also led me believe that it would deliver vicious and alltootrue attack on the way the american political media works and it did not quite do that either few of them even suggested that it would prove worthy successor stanley kubricks dr strangelove in the tradition of political black comedy and it most definitely did not do that that said wag the dog is actually very clever satire on the shady manipulations of political figures and those who assist them the story revolves around the attempts of political spin doctor conread brean robert deniro distract the american public from the accusations that the president who is up for reelection in two weeks sexually harassed young girl in the oval office the accusations the script suggests are probably untrue but as brean so pointedly puts it that is not particularly relevant the scandal is likely derail the presidents campaign regardless of its truth or falsehood brean along his assistant anne heche decide contact producer stanley motss dustin hoffman enlist his help in concocting enough propaganda and specialeffects trickery make it appear that the s is going war albanian terrorists and thus propel the president victory on wave of patriotic fervor as said wag the dog is not quite as laughoutloud hilarious as had expected but there are some genuinely funny moments be found here such as when in an echo of familiar movie clich the camera pans out over an urban sunset the strains of uplifting inspirational music then cuts studio reveal that the singing is coming from group of musicians whom motss has assembled perform we have the right fight for democracy another scene shows us how modern editing equipment an actress running across sound stage bag of potato chips can be turned into frightened young girl and her kitten fleeing terrorist attack on her village the most consistently effective gag revolves around the propaganda teams attempt forge fictional war hero out of sgt william old shoe schumann woody harrelson an exmilitary officer who turns out be firstclass psycho of course not everything goes as planned the cia for example realizes what is going on and strikes deal the presidents electoral opponent report the media that the fighting has ended forcing motss and brean come up new angle on the supposed albanian crisis still even the cias involvement the falls little short in terms of making this scenario believable regardless of the official word from the president or the cia would not the major media outlets have eastern european correspondents who could verify that there is in fact no fighting going on in albania the never addresses this question nor does it show the reactions of the american public the news of the apparent war except for few scenes border on the farcical such as when basketball fans litter the court shoes in support of the aforementioned sgt schumann we are apparently meant assume that everyone is buying it there was also an instance towards the end of the in one of motsss forced reinventions of the story seems contradict what he and brean had been selling the public thus far and could conceivably have given the game away these plot holes wag the dog does not quite work as satire of american politics but it does send up the mentality that might lead these kinds of machinations in the first place brean and his advisors never seem concerned that what they are doing is unethical rather they worry about how convincing it will be and whether or not they have enough money pull it off the takes decidely dark turn towards the end as we learn how far they are willing go in order keep the propaganda campaign secret motss and his buddies meanwhile seem completely out of touch the rest of the world and just see this undertaking as another creative project in fact one of the sources of conflict in the is motsss increasing restlessness the idea of not being able take credit for producing the fake war in his mind it is the greatest work of art he has ever created think it is fair say that wag the dog underachieves little bit more attention the public reaction and tighter plotting might have made this into fourstar and classic satire still the issue of an american president using war and patriotism distract from scandals or domestic unpopularity is very real one wag the dog takes the issue one step further and asks what if the war was not even real this premise and the talented cast the still delivers more consistently than most whatever its flaws

the sheer horrific audacity of the nazi plan exterminate the jews of europe is almost incomprehensible people may make documentaries about it for another hundred years and still not understand the organized methodical hatred five concentration camp survivors from the last days of world war ii tell their stories in the last days the first documentary from steven spielbergs survivors of the shoah visual history foundation the five interviewees are linked their hungarian ancestry as the introduction explains even as germany started lose the war the nazis stepped up their extermination of the jews in europe in hungary had the last big population of jews within germanys reach and they became the last target of hitlers final solution each of the five tells his or her story their stories are intercut chronologically starting from normal life in prewar hungary they recall the nazi invasion of hungary being sent work camps and their realization that they were actually in death camps they recall their horrible precarious lives in auschwitz and buchenwald the deaths of their family and friends their loss of hope each recalls his or her unfathomable eventual liberation and finally the last days shows their cathartic pained modernday return their old homes and the camps needless say their stories are horrifying amazing and emotionally draining themselves the stories would be forceful testaments but cutting them in parallel their impact is multiplied five the last days is talkingheads style documentary it is mostly pictures of people telling their stories intercut period photographs and newsreel footage in this kind of movie it is almost impossible get archival pictures from the same time and place being discussed onscreen but director james moll made better effort than most at finding specific or at least relevant images go his subjects narration the liner notes one of the many nice features of this dvd indicate that there is some neverbeforeseen historical footage in the last days it is not clear scene it is it could be one of two that had not seen before both powerful one is rare color footage shot an american of piles of victims in cattle cars there is something jarring something unsettling about seeing the pictures in color when so much of the footage from world war ii is in black and white another segment shows walking skeletons survivors who are so starved that they hardly look human anymore there has been glut of holocaust movies and was skeptical that new documentary would have anything new say but focusing on hungarian jews during the last days of the war moll told specific part of the story in new way in greater detail and am glad he did because his careful filmmaking stands up well compared other movies on the same subject the transfer dvd is rich and beautiful xmozillastatus words for holocaust documentary but some of the interviews take place in europe in late spring when skies are blue and trees are green also the movie was shot on mm and not video so the richness and detail are impeccable the dvds features are plentiful and wellchosen there is theatrical trailer for the movie is great introduction the subject matter there are about fifty still photos both from the production crew and from the private collections of the survivors also the disc has two complete versions of the movie widescreen and full screen both on the same side one of the more interesting dvd features is an outtake segment for each of the survivors plus one for the crew you would think outtakes would be inappropriate in holocaust documentary but they are not bloopers instead they are solid moving segments that were probably cut from the only for length one of them continues confrontation that was only touched on lightly in the renee firestone one of the five spoke on camera dr hans nch german doctor who ran the medical clinic at auschwitz firestone was aggressive questioning the doctor about what his children thought the doctor was evasive and clearly uncomfortable another of the outtakes showed bill basch saying prayer for his dead friends at auschwitz he ends his prayer saying forgive me for surviving it is ambitious shoot documentary on mm it is ambitious make it on subject that has saturated cable television and movies it is ambitious make it years after the events it covers but the last days handles all these potential obstacles very well it is only fitting that the dvd its wealth of interesting and relevant features would also be ambitious and successful

it is easy label something sentimental or tear jerking when one has not experienced the heartache of losing child whether that may be in life or in death after having said that will also say that this movie does all of the above very well one gets that choking sensation in the throat because of grief when one brother forgives another for costly mistake or when husband hugs his wife after long estrangement there is no ocean no drownings and it does not conjure up memories of yet another ordinary people in fact the only thing remotely connected the ocean is probably tap water and the toilet flushing not that this literally happened in the movie so what are the lessons learnt do not take your children class reunions do not leave them alone in the lobby not even for second michelle pfeiffer once again plays the role of highlystrung wife and mother trend that started thousand acres and one fine day my comment is that she is exceptionally fine strung in this movie so much so that when she has nervous break down the veins on her temples bulge impressively whoopi golberg also puts in an understated performance playing lesbian cop name that makes one want reach for lollipop lastly who are the ideal companions for this sort of movie my grandmother comes mind

i know that funnest is not word fun is noun and therefore cannot be conjugated like an adjective but that is the word that came me right after viewing chicken run no wonder this is the kind of movie that reduces you childish expressions like that was the funnest movie have ever seen so hell websters chicken run is one of the funnest movies have seen in while cannot remember the last time have seen anything funner the chickens at tweedys farm are up something living in concentration camplike atmosphere they are led one plucky hen called ginger voice of julia sawalha who continually comes up plans for escape and always gets caught subsequently spending day after day in the coal box one night brash american rooster flies in over the fence calling himself rocky mel gibson famous flying rooster and circus performer rocky promises teach the chickens how fly and the situation grows more desperate as the nefarious mrs tweedy miranda richardson decides abandon the farms eggselling plan for pieselling plan she orders huge piemaking machine cackling chickens go in pies come out what sort of pies chicken pies of course codirector nick park and his studio aardman animation produced three oscarwinning short films creature comforts the wrong trousers and close shave the latter two were the second and third installments of trilogy starring the delightful team wallace gromit man and his dog famous for getting themselves into increasingly peculiar adventures part of what made the wallace films brilliantly entertaining was parks uncanny ability make an old story seem new the wrong trousers for example pulled out lot of old hitchcockian suspense tricks and close shave owed great deal of inspiration classic detective stories but in the hands of park and his team the stories felt fresh and inspired and not the least bit contrived now teaming codirector peter lord park has created similar creature in chicken run the plot is largely lifted from the great escape watch for quick reference the ballbouncing scene some spielberginspired action sequences providing the excitement thing is the does not feel like it is been lifted from somewhere else chicken run feels fresh alive like nothing else ever done part of it is the original idea who in the world came up the idea make prisonersofwar movie starring chickens park and lord milk the incongruity for all it is worth the characters treat their situation as if it were dead serious and them it is but they are chickens so it is funny us another thing that helps chicken run and most of parks films succeed is the animators subtle way of giving nods the very films they are cribbing there are references the great escape obviously and stalag the chase sequence inside the chicken grinder parodies both raiders of the lost ark and indiana jones and the temple of doom there is even nod the blues brothers if you can believe it and the filmmakers even get in little lighthearted ribbing at the expense of their star voice actor taking couple of very subtle jabs at mel gibsons nationality and history the braveheart reference is hoot if you catch it when you consider just how fine line resides between funny parody and redundant one chicken run is downright brilliant in its execution consider this since july of last year have seen dozens upon dozens of blair witch project parodies on television on the radio and online out of all those maybe one or two were amusing the rest tiresome why because once you got past the thought that they are parodying that blair witch movie most of the parodies had nothing offer no insight no original idea no greater purpose they were only funny if you had seen the movie otherwise you got nothing conversely chicken run does not lean on its parodies the references are never the sole focus of any scene if you have never seen indiana jones the chase sequence is still fun even if you have no idea who mel gibson is rocky remains an interesting character park lord and screenwriter karey kirkpatrick realize that an audience does not need parody shoved in their faces before it is understood and as result chicken run is filled visual and verbal jabs that are never too obvious but not quite vague either enjoyment of this movie does not require knowledge of history but if you have got it chicken run is that much richer the voice cast turns in uniformly lively performances and the characters they play are given so many subtle nuances that it is hard not fall in love every one of them ginger is perfect spunky and opinionated but soft heart that forbids her leave her companions behind and julia sawalha known as the cute mousy girl on absolutely fabulous nails it she has warm human chemistry gibson whose rocky hides his personal doubt under brash gungho veneer the characters inevitable romance does not feel contrived but sweet poor mr tweedy tony haygarth suspects the chickens are organizing in some way but his limited intellect prevents him from figuring things out and his overbearing wife certainly is not any help jane horrocks delivers lovely voice characterization as tragically optimistic babs hen that runs away most of the best oneliners all while perpetually crocheting sweater and two supplytrading rats that seem have walked straight out of monty python sketch nearly steal the show during the lively central swingdancing sequence they even come up an inspired riff on something that is baffled scholars and theologians alike for decades the chicken vs egg dilemma one might have expected this inevitable joke come off as wearisome but as most of chicken run it comes as delightful surprise the manages cross all barriers it should be accessible both children and adults brits and yanks rats and chickens the animation is firstrate remember that this was all done the oldfashioned way actual humans moving clay figurines around on tiny set bit painstaking bit and you see just how truly remarkable chicken run really is this movie possesses that same quality that makes pixar studios animation great precise and unwavering attention detail as in such topnotch family fare as bugs life or toy story chicken run has something offer in nearly every frame certainly passive viewer can enjoy it as straightforward story worthwhile moral and some surprisingly touching scenes but active attentive viewers will enjoy it even more because they will catch all the details anyway the movies just boatload of fun funnest damn movie have seen all year

capsule short punchy action sequel the two dinosaur films made steven spielberg joe johnston directs straightforward story of an excursion back the island of the dinosaurs it lets us see some new dinosaurs is that an oxymoron and gives us nice and generally reasonably written adventure the is neither ambitious nor pretentious had good time low here goes my credibility this is on expect be in minority liked the third jurassic park even liked the second jurassic park in lot of ways jurassic park the lost world was creative threeway braiding together of michael crichtons novel the lost world arthur conan doyles novel the lost world and the classic silent version of the doyle jp was an adventure as doyle said for the boy who is half man or the man who is half boy that is what all the jurassic park films are expecting them give the viewer insights into the human condition is like expecting your car vacuum your house the classic adventure films like gunga din or king solomons mines had underwritten characters also jurassic park iii is an all out adventure on an island inhabited dinosaurs the characters are little more complex than they at first appear be and even that is little more complex than was expecting some of the characters who start out looking stupid and useless prove be neither as the proceeds that degree of complexity combined those very realistic looking dinosaur effects is just about as much as require feel got my moneys worth the story opens eric played trevor morgan and friend parasailing near the forbidden island of isla sorna off costa rica this was the research island where the dinosaurs were created for the now defunct jurassic park they hope no doubt get look at the islands dinosaurs from safe height the height is safe but driving the boat in the water is not the two soon find themselves in trouble and have ditch their parasail onto the island where they do indeed get better look at the dinosaurs than they had intended flash the united states and someone is offering fund paleontologist alan grant sam neill in his research if he will go and fly over isla sorna and act as guide he has said that no force on earth or heaven could get him back near real dinosaurs but again money convinces him drop what he is doing and go doing the convincing is wealthy and eccentric couple william macy and tea leoni who has been just about everywhere else in the world and wants the adventure of seeing real dinosaurs they too plan see the island from safe height grant is relieved learn he will fly over this island at safe altitude just this once right guess what happens next jp probably functions better as sequel than jp first it has alan grant and ellie sattler laura dern back rather than the much less appealing ian malcolm sattler has much smaller part in jp but is still present tie this story the first curiously each seems arrange have signature scene characters holding on some large metal object that is about fall some great distance one thing that does not quite fit the earlier films is just as grant discovers that raptors may be able talk each other suddenly they seem be doing it all the time they did not appear be conversing in the previous films of course these raptors look little different also so perhaps they are different related species not only are they more intelligent than in the past films they are also more sympathetic in this story they are not just killing machines they have reasonable motives for what they do beyond nutrition this time around they may be little too anthropomorphized each new in the series introduces us some new dinosaurs of course in this major threat is from spinosaurus not as common or as popularly known as tyrannosaurus but larger and presumably more nasty it has crocodiles head and the body that looks like dimetrodon walking upright perhaps as an economy measure or just create mood the visual effects team frequently obscures our view of the dinosaurs sometimes they just move too fast see occasionally darkness or fog obscures our vision few times we get unconvincing matte shot particularly of the laboratory but there is less money on the screen in terms of dinosaur effects than in the two previous films the musical score don davis borrows heavily from john williamss score for the first joe johnston who directs already has his credit two very good films recommend the rocketeer and october sky team including alexander payne and jim taylor known for election writes the screenplay the they have made is long way from great cinema but it still is fun if you get thrill from seeing what look very much like live dinosaurs alive today the is for you rate it on the scale and low on the scale

just look back two years ago at the coen brothers comedic gem the big lebowski change the actors take away the bowling alley add record store and you have got high fidelity or maybe the other way around since nick hornbys novel high fidelity came first either way it is been done before trio of losers cracking jokes and complaining about their failed romances yet it remains consistently funny why is this maybe because you know your life is much better than this you know these guys are more pathetic than you are and you know its ok laugh at them because they are fictional director stephen frears possibly not intentionally has created movie that makes you feel good about yourself and even that ostensibly no good uncle who watches television twenty four hours day when watching high fidelity expect laugh at someone elses pain realize what you are laughing at and then laugh again laughed at dick todd louiso the shy timorous steve buscemi character of lebowski who seems know what he is talking about but either cannot put it into words or is harshly rejected his friends laughed at the john goodman character barry jack black an exact replica of the comic bookstore owner on the simpsons pudgy egotistic and obnoxious at the same time and laughed at rob john cusack the jeff bridges type whom the story revolves around rob is the character easiest relate but he is nothing like you at all he uncontrollably cheats and lies then is unable realize why he can not hold onto woman and like his other miserable friends pop music is where he inevitably goes for comfort he spends the afternoons at his job quizzing his coworkers obscure trivia or listening new music and either deriding it or praising it whatever human emotions the clash aretha franklin and bruce springsteen records hold rob and co grasp them and help fill voids in their social lives rob has built an extensive collection in his record store as well as his home and he organizes them depending on what mood he is in during this confused stage of his life in the movie focuses on rob is trying cope numerous rejections over the years visiting past girlfriends and eventually asking why they dumped him but these are not any girlfriends these girls made the all time top five break ups in the history of rob robs incessant use of lists show how pop music has played major role in his life the plot in three words is women and music the approach director stephen frears takes having the charismatic rob speak directly the camera is very effective it gives high fidelity quickly paced informal structure adjectives perfectly parallel robs own lifestyle it also helps open the viewers eyes as how annoying barry is jack black steals the show hilariously realistic performance as total sleaze ball just listening him speak for five minutes makes the audience immediately sympathetic for rob who must work him every day of the week what frears does so well is that he makes us feel sorry for rob while laughing at his misfortunes john cusack plays his character convincingly but it is the strong supporting cast consisting of big stars and character actors that really defines rob now instead of rob just talking the camera after he explains something the remaining cast members physically and humorously create what he is trying say the only problem high fidelity is that it does not end when it should have ended instead the movie goes on for torturous twenty minutes that seem lot longer than that also bruce springsteen is completely wasted in brief cameo halfway through the movie high fidelity is cheerful old fashioned comedy voluminous soundtrack and as many laughs just hope keeps creating losers on the big screen they make everyone look and feel great

plot human space astronaut accidentally falls upon planet ruled apes he is taken prisoner along some other humans and tries his best escape his simian captors oh yeah and did mention that the apes can talk kewl critique despite this not looking like tim burton movie or its lead human character showing any signs of being human being himself did find myself generally entertained throughout most of this and do recommend it as fun summer fare although the thing that sets this movie apart from all others is definitely its incredible ape makeup jobs and characterizations mean was completely convinced that every single one of these apes was for real also have give it up all of the actors inside the costumes not only for waking up at three in the morning every day get makeup slobbered all over them for hours but for coming through their costumed exteriors and selling us their characters on the screen as well especially enjoyed bonham carters performance who believed be the most developed character in the entire human or ape and tim roths bad guy who chewed up scenery and oozed evil in every scene in he took part plotwise liked the beginning of the the whole buildup once wahlberg got into the village the escape and most of the fight scenes but once things got out into the deserted area and the final battle sequence kinda lost bit of my interest was much more intrigued the interactions between the characters and the whole idea of human beings as animals then was about the end battle sequence just seemed bit too typical for this kind of also hated the kid character who just got on my nerves and did not really care for the way that the battle sequence was resolved will not ruin it here but cmon guys you coulda thought of something little more plausible than that no but the thing that held this movie back more than anything else was its lead character his cold demeanor and the zero chemistry that he shared either one of his interspecies love interests this dude did not seem give rats ass about anyone but himself and ultimately did not really care about what happened him either now am not sure if this was the fault of the actor or the script but the suffered because of it visually the movie was also nice look at especially the apes but definitely expected greater coolness from tim burton the surprise ending that highlighted the original planet of the apes back in felt little tacked on here and despite being interesting did not really make all that much sense me unless you look at it from sequel point of view so overall loved the whole feel of the planet the apes that ruled it the manner in they treated the humans screamed shouted and reverted the entire evolution chain but did not appreciate the films lack of human character development why was kris kristofferson even in this movie and the fact that its lead male and female humans were just plain boring but would still recommend this as fun summer movie laughs creepiness and really cool premise ps for anyone who has seen the original cannot believe that they did not at least bring back the scene in the lead human character in this case mark wahlberg goes nuts at the world in he is suddenly been thrust this is mad house type of thing the guy in this barely seems be put off the fact that he is surrounded apes who can speak english where is joblo coming from the arrival battlefield earth godzilla instinct mission mars pitch black planet of the apes sleepy hollow

disaster films have tendency be very formulated and very cliched see disaster actual originality or at least decent plot twist would definitely be welcome surprise unfortunately folks it is not likely dantes peak is cliched and at times corny but also pretty decent be honest was not very interested in seeing this and word of mouth as well as several reviews did not make it sound promising so was pleasantly surprised that find that this movie was not bad at all it is pretty run of the mill but it is not something would say is merely ok watch in case you do not know dantes peak is about volcano and the city lives in it is shadow dantes peak who would have guessed eh pierce brosnan plays the volcanologist sent study the volcano and perhaps more hunch than actual scientific proof is determined that the volcano will be arupting in the very near future due the lack of more substantial evidence nobody warns the small town and when they finally do it is in the middle of the town meeting that the volcano finally blows brosnan all around good guy will of course save the day or at least the mayor of dantes peak linda hamilton naturally the two will become infatuated one another if you think just ruined plot development you have not seen very many movies there is also the virtually neccessary kids and pet dog tug at your heart strings and of course the kids or the dog at least one or the other will do something heroic but hey do not want ruin all the surprises if there was part of you that was hesitating seeing dantes peak merely because it was rumored be waste of time urge you watch it and decide for yourself it is not brain food but it succeeds at what it is meant be an enjoyable suspenseful movie about the fury mother nature can unleash

in brief best bleak comedy since heathers full of wonderful swipes at the fifteen minutes of fame mentality that feeds so much of modern american pop culture go see it so prepared for this watching moving interview on hard copy pam smart the new hampshire media teacher who was convicted of engineering the death of her husband back in the hard copy diane diamond asked smart what she thought about nicole kidmans fictionalized portrayal of her in the new die for smart replied that she thought kidmans character came off as dumb vicious tramp and she thought that the publicity the new movie generates might just hurt her chances in her latest court appeal smart was convicted and given life sentence for her part in the murder of her husband smarts got point it would not be the first time that the public took the better scripted and wellacted movie version of an event as the absolute truth over the duller and far less artistic real life version however given choice between the mass media happening of the real event and the fictionalized movie would definitely opt for the later real murderers rarely have dialogue as witty as what buck henry has written for this movie and smart while pretty and alluring is no match for the cinematic charms of nicole kidman die for begins in town called little hope new hampshire the archetypal dry and intellectually barren american suburb the story concerns the ambitious suzanne stone and how she tackles the obstacles between her and her life long ambition of being on tv of course one of those little obstacles turns out be her dull and unambitious husband larry played matt dillon but little imagination some charm and raw sex appeal and rather novel approach junior achievement our heroine manages overcome the naysayers in her life at least temporarily kidman triumphs in the trashy role of suzanne have never really been all that fond of this actress but she shows wonderful flair for comedy in this picture her portrayal of the incredibly shallow and dumb femme fatale resonates kidman knows starmaking role when she sees it and she plays the consciencedeprived suzanne as the ultimate career driven postfeminist ubertemptress from hell she is ably abetted wonderfully demented comic dialogue kidman delivers in unselfconsciously funny way at one point suzanne is expounding on her knowledge of world events her future husband and sisterinlaw you know she knowingly exclaims gorbachev would still be the leader of russia or whatever if he had just had that ugly purplish thing removed from his head her husband beams at suzannes profound knowledge of world politics and then proudly proclaims that this qualifies her be the next barbara walters this is very close pop culture bashing heaven folks the other standout performance in the is delivered joaquin phoenix he plays jimmy burned out teenager who becomes addicted suzannes sexual favors kidmans character vapid though she is is sort of suave beacon of success jimmy and his lost friends russell and lydia winningly portrayed casey affleck and alison folland phoenix looks like the very embodiment of genx slackerhood as envisioned tabloid tv of course his jimmy has the dead eyes and demeanor of kid who knows that he as not going anywhere ever phoenix reacts the sexy suzanne sort of obsessed amazement and he makes us believe that loser character like jimmy really would be willing kill for someone like suzanne someone who actually noticed him gus van sant drugstore cowboy my own private idaho direction is firstrate he keeps the pacing in this notquitethriller snapping along van sant rightly keeps the focus of this movie on the amoral suzanne and does not stop proselytize the audience about the rightness or wrongness of her actions van sant trusts his material and trusts his audience get it without stopping explain what is funny about this allamerican story the screenplay buck henry is absolutely great and includes some of the best bleakly comic lines have heard since heathers henrys story is blast against the shallowness of the american media and the mindlessness of fame yet the screenplay delivers this sharp message focusing on just few characters henry ably manages avoid diluting his story aiming at too many targets and the result is crisp and funny miniclassic danny elfman did the original music for this movie and he delivers another eccentric loopy score that strongly echoes his themes for edward scissorhands either score would make wonderful background music for halloween trickortreat parties allinall wonderful production well worth your seven bucks die for columbia pictures release directed gus van sant written buck henry score danny elfman starring nicole kidman matt dillon joachin phoenix based on the book joyce maynard rated for language and mature themes respect the not for under rating stars go see it

i relish those rare opportunities when talented screenwriter can make me feel like fool spent the first hour of forces of nature slowly stewing over its grim attitude towards marriage grousing myself about its transparently planes trains and automobiles plot machinations and waiting for the inevitable denouement this was mass market romantic comedy after all genre has been taken over teenagers and even in its best days worked hard perpetuate the romance infatuation paradigm then marc lawrence did something wonderful something made the entire click into place he showed me comic love story about grownups it certainly did not look that way from the outset introduces groomtobe ben holmes ben affleck at his bachelor party surrounded friends and family whooping over his last night of freedom ben loves his fiancee bridget maura tierney but the doomandgloom pronouncements of everyone around him have him questioning the meaning of this till death do you part business then on an illfated flight from new york his wedding in savannah ben meets sarah lewis sandra bullock freespirited woman string of failed careers and relationships behind her as transportation troubles thwart them at every turn ben and sarah begin threeday southward journey in their connection grows ever stronger ben seeing in sarah the chances he is never taken and sarah seeing in ben the stability she is never had forces of nature gets off solid enough start setting up the characters and the situations plenty of witty dialogue ben is an ideal role for afflecks easygoing charm and he plays the straightlaced straight man without forced exasperation sandra bullock for her part is more loose and appealing than she has been in her last halfdozen films combined avoiding her recent habit of playing any semblance of character depth as moping the two performances part of great toptobottom cast are effective and connected from the start yet the scripts apparent sympathy the marital horror stories ben hears makes it difficult enjoy the romance completely lively and funny though it may be on consistent basis forces of nature leaves bitter taste that feels like selfjustification the kicker is that those acidic anecdotes serve exactly the opposite purpose leading surprisingly emotional resolution forces of nature is not about man developing fear of commitment it is about man learning what commitment means _to him_ learning that it is not what he thought it was lawrences script feints and dodges before reaching its happy ending an ending is happy because people make the choices that make the most sense earlier scenes that might have felt like throwaways take on more resonance and that bitter taste sweetens into something fresh and genuine though one too many plot contrivances keep ben and sarah together through the and they do exchange the obligatory mutual character analysis of bickering screen couples forces of nature wraps up so perfectly that you will end up remembering the humor and the simple wisdom that is provided you are not put off the ridiculously busy direction of bronwen hughes for brisk romantic comedy forces of nature comes loaded some of the most overdirected scenes of the year teetering handheld shots whynot low or high angles sweeping pans occasionally the hyperreal approach works cinematographer elliot davis creating world of fantasy romance far more often hughes refuses let scene be what it is covering it flourishes so thick you almost cannot find what is underneath script this smart and mature deserved more restrained director but even hughes excesses cannot spoil this unique concoction forces of nature may restore your faith in romantic comedy as something the power enchant something that can make you happy be proved wrong when you expect tale for and about adolescents

warning this review contains some spoilers for the failsafe if you have not seen the yet proceed caution nutshell relevant intelligent suspenseful drama still powerful today even after the end of the cold war failsafe usa drama minutes screenplay walter bernstein based on the novel eugene burdick and harvey wheeler produced max youngstein directed sidney lumet review jamahl epsicokhan the most ironic aspect of nuclear war is that it does not have winning side and losing side in nuclear confrontation everybody loses and the aftereffects have devastating effects that impact the entire worldassuming the world survives the ideaand perhaps the only real optionis avoid war at all costs this is the theme of sidney lumets failsafe fictional drama based on the novel eugene burdick and harvey wheeler failsafe takes place during the heart of the cold war the actual was released two years after the cuban missile crisis when the united states and the soviet union were in static discord over an issue that can be summarized in single word communism the premise centers around combination of accidents and operation flaws five s bombers carrying nuclear warheads are ordered set routine course for moscow after an unidentified aircraft is spotted heading toward america the unidentified aircraft turns out be commercial airliner but mechanical failure strikes the military base that commands the bombers suddenly out of contact and standing orders remain on course until receiving new directives the bomber pilots cannot be recalled and they proceed moscow the intention of destroying it nuclear strike great deal of failsafe plot follows various characters as they attempt devise ways of stopping the s bombers from reaching russias bordersat any cost the plot is compelling and the story creates urgency and dread painting the grimmest of worst case scenarios the reality sets in quickly as one attempt turn the bombers after another fails general bogan frank overton taking orders directly from the president of the united states himself henry fonda is powerlessthe fate of the world lies in the hands of an automated preprogrammed system that may not be stoppable simply because the creators of the war machines were too efficient in their task make nowin situation winnable the events in failsafe are fascinating because they are anything but predictable but the real reason failsafe works is because it understands more about nuclear war than what exists within the confines of its plot key ingredient the is its ability create an ongoing polemic about nuclear war communism the cold war and the united states role in all of it most of this is through the films use of the character groeteschele walter matthau an arrogant civilian theorist of nuclear weapons use who incidentally is on the presidents advising staff for analyzing the statistical plausibility of waging nuclear war many of the films most pointed messages arise from discussions where groeteschele is one of the key voices early in the he hosts dinner party where he explains the importance of strategy in nuclear assault minimize casualties what is the difference between million and million dead guest asks impatiently forty million groeteschele responds wryly the problem groetescheles mindset is that he believes nuclear combat be viable method of war the only difference him between nuclear armageddon and conventional warfare is the raw data and the casualty totals groeteschele realizes that these weapons can destroy the world several times over yet his answer the arms race is not slow down and try cool the situation off as general black dan oherlihy has often recommended on the contraryaccording groeteschele that would lead russia having more nuclear weapons than the s would clearly put america at disadvantage such stance was perhaps the central paradox and misguided practice of the arms race failsafe clearly sees it as one of the central issues of the cold war and likewise it becomes central theme in the why continue build such machines of mass destruction while already possessing enough of them destroy the world several times over is it wise is it even logical no not really although failsafe is more about the issue of nuclear weapons than it is about the political ramifications of communism there is scene in the that deals communism in an intentionally superficial onesided sort of way again this is achieved through groeteschele who is easily the films most important character in terms of the largertheme significance in addition providing the central pronuclear war voice that the warns against he also makes key remarks about communists that show just how much fear and resentment people of the period were prone when it came communism the context the uses suggests that this hatred was often glib one of groetescheles logical trains of thought ventures so far into fantasy theoretical prediction that it is merely absurd he labels the average marxist an unfeeling calculating machine that will do whatever it takes preserve itself groeteschele takes it so far as say that if the s drops the warhead on moscow the soviets will instantly surrender for retaliate would invite countermeasures that would further destroy russias home soilwhich must be preserved at all costs groeteschele seems forget these people are human beings emotions general black quickly reminds him that the soviets would attack out of revengeas any normal person would the irony here is groetescheles own mechanical theorizing he is so quick judge the enemy that he does not even realize his own seemingly programmed thought patterns once the makes it evident that turning the s bombers will be impossible the question becomes what the consequences of destroying moscow will be just how will the soviet unions leader react and what can the president do convey his best intentions just how does one pass off the deaths of millions of people as an mishap the help of his translator buck larry hagman the president negotiates at length the soviet leader in scenes that prove amazingly taut and powerful in their simplicity lumets long takes of fonda and hagman in the same frame exchanging the dialog between the president and the soviet leader without getting into too much detail will say that the compromise they ultimately reach is very costly yet necessary and as sensible as possible under the circumstances that is as sensible as nuclear incident can probably be it does accomplish what it must it avoids an allout war something that simply is not possible because of its alltooreal consequences dramatically the ending is quite powerful and the use of oherlihys character as the symbolic matador providing bookend the ending the story while tying into his dream sequence from the films opening is particularly appropriate failsafe is production of major studio released columbia pictures and it has the structure of hightension suspense thriller that one might expect from nevertheless under lumets direction and walter bernsteins intelligent adaptation of burdicks and wheelers novel the continues have lasting effect even after the events on screen have unfolded the often warns that the automation of war is something that may make nuclear holocaust an unintentional consequence of such mass arming but it was the conscious human choice initialize this automatic arming that failsafe also finds dangerous in retrospect the arms race seems be one of the most puzzling exercises in futility of the century it is just fortunate that both sides were finally able come their senses and slow down rather than continuing groetescheles dangerous approach of speeding up and causing possible meltdown

andrew lloyd webbers musicals preferably his early work lyricist tim rice present musical is totally unlike any musical before its time webber and rice do not subscribe the gaity of such musicals as oklahoma or the slapstickness of shows like funny thing happened on the way the forum they instead tackle hot issues from our past and view them differently and pack them together redundant catchy music as well as thoughtful lyrics like jesus christ superstar examined the rise and fall of jesus in his last days from fame perspective in the cool tune superstar dead judas comes back from the dead ask jesus why he did not spread his message wider evita takes an inventive stance on its topic this time being the famed wife of argentinian dictator juan per eva who slept her way the top and became famous chiefly because she got attention much like the woman playing her madonna although think madonna did rise the top for her musical talent among other things evita deals the rise and fall of eva per a woman who captured the heart of the nation after marrying juan jonathan pryce then died at the young age of creating an international stir of mourning not unlike that of princess di the two do share bit in common although it was not like di slept the top webber and rice sure chose bizarre topics for their musicals but they always have point for doing it here they wish expose her for what she is but still show that despite all of her many drawbacks her lying and covering up for her fascist husband but show that she was still good woman fairly good intentions and her death was very sad it is also musical almost no words not unsung the plays like rock opera much like their jesus christ superstar many giant musical sequences just like the old musicals even if they do possess very intelligent lyrics create not only an intellectually enlightening experience but also very entertaining one after all this is musical and webbers musicals never undermine this they are balance of energy and intellectual depth walking on fine line between the both and never stumbling on either side this is why the beginning of evita is kind of letdown okay it is letdown am not saying the opening moments are bad because they are pretty good but what comes after is lifeless unentertaining and totally unrewarding sequence where she cons singer jimmy nail into taking eva buenos aires after onenight stand in the musical it is fun energetic sequence culiminating in the show stopper buenos aires is also lifeless then punch is pulled as we see eva being screwed over the singer instead of her leaving him where she ends up singing the sad tune another suitcase in another hall was meant for later character screwed over eva the portrayal of eva in the beginning is too soft seeming like parker and oliver stone who adapted it for the screen are afraid present her for what she is even while it is being narrated hater of evas the omnipotent antonio banderas who presents her in negative light for while it looks like alan parker cannot pull it off however the pulls itself together in flash and after that song is over and the giddily nihilistic song goodbye and thank you where we see eva go through long line of lovers who help her ascend is magnificent darkly comical and just gleeful from this point on the is hypnotic satisfying and satirical no more punches are thrown and the basic outline of the original musical are in tact we see eva woo and marry juan get him out of jail rise stardom falter bit come back and then gradually die of cancer think it was because of cancer more importantly many of the themes from the musical carry on this as well as some fillinginthegaps reconnassaince work juan who is pretty underwritten in the musical is given some extra scenes and
