exposed as what he was for eva an accessory muted scene where he tries visit her respective room but is shunned allows us learn more about juan and understand his sadness more than we did before from the goodbye and thank you number on the shows eva trying cover up for the horrible government doing cheap and petty things wooed nation and saved government even while it left the nations people downtrodden but despite this the nation still loved eva and when she slipped into death the world mourned her because she was star that is when our narrator ch comes out show that she was not the great woman she really was and expose her fame describing this character is difficult mainly because he has no real realistic background he is said be based on the revolutionary ch guevera but the two probably could have never met like they do in the but he serves as perspective on eva but even his perspective cannot help us from feeling bad when eva dies pathetic death alan parker no stranger bizarre musicals he is done fame the committments bugsy malone and pink floyd the wall the latter is absolutely brilliant nails the exposing everything for what it is we cry for evita at the end because we feel we should the way it is presented his direction is manipulative for reason show the mourning for what it is and there is energy throughout lots of bright colors and scenes are cinematically entertaning as well as enriching and deep such as the balcony scene where she sings do not cry for me argentina and her death sequence is poignant becuase of how sad it is madonnas golden globe winning performance is much like the movie starts kinda downhill then goes up quickly remaning there for the rest of the at the beginning she looks like she is too busy concentrating on her singing act but she eventually gets it right though never really getting the presence of say patti lupone who did the role in its american premiere back in the late her death though is brilliant her singing could be better though know she took lessons improve her range and all but it still sounds like she is trying hard she sounds way too soft in several places where she should be comanding like patti lupone heard her sing on an old evita cd and you could just feel her stage presence without even seeing her but it is generally very good although not up the brilliance the role really requires antonio banderas who is almost like guilty pleasure these days am one of the few people who thinks he rocks is extremely comanding in his performance presenting lovable narrator his singing is very good though nothing compared the original mandy patinkin he does have pretty good singing voice and great range and jonathan pryce is pretty awesome although very brief at times in his role as juan seeming put on poker face for his melancholy facade although it gets off rocky start rocky polite for what it really is it soon picks up and becomes wonderully poignant musical like the other musical released in woody allens everyone says love you it is reminder that the musical may be dead but it can come back every now and then for brief performance

there is more quilt than fabric and threadeach patchwork design has its own unique story or stories tell in how make an american quilt the first release from australian director jocelyn moorhouse proof we come understand how the tales of the seven makers imbue their creation passion and vitality all the sorrows joys longings sufferings and loves of these women are sewn into their quilt and as their bittersweet memories are given expression one young woman applies these lessons of the past her own uncertain future motion pictures are filled male bonding rituals how make an american quilt presents distinctly feminine alternative the quilting bee consists of seven members sisters gladys ann bancroft and hy ellen burstyn sophia lois smith woman known for frightening children emma jean simmons the timid wife of perpetually unfaithful man constance kate nelligan who has been having an affair emmas husband anna maya angelou the leader of the group and marianna alfre woodard annas daughter the project they are busy is the wedding quilt for hys granddaughter finn winona ryder who has just become engaged she is spending the summer hy and gladys and away from her fiance decide whether lifelong commitment is really what she wants and whether it is better marry friend or lover one of the greatest pleasures of how make an american quilt comes from watching an array of fine performances an impressive ensemble cast from winona ryder ann bancroft ellen burstyn and maya angelou minor players like rip torn claire danes and kate capshaw this is overflowing realized talent the performances are good enough in fact cover up many of the scripts weaknesses how make an american quilt is basically an unremarkable if affecting tale of love across the generationsa sort of truncated american version of the joy luck club dash of fried green tomatoes added there are probably too many characters so instead of really getting know few of them we are presented quick glimpses into single defining event in each of their lives we learn about the root of the smoldering resentment between gladys and hy and are told the reasons why emma stays her husband and sophia is so irascible there are other episodes as well the love of annas life mariannas soul mate and look at the reasons why constance entered into an affair her friends husband the sum total of these tales is meant provide the framework for finns story whether go forward her marriage or dally hunky stranger there is no emotional epiphany in how make an american quilt the stories are all welltold but it is difficult really connect the characterstheir moments pass so quickly while we certainly feel something for each of the eight principals our emotional investment is tenuous there is not enough depth pull the viewer in all the way and many of the personalities and relationships feel half formed like quilt patches missing put it bluntly while enjoyed watching this it did not do much for me on the whole how make an american quilt is nicelyunderstated drama that has lot say about love passion and monogamy in relationships finns segment is far the most compelling because she is the focal point her actions are shaped everyone elses experiences the other patches of this american quilt are successful only varying degrees if there is disappointment here it is that the script does not have more resonance but the privilege of seeing such fine cast in top form allows viewer enjoy this picture even if the story is somewhat conventional

mimi leder is probably best known for her stunning work as director of the hit tvshow er her mast famous episode loves labour lost dealt the ordeal of doctor mark greene as he tried his best save the life of pregnant mother and her child the way she moved the camera and created tension throughout every scene was amazing there was more excitement and adrenaline rushed suspense than just about any of hollywoods big blockbuster movies so it is only natural that leder would get direct her very own blockbuster and have say after shaky beginning she does not disappoint peacemaker deals the theft of nuclear weapons terrorists is obviously nothing new the first half hour goes into detail way too much detail about how the weapons are stolen despite few good images including train collision and very impressive explosion none of this was very coherent it is long and drawn out and would have settled more implausible beginning that would have moved the story along better once george clooney and nicole kidman enter the picture it begins take off george clooney is an air force colonel connections all over the world he has nice sarcastic wit and the rough edges that you expect from most clooney characters nicole kidman is head of white house team on weapons smuggling there is the usual flirtatious banter between the two but that is dispensed quickly the story takes clooney and kidman across the globe trying figure out who has the weapons and where they are going them clooney goes through bouts of sarcasm frustration determination and revenge while kidman works against her own insecurity and selfdoubt this is when leder starts show her true stuff she starts us off nifty little car chase as an appetizer then we get clooney doing heroics in and out of helicopter then that leads us the brilliant final showdown on new york citys crowded streets and madman nuke walking among them mimi leder is natural at creating suspense she reminds me of wolfgang petersen in her ability make the most routine action sequences exciting and breathtaking nicole kidman is an intelligent female action hero you are not gonna find her falling down so clooney can come back save her george clooney is real movie star many of you may have hated him as batman but this guy is for real he has natural screen presence and an ingratiating personality he will be around for while dreamworks is off satisfying start peacemaker

i have say it tim burtons retelling of planet of the apes is more fun than barrel of monkeys ok that is off my chest no more monkey puns promise seriously though planet of the apes is one riproarin summer outing filled thrills action adventure wit and bits of funny dare say monkey business know know promised and for those buffs who are fond of the original burtons version includes couple tips of the hat that movie mark wahlberg stars as capt leo davidson deepspace pilot whose ship gets drawn into magnetic field and hurled into the future he crash lands on planet where apes are the dominant species and humans are hunted captured and sold into slavery despite being darker than the original burtons is not as heavy handed nor as sanctimonious some of the movies flashes of humor are surreal as well as typically burton an organgrinder ape midget or an elderly ape taking off wig and removing false teeth as he prepares for bed then there are the parents who buy little girl as pet for there young daughter the seller advises the parents get rid of the girl before she reaches puberty one thing you do not want in your house is human teenager he says you do not have be an ape realize the truth in that statement touches such as these are what stamps this movie burtons brand lines that hearken back the original movie are sprinkled throughout the first words spoken an ape davidson as the astronaut is regaining consciousness and grabs the simians foot try righting himself are take your stinking hand off of me you damned dirty human anyone familiar the first version of the will of course recognize the irony in that piece of dialogue another of burtons injokes is have charlton heston star of the original play the chimpanzee father of tim roths gen thade the young chimp goes visit his dying father both have one thing in common hatred of humans his dying breath the elder spews out his vile damn them damn them all hell he says before expiring that is the famous line hestons taylor shouted at the conclusion of the original after discovering the planets terrible secret the performances throughout are topnotch wahlberg plays davidson not as some gungho hero but as confused and somewhat frightened explorer who only wants return home he is reluctant lead the human rebellion his only objective being find way off this upsidedown planet this hesitation is what makes his character believable and vulnerable roth is ferocious cunning cruel and savage as the fascist chimp who wants rid his planet of all vestiges of humanity he leaps and bounds as if he had springs on his feet it is masterful turn helena bonham carter is ari the chimp who believes that apes and humans can live in peace and as equals hers is smart compassionate characterization michael clarke duncan is big and brutal as attar the gorilla aid thade who blindly follows his leader until his faith is shaken fine comic outing is given paul giamatti as limbo the ape slave trader making living off the misery of the humans he captures as the battle between apes and humans looms the cowardly limbo pleads cannot we all just get along echoing the words of rodney king much of the success of planet of the apes goes burtons technical crew especially production designer rick heinrichs and the legendary rick baker who created the ape makeup burtons musical collaborator danny elfman provides another fine score though it is not as memorable as his work on batman or sleepy hollow the movies only letdown comes at the very end where burton tries outshock the finale from the original he comes close but falls short otherwise planet of the apes is what summer movie should be an amusement park ride filled lots of action stunts and few laughs this is one feature in the expectations lived up the prerelease hype

urban legend surprised me based on the last few films the genre has produced including but not exclusive the likes of know what you did last summer disturbing behavior and the disappointing halloween i was positive that was in store for another mildly entertaining but silly and ultimately boring rehash of the scream phenomena thankfully legend rose above it is soggy premise become not only hip scary and stylish entertainment but also what will probably become one of the best films of the year you are all familiar the plot bunch of overly horny teenagers get systematically slaughtered masked maniac who is identity is not revealed until the closing moments of the when it turns out be you guessed it everybodys favorite veteran of the whodunit flicks the only person you did not suspect however just because legend does not really break any new ground as far as literary or even technical achievements go does not mean that it cannot qualify as firstclass entertainment it was believe it or not one of the funnest times have had at the movies all year the thing is am not really sure what made this particular stab pardon the pun at the genre seem so fresh and alive maybe it was the abovepar performances the movies two leads jared leto and cybil actress alicia witt or it could have been the on target direction jamie blanks more likely though it was because of the inspired premise do not think need tell you that killer hacking people up ala urban folklore is much more frightening than killer fisherman urban legend begins sequence that reminded me of the classic scream opener not so much in plotting as in attention detail that makes for an absolutely chilling teaser for the rest of the pretty young coed is driving down deserted road when gasp gas problem heehee forces her stop at an equally deserted gas station for refill one problem though would you want stop at station run brad dourif thought not predictably the attendant ends up coaxing her into the main building sort out problem the credit card company it is odd though when you pick up phone realize that nobodys on the other line naturally the potential victim escapes into her car and drives off and the when we least expect it whack decapitation it turns out that the creepy looking attendant was just trying warn her about the maniac in the back seat of the car so who is it this time the obvious candidate is the slightly offkilter professor at the college the girl went none other than freddy kruger himself robert englund who teaches class on urban legends aha or could it be the famehungry local journalist leto looking for meaty story put on his resume like all movies of this nature one of the chief pleasures is trying guess whodunit and it turns out be of course the one you did not suspect am not going pretend urban legend is anything more than it is but must give credit where credit is due and this flick definitely deserves credit for being what not many other recent horror films have been fun complimentary movie ticket courtesy of valley cinemas in lodi ca

capsule the verma family is having wedding and all the relatives will come for the multiday festivities mira nairs is pleasant enough little human drama few family secrets some sadness and some happiness you have seen it all before but perhaps not from india the photography is colorful and the music is very agreeable low mira nair previously directed salaam bombay and mississippi masala her newest written sabrina dhawan is very similar previous films like betsys wedding but it is set in new delhi wealthy family is having wedding an indian wedding is multiday affair as much family reunion as nuptial even more than in the us it is an excuse for lavish and extravagant family gettogether the shows us what the family does together and at the same time follows several family members individual story lines aditi verma is marrying hemant an indian engineer working in the us she had previously had relationship vikram her supervisor latit her father played naseeruddin shah is juggling many problems not the least of is worrying about the caterer has hired pk dubey dubey is rather eccentric man taste for eating the marigolds he uses for decoration even dubey will soon be romantically entangled when he becomes interested in alice one of the family servants several family members arrive giving rise several plotlines involving sex family secrets or both there are heartbreaks and there are people falling in love some of the subjects covered are probably near taboo for indian films western audiences will appreciate look at unfamiliar indian customs like women painting their hands henna on the other hand it was not clear me at least if scenes like the family singing together are typical of indian culture or if they are convention of indian musical films this seems particularly westernized family the father wearing american designer sweaters and the family speaking mostly english the latter will however help an international release sabrina dhawans screenplay is vibrant witty dialog we have seen films plotting very much like this but the indian setting makes great deal of difference director mira nair calls the an affirmation of life rate it on the scale and low on the scale

the love for family is one of the strongest driving forces in any mans life especially for those who have fostered their family under precarious circumstances thematically in cinema love for family has been used frequently and emphatically highlight more abstract aspects of characters it is rare however for it develop as outstandingly as it does in roberto benignis neoclassic drama life is beautiful through central cast of father mother and son benigni demonstrates the wonderful undying love that family shares in the best of times and the worst of times life is beautiful for guido orefice roberto benigni directing himself here for the sixth time in his career an italian jew master con man and aspiring waiter extraordinaire living in italy he lives carefree life of good fortune it is made even better when he happens upon pretty schoolteacher named dora nicoletta braschi although dora is already engaged guido manages sweep her off her feet and persuades her marry him instead the two have child named joshua giorgio cantarini unfortunately for the happy family the third reich and its nazi minions occupy italy and imprison all jews in work camps it is after the movie takes this dramatic turn that the movies theme of family love becomes the strongest although prior this turning point benigni plays guido sort of goofy charm he relaxes the role ensure his sons happiness now instead of awkwardly seducing the sweet dora he constantly reassures his son that everything will be all right benignis performance is truly wellrounded one and certainly one of the more fluid turns all year the supports are all strong as well but the movie truly excels in its script life is beautiful is selfproclaimed fable one tells its story in grand twopart fashion in certain parts it manages sink the level of saturday night live spinoff number of humorous skits connected token plot but in the movies second half the scripts circular nature becomes admirably obvious characters make reprise appearances in fine form and certain events are intially curious become critically linked the plots outcome in all fans of foreign will see this as memorable motion picture and novice moviewatchers may take this opportunity see their first artsy life is beautiful is an artsy movie convention but easily accessible everyone and above all is fine thematic picture

while watching wes andersons rushmore it may be surprising think that the role of max fischer the films antihero was not written jason schwartzman in mind the young actor making his debut as year old student at the exclusive rushmore academy is so perfect in the role that it comes as shock that anderson auditioned some two thousand other prospective stars before discovering schwarztman schwartzman plays max student who is more interested in his extracurricular activities such as writing edgy plays like serpico and being president of the rushmore beekeepers but sees his grades suffer as result on the brink of being thrown out he lands himself in even more hot water when he falls for first grade teacher rosemary cross olivia williams and enlists the help of millionaire acquaintance herman blume the great bill murray build an aquarium on rushmores baseball field in her honour unfortunately for everyone involved blume finds that he has feelings for miss cross as well gets in the way of maxs plans woo her max is one of the bestwritten characters we have yet seen in the and schwartzman plays him perfection in one of the finest comedy performances ever given someone of his age as everyone else has probably already pointed out he is reminiscent of young dustin hoffman although was reminded more of paul from the wonder years from visual standpoint at least hopefully if he avoids typecasting as weird quirky lonertypes he should earn himself good career bill murray is his equal as blume displaying depth we have not yet seen from him while this is not his best performance that honour goes groundhog day he is still terrific here williams is not given much do except react schwartzman and murray but still does fine work rushmore seems go just little too long but while it is not perfect it is definate mustsee for anyone who wants see that rarity an american comingofage that actually works well without an excessive amount of sentimentality anderson has created modern classic star who should any luck rise even greater success

no did not read the novel thomas hardy jude the obscure his final novel final because this created such an outrage that he never wrote again see did do some research on it about man who is plagued bad luck throughout his entire life but after watching the movie can imagine how incredibly depressing it is jude is satirical from start finish about societys way of spitting out and chewing up those unwanted in its system but what is remarkable is how timeless this is the takes place in the late th century or early th was not really sure but its story could even be retold today in modern form although it would be kinda different given it tells the story of jude christopher eccleston the psychotic accountant from shallow grave simple dimwitted young man big dreams in its bleak foreboding opening shot in grainy black and white he gets lesson from phillotson liam cunningham his teacher as they stand upon mountain looking upon city in the distance he says all you have do is work hard and you can have anything in the world after marrying and divorcing an immature woman named arabella rachel griffiths because they frolicked in the hay literally but did not ultimately share anything in common he moves away town giant university chance learn more and get ahead in life taking welding job he works hard while studying constantly for his college bars reciting latin over and over again and training himself but when he sends his application for the school in he is bluntly told just remain worker another reason for going this town was because someone in his family lives there sue kate winslet his cousin and very intelligent but kinda mischevious young woman who wants be school teacher she and jude click eventually and become very endearing friends so much that when she spends the night at his flat after running from her apprentice teacher job for none other than phillotson at the local school there are rumors that she and jude did some nasty business nudge nudge several twists turn in the storyline and eventually jude and sue do do some nasty business an interesting scene say the least and are soon born into controversial nonwedlock as she eventually gives birth their baby and jude inherits his son from arabella who turns up again after awhile because they are not married and because they are cousins they run into problems every place they go carrying around two children everywhere and only staying in lodges for very brief period of time then moving on if you did not think this was harsh enough wait till you see what happens later on the sad truth is that jude is one of the miserable people who can never get any luck in this world he will never gain any true happiness and any happiness that happens him will be fleeting and will probably bring more horrible instances his life part of it is his fault he is too optimistic and too gullible but society has way of taking these people and hurting them until their death the ending of jude is bleak because it has be although hear the ending of the novel is even worse guess will have read it now jude offers satirical view on societys cruelties but shows no way of curing this and thank heavens it does not there is no way relinquish the selfishness of society and any solution would be too small cure such mass problem satire has always been one of the few ways of changing certain peoples minds and that is what jude is sure it is one hell of downer but it needs be the also posesses two fantastic performances from its two leads and some good supporting work along it christopher eccleston slightly resembling richard edson his new look and dumb expression plays jude wonderfully sometimes bringing big dumb smile his face and making him kind of childlike at other times kate winslet in pre titanic performance is brilliant nailing every psyche of her character and creating someone who is troubled but very seductive her personality kate may be the best actress in her age group if you do not believe me see titanic branaghs hamlet sense and sensibility and heavenly creatures the latter one being my favorite performance of hers in the supporting roles liam cunningham is wonderfully flawed teacher exposing all his bad parts but ultimately being pretty good person and rachel griffiths is wonderfully immature as judes wife whom he never divorces jude moves at very slow pace and keeps taunting its viewers chances of happiness for its protagonists would drive some people nuts but those who appreciate good social commentary their films no matter how slow or downright depressing they are this one is both will appreciate jude though doubt anyone truly enjoys it

quaid stars as man who has taken up the proffesion of dragonslayer after he feels he is betrayed dragon early in the movie he runs into the last dragon in existence and there is genuinely amusing battle between the two results in standoff where quaid is in the dragons mouth but has his sword pointed at the dragons brain eventually they decide call truce and they work out deal since he is the last dragon he will pretend die and quaid will be able get paid for it their scam works at first until they come town without any money instead the town sacrifices girl the dragon but of course draco is nice droagon so he will not eat her there is however very amusing scene where draco is hitting on the young girl of course as you can probably tell the plot this is silly movie but it does know when take itself seriously at the right times unlike eddie was serious all the time you could probably call this medieval comedy because there are more laughs here than in eddie and spy hard combined dennis quaid makes fine hero pete posthlewaite provides some ghreat comedy as monk who journeys them dina meyer is appealing as the sacrificed girl but lets face it the movie is really about the dragon and what an amazing creation he is connerys voice and ilm team up provide us truly magnificent dragon so if you are going see this movie for strong hard core medieval epic you are going the wrong movie if you are going because of the dragon you will not be dissapointed and you will be provided plenty of laughs that smooth out the boring parts in the script

it has been years since terrence malick hit theaters his new the thin red line is strange beautiful enigmatic mess of movie the first thing that jumps out one when they see the advertisements for this is the huge cast it is filled abovethetitle stars the cast for the most part gives great performances john travolta whose role is nothing more than cameo seems not have attacked his performance that much verve george clooney whose role became cameo in editing gives strange performance one wonders if he knew that his performance would become the object of ridicule through characters narration the rest of the cast especially nick nolte and elias koteas are unambiguously fantastic these actors and they are two exceptions men were lured the name of malick terrence malick is cinematic legend he has often been called the d salinger of cinema his two previous films badlands and days of heaven are spectacularly beautiful and obscure motion pictures after he made them he disappeared for years this marks his return what he is made the thin red line is that seems less concerned plot than the emotion of the moment the narration fills the and perplexes many not only lets us hear the narrators the characters themselves pontificate but also lets us hear such ofthemoment thoughts as am scared the rather simple plot of the thin red line is used as canvas on many stories are painted the plot couldly simply be boiled down an assault on hill plot synopsis for the thin red line is difficult because the story is fractured many stories are here from the clash between the lieutenant elias koteas and the savage colonel voracious nick nolte the private ben chaplin who uses his love for the woman he left behind keep him going the fracturing of the story is ultimately fault it is as if an artist spent an incredible amount of time artfully sculpting tiny statues and then threw them into box shook the box and poured the results onto table this basically creates mess but the stories can be discerned and enjoyed am not declaring that the has no structure while saving private ryan used warfare bookend the plot malick uses reflection and glorious shots of nature bookend about minutes of combat the battles in the thin red line are astonishing and display mastery of filmmaking the astounding cinematography in this must also be given notice this uses color and light in such fantastic way that it will be sad see it degraded when it has bee transferred video ultimately malick has crafted that is movie that enjoys looking through the treetops more than regarding the war that rages below them the is filled nature photography and the regarding of nature while some have said that the antiwar message and pronature tubthumping was juvenile it was done so much complexity and thought that it cannot ever honestly be called childish after seeing the thin red line was haunted it and am quite ready see it again

stuart little is one of the best family films come out this year it is cute funny and very goodnatured that has nothing for parents squirm over except few mild cusswords though read the book long time ago and really do not remember what it was about do know that this does not disappoint finally movie gets released that is as good as the trailer makes it be few surprising twists some very funny moments and few sentimental moments all mixed in one great little movie stuart little is mouse he has finally gotten new home after being put up for adoption he now lives the littles nice little no pun intended family that lives in their apartment next central park in new york city they have little boy george played the adorable jonathan lipnicki and now they have new son at first stuart takes while but he finally adjusts being part of the family and even getting along the pet cat george does not take too well having mouse for brother at first but once the two play together they instantly bond stuart however is missing something and he wants know who his real parents are the littles try and find his parents and one day they show up on the doorstep wanting stuart back hesitating the littles know what is best for stuart and so does snowball the pet cat he and his friends try get stuart but in the end we find out the truth about stuarts past ending up sentimental and very heartwarming ending one thing noticed about the instantly was the fantastic special effects just like in star wars episode the phantom menace stuart little and his family are all computer generated and they look fantastically real from the detail of their fur the detail of the way the walk the special effects team put lot of time and effort on this million dollar and it shows another movie that this has in common is babe it is talking animals and people understanding them it has family friendly atmosphere and is never really scary or suspenseful enough even scare the youngest of kids michael fox does the voice of stuart himself and just like in the homeward bound movies does fantastic job and brings more out of stuart than anyone else could he me fits the character perfectly and ends up making stuart even more lovable another gem of the is nathan lane as snowball when he was timon in the lion king would have sworn he was comedian and now in stuart little he brings the most out of snowball and makes him one of those characters we love dislike for the human actors geena davis who never gives bad performance does not disappoint here as well she fits nicely in her character and there is good chemistry between her and hugh laurie who plays mr little both make us believe they are happily in love and married and jonathan lipnicki as their song is even more adorable than he was in jerry maguire even though stuart little is completely cgi the human characters and stuart have nice chemistry together and even makes us believe they really do care for each other stuart little is ideal family entertainment for this holiday season and will not disappoint youngsters or adults for that matter we get entertainment laughs cries and more fun at the movies this season than probably any other movie its nice see pg rated movie out at christmas that everyone can see even though it has million dollar budget am sure it will make over that or just below it respectively for all you parents out there trying find good family movie have yet see bicentennial man as write this but as far as know stuart little and toy story are far the best family films this year winner

as his other stateside releases jackie chans latest chopsocky vehicle mr nice guy is contrived blockheaded and lacking in narrative logic but also like those other films it is highly enjoyable ride once again chans screenwriters here edward tang and fibe ma have taken the easy way out and named their stars character simply jackie no last name this jackie is worldclass chef who cohosts popular cooking show on australian television of course jackie also happens be talented martial artist and these skills come in handy when he becomes involved in an ambitious reporters gabrielle fitzpatrick expose of drug dealing ring other plot details involving videotape and biker gang are irrelevant in fact as is the case most chan films the plot itself is just about irrelevant the sole purpose of mr nice guys existence are chans comic fight scenes and those here do not disappoint director samo hung who has cameo role longtime collaborator of chans does not waste any time putting chan in action diving headon into wild chasefightshootout after brief cooking show prologue other impressive set pieces follow most notably chase in mall directly leads some frenzied if cliched can you say fruit cart business involving runaway carriage and an extended latefilm sequence at construction site in hilarious pursuit through maze of blue doors culminates in some exciting fights involving boards cement mixers and deadly buzzsaw none of the action sequences in mr nice guy are as spectacular as supercops thrilling helicoptertrain finale or rumble in the bronxs daring leap between two buildings nor is anything as inventive as the ladder fight or air tunnel climax in first strike and operation condor respectively but the action delivers even if the energy peters out before the films end the finale as spectacular as it is is letdown for fans of chans athletic prowess filmed almost entirely in english even so the voices of some englishspeaking actors are laughably dubbed mr nice guy hints at jackie chans latest transition productions he made illfated attempts the big brawl and the protector next in the pipeline is rush hour stateside production costarring chris tucker hopefully that will be mere diversion in tinseltown and chan will continue exuberant hong kong productions such as mr nice guy for his unique charm and reckless abandon are sure be diluted american hands much like they have been before

the premise of wag the dog is so simple that it is adequately explained the commercials days go until the election the president who we never see calls in political dirtytricks artist robert deniro distract attention from burgeoning sex scandal deniro enlists producer dustin hoffman produce pageant phony war against albania fought on the blue screens of and the recording studios of nashville woody harrelson as the reluctant psychotic hero and if there was not anything more the movie than this it would be secondrate heist comedy at best enlivened great actors like sneakers goes washington heist comedy yup deniro and hoffman are stealing the election so speak and the movie is more about how they do it and the fun they have doing it than anything else wag the dog succeeds because it is based one great truth the american people are stupid ok maybe it is not love thy neighbor as thyself or even two plus two makes four but truth nonetheless any average person who thinks that they are really smart about the two things this movie satirizes moviemaking and the political process is invited nay challenged spend week either watching movie actually being made or hours straight watching cspan when the house is in session and because we are so utterly predictably stupid knows that certain percentage of us will go see hard rain or magoo washington knows that we will not notice few million dollars spent here and there on porno art grants and cigar subsidies and deniros character knows that american geography skills are so weak that we will not be able locate albania on the map the beauty of wag the dog is that it is not light meaningless comedy about politics like speechless the michael keaton geena davis picture or from the level of lighthearted politcal satire neargreatness nor is it hardedged cynical look at the manner in morallydeprived ethically challenged babyboomer connives his sleazy way into the white house like primary colors and yes am little disappointed in the way the last two elections turned out thanks for asking instead david mamets script strikes that delicate balance between comedy and cynicism needed for satire it does this keeping us in fantasy world where most of the schemers schemes come off beautifully and fail only in entertaining and humorous fashion deniro is playing variation on his al capone character from the untouchables without any of the violent rages it is all what do love what is it that brings me joy baseball minus the savage bloody beating the bat he threatens lot of people mind you but he is doing it in very nice polite way it is very mellow restrained performance fits in the air of gamesmanship in the script hoffman on the other hand is giddy exuberant and joyous this kind of thing is what his character lives for and he is so excited that he cannot even shut up even on the edge of disaster he is brighteyed behind oddly tinted sunglasses and positive insiders note that he is basing his character on some powerfulbutanonymous producer may or may not be true but hoffman still exudes the kind of letsputonashow electricity that you figure producer needs have the best part and the most frustrating part of wag the dog is in the supporting cast the characters are so well drawn and so well acted that we want see more of them listen them talk in that wisedup mamet dialogue get know them better we do not anne heche is deadbangon in her portrayal of political press aide cool and composed on the outside panicked and frenzied on the outside denis leary one of my favorite actors see the ref is the fad king who handles the profitable backend tshirt tie ins and shoe contracts and other creative innovative ways separate fool from his money they could make whole movie just about the fad king and would go see it willie nelson and merle haggard handle the musical end of things fabulously from the upbeat gospel chorus theme song the weepy country waltz the hilarious ballad of the green berets parody woody harrelson has brief but memorable part as the overmedicated hero of the albanian conflict craig nelson as the opposition candidate and the everreliable william macy as wacky cia agent are given surprisingly short shrift one of my small gripes is that we never see what the spin doctors on the other side are doing wag the dog is funny movie about serious problems the trivialization of american politics the role of the press in dumbing down the issues the impact of in creating campaign commercials the reduction of all things political soundbites and sidebars the list goes on we can solve most of these problems taking greater role in our national life and educating ourselves as voters and citizens wag the dog reminds us of what can happen if we do not

as the opens up expectant unwed mother sally played drew barrymore encounters her babys father in fast food drivethrough window after he gets his milkshake he drives off only be pursued military helicopter from this moment forward you know that this is not going be your runofthemill romantic comedy home fries tells the tale of the relationship between sally and dorian played luke wilson helicopter pilot who has different kind of connection sally more than he would care admit hint it has something do the father of sallys unborn child after taking personal and professional interest in her he finds work at the local fast food restaurant at she works and the fun goes on from there this movie is lot of fun it is comedic on two levels as romantic comedy and dark comedy the romantic moments are sweet yet not sappy one of the more poignant moments is when dorian accompanies sally lamaze classes however the dark comedic moments are more memorable this is also tale of revenge and funny one at that the father of sallys unborn child also happened be married man whose wife is played catherine ohara she does wonderful portrayal of jealous wife who is targeting the person who had an affair and is not above getting other people do her dirty work my apologies if this sounds cryptic but there is too much of the plot give away rounding out the cast are jake busey as angus dorians overzealous brother and daryl mitchell as roy dorians trainer at the fast food restaurant the dialogue is sharp and not filled sappy overtones even the romantic nature of the plot if there are any complaints it is over drew barrymores performance while she does light up the screen there are moments when she does not seem all that convincing the movie was filmed in texas and most of the characters have southern texan accents drew barrymores accent tends come and go luke wilson does not seem have this problem as well she seems awfully agile for woman that is eight months pregnant still this movie is one that will please many viewers plot twists galore and hilarious dark moments this is sure entertain

the second jackalbased come out in the other starring bruce willis was simply entitled the jackal this one stars aidan quinn and donald sutherland and is directed man who hailed from joblos own alma matter concordia university in montreal canada the story is based on the exploits of the real terrorist known as the jackal but does not pretend be factual plot naval officer ramirez quinn gets called upon the cia impersonate the international terrorist known as the jackal in order put an end the actual militants radical activities he is chosen for this role because he physically resembles the real terrorist tee ramirez reluctantly agrees take part in this assignment and soon finds himself wrapped up in true web of international terrorism intrigue and doublepersonality syndrome does not sit well his uninformed wife and kids back in the states critique great premise is executed enough style and thrills keep the piece interesting throughout its close twohour runtime admittedly was not huge fan of any of the main actors in this and did not expect much from this movie beforehand but surprisingly it did have its thrilling moments as well as mostly plausible and absorbing story line the first hour is mostly just buildup of things come and does offer great characterization of the jackal but the second hour is the one that really cranks in the cool scenes and sweet ending quinn was adequate in both roles as naval officer ramirez and the real jackal but did not offer anything extraordinary in my opinion sutherland and kingsley seem be playing the same role that they have played in both of their respective careers of late but nonetheless appeared relish the coldheartedness of their chosen characters did not like performance put forth from quinns wife in this flick but then again she does not show up in most of the so that was not so bad did however enjoy director duguays interesting style and cinematic vision this thriller could easily have been boring during many sequences but duguay always seemed find something interesting show the viewer thought that was neat having said that did not think the first hour needed be as long as it was and the did have me tinkering on the bridge of believability when the fake jackal met the real jackals girlfriend without much retrospection on her part but all in all not too many complaints in movie that could easily be enjoyed all those who take pleasure in the spy and terrorist thriller genre little known facts ben kingsleys real name is krishna banji he stands was born in scarborough england and won the best actor honor in academy awards presentation for the title role he portrayed in ghandi many scenes from this were actually shot in montreal canada joblos haven of restfulness donald sutherland has fathered actor kiefer sutherland is canadian and apparently still owns place in the north of montreal

one of the last entries in the longrunning carry on series carry on behind is very similar carry on camping in that it involves group of holidaymakers descending on caravan site professors anna vrooshka elke sommer and roland crump kenneth williams and group of archaeology students stay in the caravan site owned major leep kenneth connor so that they can explore the nearby roman settlement remains anna has little trouble understanding english and sometimes people get the wrong end of the stick for instance when anna is asking for scrubbers for dirty caravan she means that she wants scrubbing brush clean the caravan arthur upmore bernard bresslaw and his wife linda patsy rowlands take her mother daphne barnes joan sims and her minah bird on holiday them motherinlaw jokes prevail furthermore the trouble that joe and norma baxter ian lavender and adrienne posta have their large irish greyhound allows for some comical moments between the two families fred ramsden windsor davies and ernie bragg jack douglas leave their wives liz fraser and patricia franklin behind for fishing holiday however they have more in mind than fishing when they catch sight of two young girls sandra carol hawkins and carol sherrie hewson the story involves the disruption caused the archaeological professors of the daytoday running of the camp the search for the minah bid and greyhound the major fred and ernies desperate need of woman misunderstanding leading striptease at the caravan parks pub and shock in store for daphne the partnership between sommer and williams is very effective and amusing this is what binds the movie together joan sims stands out as the demanding motherinlaw bernard bresslaw and patsy rowlands work well together as husband and wife and carol hawkins and sherrie hewson are welcome addition the cast on the other hand there are lowkey performances from kenneth connor and peter butterworth as barnes the handyman and there are very poor performances windsor davies and jack douglas who spend far too much time on the screen even though there is no real plot speak of and the jokes are getting bluer due the new scriptwriter dave freeman there are enough truly comical moments and bright and breezy performances lift this carry on above many of its predecessors although the regular cast is depleted the ones that remain show that they can still make good carry on relative flop at the cinema this movie deserves lot more recognition

the cryptic teaser trailer has been unspooling in moviehouses for quite sometime now it mut be found so what exactly is the fifth element after seeing luc bessons ambitious muchshroudedinsecrecy science fiction fantasy could not help but be let down the actual answer is not nearly as exciting nor clever as one would think but what is far from letdown is the as whole wildly imaginative feast for the senses that does what all the best science fiction films docreate universe unlike any other presented on the silver screen the biggest irony of the fifth element is that the one thing that has been kept under such tight wrapsthe actual storylineis the most conventional dismayingly so element pun intended of the speaking in the vaguest possible terms the basics of the plot are as follows in the year great force of evil threatens consume the earth and only the four elementsearth wind fire and waterunited fifth element can stop it figuring into all of this are new york cabbie korben dallas bruce willis shady southerndrawling entrepreneur the name of zorg the hilariously hammy gary oldman picking up where he left off in bessons the professional priest ian holm and mysterious creature named leeloo milla jovovich all of the pieces come together in tidy and somewhat underwhelmingand unsurprisingfashion but there is no denying that this basic story holds some intrinsic interest what remains interesting and exciting however after brief glimpses is the fascinating world besson has created production designer dan weil director of photography thierry arbogast visual effects supervisor mark stetson and the crew at digital domain the look is absolutely mesmerizing right from the opening moments the last the frenzied cityscape of new york its vibrant dayglo colors tall buildings penetrating high into the clouds and the swarm of cars cabs and other vehicles flying through labyrinthian skyways is absolutely breathtaking behold especially in wild car chase sequence early on in the but it would not have been completely captivating vision if the people inhabiting the settings were not equally as interesting and are they ever in addition the exotic menagerie of alien creatures that populate this world from bulky robots doglike mangalores the humans are outfitted in costumes eccentric designer jeanpaul gaulthier best known for creating madonnas pointy bustier getup in her blonde ambition tour gaulthiers outlandish creations such as number worn leeloo made entirely out of white straps feel more at home in bessons futuristic vision than on any fashion runway in the world they add the sense of otherworldliness about the while bessons bold vision is the biggest virtue of the it also could be its biggest obstacle reaching mass audience for all its imagination certain things about the may be bit too quirky and bizarre really do not know what middle america will make of the most outrageous character of the ruby rhod chris tucker flamboyant disc jockey who makes dennis rodman look conservativehe makes raucous entrance dressed in an animal print dress sporting blonde hairdo in the shape of hair dryer speaking in high pitches at rapid fire speed at first this characters hyper energy is funny but the act wears out its welcome very quickly not irritating but just as strange is musical number blueskinned alien chanteuse diva maiwenn lebesco who singsand dancesan aria that is an unlikely blend of classical opera and techno the tune as the entirety of longtime besson collaborator eric serras innovative score is haunting but it is also completely jarring then there are the campy touches of humor besson and coscripter robert mark kamen sprinkle throughout too often are silly and forced comic sexual encounter between ruby rhod and flight attendant is highly distracting and not very funny boot the storys weakness shines through in the climax and conclusion of the fifth element while still visually and aurally spectacular the events detailed are not as exciting nor powerful as they should be the big serious dramatic climax was met more than few snickers and it ambitiously strives for profundity the had not even begun work toward as such at the end there is sense that there was something bigger at work here that there was still more left be said about this story and these characters this suspicion was confirmed besson himself who told me in the lobby following the screening imagine that the filmmaker watching the the enemy the critics that what had made it the screen was really just the first half of the lengthy original fifth element screenplay and that the second halfnow titled mr shadowis still waiting be made still despite the story problems the fifth element is an artistic triumph for luc besson rarely does filmmakers original vision come the screen in all its audacious undiluted glory it is fascinating example of how of one artists fervid imagination can transport an audience into an intoxicating fantasy world generally seen only in dreams

very bad things is the most delightfully morbid of the year movie that goes so far over the deep end its outrageousness and violence that could not help but be won over the material the starts off five friends leaving their homes in los angeles for bachelor party in las vegas the groomtobe is kyle fisher jon favreau who is about be married the controlling weddingobsessed laura cameron diaz the other friends are real estate agent robert boyd christian slater quiet charles leland orser and brothers michael jeremy piven and family man adam daniel stern after wild night of gambling boozing and drugs stripper carla scott who was paid for robert comes into their hotel room but after freak accident everyones terror she is killed as robert puts it there are two options go the police and go prison or bury her out in the desert where no one will ever find her after security guard enters into the hotel room unexpectantly and sees the body robert is forced kill him as well okay there is only one option now you can forget about calling the police he says the time the five friends return home and as the wedding draws nearer most of them are overcome guilt sets off an even more elaborate series of event that includes much much more murder doublecrosses and the inevitable wedding from hell very bad things is actor peter bergs feature directing debut is the shockingly perverse and wicked comedy that there is something about mary wanted be it pulls out all the stops create something fresh original and hilarious even if that requires surprisingly graphic violence gore and slew of truly hateful characters that all get what they deserve the end the screenplay also written berg is put it mildly very funny and courageous during the second act of the some of the fun was beginning slightly dwindle due so much death was beginning undermine the humor but it eventually recouped itself climax that has be seen be believed the dialogue is edgy and inventive and this proves that movie does not necessarily require likable character be extremely enjoyable there is more fun think in showing ignorable people getting their just desserts cameron diaz gives her best performance date here and has lot of fun in playing the hateful laura who eventually turns out be more crazy than any of the five male friends diaz puts so much overblown energy her character that really do think she deserves supporting actress oscar nomination come next january the time she is beating someone death coat hanger and reciting lines like stuff him in the crapper and get your ass upstairs could not help but crack up at how ballstothewall this had become jeanne tripplehorn creates another character original as daniel sterns wife who late in the picture we discover is tough kickboxer that should not be messed around it is at this level that very bad things was so entertaining and surprising just when you thought you could predict what was going happen there would be little twist involving the characters that would be absolutely wacky the last sequence was perfect and managed go even further overthetop although enjoyed the immensely let me make this clear very bad things is not movie for everyone it is more tasteless than anything have ever seen it is more violent and bloody than rrated usually is and it is offensive luckily these are elements that would prefer in comedy since it clearly shows the filmmakers were set on making noholdsbarred politically incorrect comedy the fact that this slipped through the cracks of the usually mainstream and safe widereleases coming out lately still gives me hope for the industry

it is hard imagine that movie includes abortion and incest as prominent plot devices could be so sensitive so delicate so insightful and yes even so enjoyable somehow the cider house rules manages keep an even keel in the face of the harsh subject matter and allows substantial amount of heart shine through set in the the tells the story of unique young man named homer wells tobey maguire ride the devil an orphan twice rejected as an infant possible adoptive parents he grows up in the care and under the tutelage of dr wilbur larch michael caine little voice father figure the orphans of st cloud obstetrician or abortionist the unhappily pregnant women who come there seeking his help figuring that as long as homer was going stay at the orphanage he might as well be of use dr larch begins teaching him all he knows about obstetrics soon homer is delivering babies like professional he refuses perform abortions instead wondering why the couples just did not behave more responsibly larch too old and experienced have such youthful ideals marvels that homer continues have such high expectations of people such is the result of an insulated upbringing though skilled in certain medical procedures homer remains woefully naive and ignorant about most everything else he finally figures that in order find his place in the world he must go out into it befriending young couple who had come see dr larch he hitches ride them and parlays that into landing job as an apple picker group of black migrant workers at the orchard where they lived thus homer begins his worldly instruction new friend candy kendall charlize theron the astronauts wife willing tutor tobey maguire is well cast yet again as an inherently good man who is seeking answers lifes questions many of he was unaware needed be asked he demonstrates quiet strength and thoughtful curiosity that is both warm and appealing michael caine is in word brilliant as the caring caretaker of these orphans many of whom he helped bring into the world calling them princes of maine kings of new england in his ritualistic goodnight mr caine manages communicate the love and commitment larch has towards these children without becoming maudlin or saccharine delroy lindo life less ordinary has many powerful moments as mr rose the strong and charismatic leader of the apple pickers whom homer joins director lasse hallstrom what is eating gilbert grape and screenwriternovelist john irving the world according garp who adapted his own work for this movie deserve much of the credit for the balanced approach the sensitive subject matter regardless of ones personal stand on the divisive matter of abortion it is hard imagine anyone becoming offended the evenhanded treatment used these filmmakers the title is reference list of rules posted in the quarters of the illiterate apple pickers figuring the rules did not apply them since they did not have hand in writing them they decide ignore the list and make up their own rules as they go along dr larch in his own way acts similarly there is danger in that line of reasoning god has also given us set of rules unlike the list posted in the cider house gods rules if followed promise us benefits beyond our imagination and yet many continue ignore his rules preferring make up their own as they go through life trust in the lord all thine heart and lean not unto thine own understanding proverbs kjv just as builder follows designers blueprint or conductor follows composers score why should not we follow the rules of life given us lifes architect for our own blessing

known as the most successful highestgrossing romantic comedy in history director garry marshall apparently struck gold pretty woman opened quietly during the summer of but thanks positive wordofmouth was able reach upwards of million in theaters alone the question of why it worked so well lies directly the films two charismatic stars richard gere and julia roberts since the story itself is none too original or even believable the other winning element that makes pretty woman so entertaining is its genuine sweetness and innocence is rarely as palpable in todays films as it is here edward lewis richard gere is suave extremely wealthy business mogul who at the start of the picture breaks up his girlfriend over the phone after nasty argument and abruptly takes his friends car and gets lost on boulevard while trying find his hotel stopping the car along the street he asks woman obviously prostitute for directions agreeing get in his car and show him for ten bucks edward ultimately accepts they strike up conversation and before long she has been asked up his penthouse room on the top floor this meeting does not lead sex however as edward confides that he would rather just have someone talk and offers her spend the night just as well since the hooker named vivian is beautiful generally upbeat young woman who is the type of person that can lend an understanding ear the meeting between these two completely opposite people does not end the next morning as planned when edward finally offers pay vivian threethousand dollars if she will stay him for six days and nights while he is in the area keeping him company and acting as his companion business dinners and gettogethers since vivian firmly tells edward at the beginning that she will do anything him except kiss him on the lips always leads unwanted intimacy when dealing her customers the obligatory rule of the genre says that the third act edward and vivian will finally truly kiss allegedly planned as grim downbeat drama until garry marshall came on board as director pretty woman has been transformed in all senses of the word into classic fairy tale la cinderella the premise is hardly believable and its portrait of prostitutes hanging out on the streets of boulevard is just about the most idealized portrayal that there could have possibly been you honestly do not need highiq or any iq for that matter guess how the will end and the story is as old as my great great grandma bertha the supporting characters are almost all sketchily written and lessthangratifying and the screenplay is no award winner and yet amidst all of these qualms and flaws pretty woman is an astoundingly charming motion picture and it is definately easy see why it became such an overnight sensation moviegoers you would actually be amazed how far bemusement can go and there are few select moments not even whole scenes mind you that are as romantic as anything have seen on in the additionally the belongs and its success can be attributed two people and two people only and they are richard gere and julia roberts playing sex symbols throughout the such pictures as american gigolo and an officer and gentleman gere branches out here play more quiet almost shy but still alluring character that believably could sweep julia roberts off her feet and vice versa julia roberts in her breakthrough role after wellreceived mistic pizza and steel magnolia for she was nominated for an academy award is radiant and funny as the wordly vivian who surprisingly could be role model for impressionistic viewers not for her line of work but more for her sheer intelligence it would have probably been easy have written vivian as merely flake but screenwriter f lawton clearly cared too much about his central characters do such thing after pretty woman roberts along meg ryan became the reigning queen of romantic comedies her latest being the justreleased runaway bride repairs gere and roberts together once again and no wonder roberts has continually proven not only be strong actress flare for comedy but also one who can efficiently do drama and in almost every she appears in it is difficult not fall in love her along her male costar an especially strong scene that gere and roberts do together takes place after edward foolishly tells one of his coworkers that vivian is actually prostitute and he then approaches her making sexual advances no only does this make vivian feel cheap especially since she had previously been posing as more professional eloquent young lady but it also maddens her that edward would demean and betray her in such way and ultimately causes her question where exactly her life is leading and if she likes this particular path on the more dreamy side the is filled romantic scenes that are simply effervescent behold especially one in edward enters into the hotels lounge see vivian turn around and not only reveal her marvelous cocktail dress but also her inner and outer glowing beauty another subtle moment has vivian lovingly blowing kiss edward who is asleep and placing it on his lips since she still is unsure if she should be getting attached this man who may very well be out of her life forever in short couple of days pretty woman does not blatantly step wrong until the very last scene is happy ending as you would expect and would not have it any other way that somehow does not work perhaps because of its undeniable contrivances this one misstep does not put damper on the rest of the though because there is just far too much magic at work here disaffirm such petty problem helped along warm memorable supporting performance from laura san giacomo as vivians best friend and roommate and fabulously catchy soundtrack in all of the songs prominently aid in the movies overall fulfillment pretty woman is sparkler of motion picture and has what it takes act as blueprint on how make the quintessential romantic comedy

the dramatic comedy cousins has all the necessary ingredients witty and whimsical script inspired performances great sense of humor large and wonderful cast and the beautiful scenery of vancouver it is movie of weddings marriage family infidelity andoh yeslove like men and baby cousins is an americanized version of french cousin cousine the plot is complicated but it goes something like this larry and tom are cousins each of whom is notsohappilymarried tom starts an affair larrys wife tish and get even larry and toms wife maria pretend have an affair of their own soon the pretending turns love and cousins is off and running cousins is populated wide assortment of interesting characters and caricatures the acting is first rate down even the smallest supporting role and virtually every performance deserves mention ted danson in his first starring role finally gets play character some depth and sensitivity while larry may be confident and charming like sam malone on cheers he is also complex and vulnerable more between his ears than empty space as maria isabella rossellini is joy watch she is shy sensuous and immensely alluring sean young is perfectly cast as larrys picture perfect wife tish superficial and trendy makeup consultant keith coogan from adventures in babysitting is wonderfully weird and eccentric as larrys rebellious son mitch and finally lloyd bridges in tour de force performance is mitchs rambunctious grandfather he provides some of cousins best lines and laughs like moonstruck cousins is mix of drama and comedy the is larger than life and has keen sense of the absurd it understands human nature extremely well and milks it for every possible laugh and hearttug how often do you see movie where you believe that two characters truly and sincerely care for and love each other as friends and as lovers well its credit cousins is just such movie let us hope the french continue provide us the inspiration make films like cousins

this remake of la cage aux folles features gay couple pretending be straight in order pull the wool over the eyes of their sons future inlaws the couple robin williams and nathan lane are about as archetypal or as the less kind might put it stereotypical gays possible williams owns nightclub featuring drag queens where his partner performs as the featured star they live above the club in what could not possibly be mistaken as heterosexual abode williams is excellent as should be no surprise gene hackman as rightwing potential fatherinlaw is refreshing in one of his few comedic roles the real star is lane his attempted transformation from one of the most obviously gay men in the world the straightshooting uncle is hilarious perhaps it is personal failing on my part but the crying and screaming drag queen faux high drama just grates on my nerves and the first few minutes of this are filled it luckily for me at least it does not last long and the rest of the story focuses on the relationship between the men their son and the deception the question of stereotypes is touchy one these guys personify the homophobic gay image you can almost hear the swishing if you think that they are supposed be representative of every gay man in the world you will be outraged but if you can accept the view is that this is movie about gay individuals you will love it your choice

seen may at m at the crossgates cinema guilderland y theater my brother john for theater rating excellent seats sound and picture critics note this review is the longest have ever written and still only scratches the surface would recommend this be read only those who have seen the as form of critical analysis as my friend and fellow critic ted prigge said in his review of the phantom menace how do even write this review never mind the fact that have been waiting for new star wars movie since was seven years old never mind the fact everyone on the internet had already dissected and discussed the movie before it was even released never mind that there is so much going on in this movie in terms of plot action special effects and longterm story that analyze every aspect would take lot of time and energy and still would not cover everything and also like ted does in all of his reviews will try review this in way different from my usual reviews and instead write as casually as possible as if was talking directly you the reader before we can begin analyzing the specific aspects of the many of the most general and most significant factors must be considered get the specifics of the skip this and the next four paragraphs as has been made obvious for the last several years another trilogy of films will be produced account for the missing initial three installments of the star wars series the first of the films was actually episode four not one george lucas the creator of the series has probably just assumed most people know the firstproduced trilogy star wars the empire strikes back and return of the jedi is actually the second trilogy chronologically in media interviews in the past he has explained why the movies were made out of order but cannot recall his reasons this new he as writer and director has also assumed viewers are at least vaguely familiar the storylines and significant plot points of the first trilogy err second trilogy well you know what mean and in order for this review be thorough many of those significant points must be mentioned unfortunately may serve as spoilers so proceed caution critics note it is one my personal policy not intentionally analyze spoilers because would like my reviews be able make sense the reader both before and after viewing the reviewed but it would be nearly impossible do the justice here without breaking the rule critics note reviewing this also breaks the universal critics law of reviewing movies as roger ebert coined it is not what movie is about but how it is about it because so many outside factors come into play in the films plot and significance as part of trilogy and just considering modern society it again would be difficult if not impossible simply review the as completely autonomous story first of all we have catalog what we know about the before even going into it we know that young anakin skywalker will grow up become the evil ruler darth vader who is also the father of luke skywalker who will lead successful revolution against him and his empire we know obiwan ben kenobi was the trainer of anakin in the ways of the force in attempts become jedi knight but would fail and thus anakin would fall the dark side we also know something about the force itself that it is some kind of universal force determines fate and can be manipulated those whose minds are expanded enough believe in it and feel it the jedi what we do not know for sure is the history of the ruling of the galaxy is most likely much longer and more complex than any government we have had here on earth me this was one of the most fascinating aspects of the first three films because there seemed be subtle definite order all the complexity also it seems that we are supposed be familiar few other details about the story have come out of the thousands of comic books and paperbacks published in the years since the movies ended most notably details regarding the emperor from empire and jedi and that he was once senator and his last name is palpatine for those who have not kept up all the star wars paraphernalia over the years there is still way know these details simply recognizing an actor or his voice at least the phantom menace being the first chapter of long saga one would assume the basic groundwork would be laid including the history behind all the major factors of the series especially the force and the jedi knights unfortunately this does more of the opposite as it simply builds on top of what must be history so long and detailed it could never be explained did not liked that aspect this and is one of the reasons it falls just short of greatness if you are going tell story from the beginning tell it from the beginning is it possible that after this trilogy is complete there could be another trilogy of episodes through clarify the back story even further but digress have said so much and yet have not even touched on the specifics of the itself all these necessary disclaiming elements should go show just how vast the story of the star wars series is and this individual itself what we get here is movie not unlike any of the other three we have come know and love since the late its similarity the other films helps keep the spirit of the series familiar but at the same time seems be flaw in the filmmaking process itself since it sometimes rings of unoriginality the basic story is rather sorted complex and even confusing at times we are told that an army known as the trade federation has set up blockade around an seemingly insignificant planet called naboo we are not given too many details clarify the back story of what the federation is and what their purpose is instead the opts get its story moving quickly we are introduced two jedi the master quigon jinn neeson and his apprentice obiwan kenobi mcgregor the two are acting as ambassadors of some sort in hopes of ending the obvious hostility between the federation and the planets queen amidala portman the leader of the federation an alien called viceroy is following the orders of strange mythical character an older human man whose face and body are covered and shadowed the black robe and hood he wears he is referred as lord sidious but considering his appearance and especially that creepy evil voice of his he is obviously one of the most significant characters in the series sidious communicates viceroy only through digital transmissions and never in person clearly his actual whereabouts are something he wants keep secret because that would also reveal his identity is never openly revealed in the but should be clear most viewers have feeling we will delve into his background in the next two films but it does not take the long spring into action and within minutes our hero jedi are fighting for their lives and the films story begins move along the does not have one specific plot and works in the same manner as the other films in the series where as what we get is one miniplot and adventure on top of another there are so many of these miniplotswithinplots in this would not describe them all because it is what gives the movie its hook the other films have relied on this type of storytelling but because of the limits of the technology at the time the films screenplays were also limiting the sense of limitlessness here is what gives the phantom menace its unique traits as we already know the takes place at least generation or two before the original star wars trilogy means lot of the background was unclear andor unexplained may be cleared up here as it is the beginning of the vast epic story and here the most significant storyline is that involving the discovery of yearold anakin skywalker lloyd quigon jinn and his introduction the jedi council briefly summarize the story jinn stumbles upon skywalker in an attempt buy parts for queen amidalas spaceship was damaged in efforts free her from the federation their meeting on tatooine is mostly chance but of course jinn chalks it up the will of the force jinn can feel that skywalker has great natural power in the force and through another subplot involving bet on skywalker in fantastic race he will enter more and more details of his significance begin reveal themselves this also provides for new elaboration and explanation of the force has never been mentioned before in fact it seems be something so important it is upsetting it has never been mentioned before the element seriously undermines the mystical aspect of the force and transforms it into something more physical and scientific is completely unnecessary the films third act all the major significant elements become tied together in rather familiar execution of the plot it is funny how the reality of the star wars world seems so
