embedded in mythology new agelike philosophy and religion and yet the solution all the major conflicts in the series has been violence not that this technique has not been used in movies and in reallife situations countless times throughout history and at least it is all in the spirit of the ultimate powers of good versus evil in fun and exciting matter it does border of the cartoonish sometimes but that is just the appealing our inner child is the basic reason the entire saga exists and has become such big part of our modern society the phantom menace delivers exactly what you would expect from star wars is why it succeeds as well as it does but is always why it never truly achieves greatness so many things in the we have seen before and done more heart because the filmmakers concentrated just bit more on story and character because they were limited but this is far from bad because it at least embraces the spirit of sheer fun at the movies

the story of us rob reiner is the second movie this fall that touches the viewer in way they are rarely touched as they can see their everyday lives in the usually once in year films well has two of them the other being the instant classic about very dysfunctional family american beauty the story of us about the highs and lows of marriage and family is well written heartbreaking and insightful that made the majority of the audience including myself cry the story of us tells the story of ben bruce willis and katie michelle pfeiffer jordan and asks the question can marriage survive years of marriage the is about two individuals who have come together spent good chunk of their lives together and shows when our main characters are him and her during the bad times and when they are us during the good times the story of us is about their entire years of marriage that is collapsing day day ben and katie now only see and live each other because they do not want devastate their children the fact that their parents no longer or at least say they do not love each other anymore ben cartoonist and katie crossword puzzle writer have grown apart during their fifteen years of marriage as they have grown follow different views on life family and marriage katie is the more organized sophisticated type who wants plan everything out while ben is spontaneous adventurous individual who does not mind doing things differently than they were planned the story of us plays out nicely as the opens ben sharing his story therapist told the viewer through flashbacks as the progresses it switches between ben and katie talking their therapist their stories being told flashbacks of their marriage this method is highly effective as we see the characters changing from year year slowly growing apart through the flashbacks we get see the story of them through both of the characters eyes and this gives us strong sense of what their characters are really like as the story of us has three dimensional believable main characters the screenplay written jessie nelson stepmom and alan zweibel dragnet is touching down earth work that hits chord within the viewer much like another one of nelsons films stepmom the script has an open honesty and outlook on life one that is so realistic you feel uncomfortable at many times because so many situations the characters are in are undeniably familiar as most families these days most go through the hard times as ben and katie must if it was not for the first minutes that the writers wrote are rugged and certainly flawed the story of us would have been this years best picture bruce willis usual actionadventure star has certainly turned himself around in the past year he went from being man who was being typecast the same role in action movies distinguished sophisticated actor as in last summers the sixth sense and now in the story of us willis shows the world what he can really do if he is fed good script although would not pick willis as the choice actor for ben jordan willis handles himself nicely and shines in few of the films most powerful scenes enough that make his performance definite contender comes awards season where start about michelle pfeiffer pfeiffers performance is spellbinding and ultimately strong as she brings her character life such charisma and emotion you wonder how how it is possible for someone portray real person such realism pfeiffers performance is one that if not recognized the academy next spring will be in the hearts of any viewer that has watched this moving the story of us is one of most real yet funny films as the razor sharp script evens out the laughs and the tears keep the viewer hooked superb acting direction writing story and soundtrack that always sets the mood for the is beautifully composed eric clapton and marc shaiman make the story of us touching unforgettable motion picture that will touch the hearts of viewers across the country and will certainly become one of the most talked about movies of the fall the films major high points are the fights between ben and katie as the two constantly accuse of each other of whose fault it is that their marriage has collapsed and although they also say things like it is over or hate you you can tell the two still share deep connection and that inside somewhere they are still an us the bottom line wonderful enchanting and heartbreaking one of the most realistic heartbreaking films in recent years

warren beatty returns the screens in the funniest craziest and hard hitting movie in his career based on story concocted himself and also written beatty bulworth gives good insight of what beatty thinks of the american government system beatty stars as senator jay bulworth who is going through nervous breakdown after hiring someone kill him he completely changes his campaign strategy and tells the honest truth about what is _really_ happening in american politics much the annoyance of assistant dennis murphy platt instead of everyone hating him the american public love him however inside his party more people want kill him than just the hired assassin and he also strikes relationship black girl nina berry it is remarkable that this was released at all much more open than the rather subdued primary colours bulworth barely gives the american politic system good name the outrageous remarks bulworth makes his potential voters are very funny and also somewhat true it is great that beatty is not afraid let loose on subject talking of beatty he is excellent in the role of the demented senator clearing having fun and seeing warren beatty have fun is rare sight indeed even in dick tracy he was the most straighten face actor then again he was the only characters face we could completely see the gives an opportunity for the year old beatty indulge in some rapping he does gusto and also quite well and seeing beatty as homeboy has be seen be believed it is nice see that beatty can laugh at himself second best is oliver platt as the flustered coke snorting assistant who goes over the top when he finally snaps halle berry is fine and sexy as the intellectual nina who comes like the senator also popping up in the supporting cast is paul sorvino wit a strange accent laurie metcalf as the exact same characters she is also played and christine baranski of cybill fame as bullworths wife who all contribute the fun and this being political the ubiquitous larry king makes an appearance as shock himself the writing and directing both beatty are above par the direction is very nearly sitcom like but suits the perfectly and both the politics are gangland parts are handled well the script is funny and the raps are actually well produced and humorous and quite clever they are not cringe inducing at least the script makes many points about society in america today and is not afraid make any bold statements about what is flawed system best of all the is thought provoking but directed and written in such way that the feels as light as feather and is very entertaining there is also great rap soundtrack some well chosen tunes bulworth is many advantages and few flaws perhaps it could be somewhat embarrassing see year old man rapping but beatty does it so well it is irrelevant in fact there is very little against bulworth except for the language is very heavy but then again it should be expected bulworth then is well worth watching david wilcock review you know for kids norville barnes

the long and illustrious career of robin williams has included both forgettable turns like mrs doubtfire and flubber was punctuated the actors first academy award in for his role in good will hunting it was his first truly dramatic role since dead poets society and critical remarks were unanimously positive his next role that of deceased pediatrician in what dreams may come was unfortunately lackluster and so after sixyear stint as comedic actor the proof on whether or not williams can cut it in the dramatic league has come down patch adams williams is the title character hunter patch adams sporting scruffy facial hair that falls between the cleanshavenness of dreams and the grotesque hairiness of will hunting we are introduced patch as he commits himself mental institution because of his suicidal tendancies it is at the institution however that he discovers latent talent for relating people he removes himself from the institution and enrolls at the university of virginias medical college where he finds that medical doctrine is calculating impersonal trade his attempts inject humanity into the profession result in several bouts expulsion and the movie climaxes patchs appearance before the state medical board the characters are welldefined in an oscarworthy sense although the script does not perform well as narrative there is little story be told outside of patchs skitlength experiences the script does go long way toward building the relationships of characters at medical school patch meets up truman schiff daniel london an outsider like himself who relishes patchs zest for humanity the two instantly become the best of friends and it is easy see why monica potter plays patchs love interest young woman who personifies the things that patch hates about medical school for some reason he is attracted her and although it never gets said the audience understands from an intrinsic point of view the script based on hunter adams own story works well this way the rest of the cast bob gunton as the villain professor in particular is solid director tom shadyac liar liar leads us in and out of patchs life in sound intentional manner combined williams presence on screen the movie rarely becomes boring patch adams lack of purpose is its major shortcoming and for the first ninety minutes out of two hours there is little feeling of continuity or the passage of time nevertheless it is an emotionally moving picture and patch adams looks be one of the more memorable of the holiday season it succeeds at everything it tries and only fails at the stuff it does not try in the first place and large there may be another oscar nomination herein for williams but more importantly it is entertainment for the entire family

in recent years harrison ford has been such grave screen presence scowling through the likes of tom clancys jack ryan series _the_fugitive_ and last years smash _air_force_one_ that one wonders if the rogue charm that made him such superstar had been completely drained from his system apparently it was just lying dormant ivan reitmans enjoyable romantic comedyadventure _six_days _seven_nights_ the lovable scoundrel is back giving audiences fresh reminder of why ford is one of the most enduring and popular modern screen icons ford plays quinn harris carefree and slightly slobby endearingly so pilot in the tropics whose brokendown plane crashes in storm stranding him and his charter new york magazine editor robin monroe anne heche on deserted island of course the sophisticated robin and the saltoftheearth quinn are at odds long before the plane goes down and all manner of hostile repartee is exchanged between the two from their first meeting while some of the lines fall flat the formulaic motions work because of the unexpectedly electric chemistry between ford and heche both actors who have largely done serious works as of late seem liberated the lack of dramatic weight on their shoulders and they deliver their zingers as weak as they sometimes are beguiling abandon naturally there is nothing like lifethreatening crisis bring two people together and quinn and robins warmup each other is sped up even further the arrival of some bloodthirsty pirates granted some conflict needed be introduced on the island but this tackedon development from writer michael browning is bit too obviously thrown in for the purpose of adding gratuitous action scenes but the point is get the two together and their newfound affection causes complications for both but mostly robin who came the islands on vacation her fiance frank david schwimmer who frantically awaits her return on the home island reitman and old reliable hand at breezy comedies keeps the pace brisk and capably handles the more actionoriented sequences his big accomplishment however is bringing the old smiling ford back as appealing and charismatic as he always is ford has not been quite this charming and affable in years he is obviously having blast and the audience cannot help but have one along him holding her own is heche whose scrappy character never becomes the screaming ninny she initially promises be as the plane goes down she frantically pops stress pills she can take her lumps physical and otherwise just as well as quinn making her formidable foil and ideal match formulaic and light as feather _six_days _seven_nights_ could be cited as classic example of the summer popcorn movie seasons lack of substance it is certainly fluff but it is unpretentious undemanding andmost importantlyfun fluff that goes down as easily as frothy pina colada on balmy tropical beach pass the popcorn

near the end of analysts remarked that the year would be the last in disney would stand alone as the animation king the following year saw the first sleeper entry into the genre from studio other than the magic kingdom twentieth century fox gave baronial russia the masses in the form of anastasia at best that is all it was sleeper hit designed surprise but not shake the industry in however things have been decidedly different there have been number of pushes on disneys death grip on the market and fiftyone weeks into new champion has emerged dreamworks the prince of egypt succeeds where all of the other conventionally animated products have failed the other two contenders warner brothers quest for camelot and disneys own annual entry mulan lacked inspiration and drive respectively although camelot was borderlineabysmal and cannot really be considered shot at the title mulan had the makings of winner unfortunately it was saturated traditional disneycute animation and lost points against the rapidlychanging face of the competition in making the prince of egypt dreamworks has strayed from all of these hallmarks and created genuinely unique product the animation is flawless and aside from bugs life is the bestlooking movie date the animators have nimbly mixed both flat and spatial effects and the dd combination is something that artists from disney and fox have heretofore struggled the key success however was that the visuals were used not just because they looked cool but also as method of advancing the plot namely some of the most important action sequences like the parting of the red sea were done almost entirely in dreamworks is the first studio prove that they have got the stuff of success and that they are capable of challenging disney the story is also wellwritten and the characters voiced talent for the most part the plot follows its source material the book of exodus although only in the most general sense the writers took few creative liberties and most do not damage the story in any way in fact the shakespearean relationship between moses val kilmer and the pharaoh rameses ralph fiennes makes the story more interesting if anything moses hebrew is saved from the slaughter of the firstborn sons his mother when she sets him in basket on the nile he floats into the pharaoh seti patrick stewart palace and is taken in the royal family moses grows up but learns of his heritage and flees into the desert where he discovers the burning bush and is commissioned god return egypt and free the slaves this time rameses is now pharaoh and the two brothers now on opposite sides of the line face off in battle of wills and divine intervention the cast of voices is most impressive and also includes such noteables as sandra bullock jeff goldblum danny glover and steve martin the script does not have lot of oneliners in it and god is reduced voice that might well be mistaken for the same one that spoke kevin costner in field of dreams but overall the story is exciting and interesting it is decidedly for an older crowd and the tykes who have not had few years of religion class will be hopelessly lost but for those who make the bid the prince of egypt can be great watch

capsule rock and roll fable indeed like hubert selby jr novel filtered through equal parts damon runyan and bruce springsteen and ton of fun streets of fire bills itself as rock and roll fable and the description is perfect this is stylish greatlooking and breezily enjoyable movie that feels like hubert selby jr novel damon runyan rewrite irected bruce springsteen noir is one of the few truly american movie genres aside from the musical and the western this is postwwii brooklyn noir for lack of better label generous injection of rock roll and an allaround confrontational attitude it all works the plot is simplicity itself rocker ellen aim diane lane is kidnapped vicious street gang led bloodthirsty fellow named raven willem dafoe very nasty her old soldier flame played michael pare comes back into town save her but does not count on whole bunch of things going askew that is about the entire plot save for the spats ellens manager hilarious rick moranis an encounter doowop group that winds up becoming ellens supporting act and whole gang of other fun little touches but in movies like this when is the plot important the movie is all style all visuals and attitudes quotable lines and posturing and it delivers all those things consistently and great brio and pacing no surprise that it was directed walter hill hrs who understands this kind of macho romanticism perfectly and has put together movie that is mixture of times and sensibilities but perfectly unified in tone when was the last time you could say something like that about movie especially movie where it seems like someone gets decked on the jaw and passes out every minutes on cue streets of fire is not the greatest movie ever made but it occupies totally unique little niche and enjoys the position it has anyone weakness for doowop neon motorcycles rainy streets the el studebakers gang pictures lonely heroes and greatlooking gal giving the microphone both lungs will eat this movie up did

jack nicholson has funny way of playing characters very few redeeming qualities but whom you end up liking anyway in as good as it gets the character in question is melvin udall successful novelist obsessivecompulsive disorder who seems bent on having as little contact people around him as possible except when he feels like being royal pain in the youknowwhere he is mean mean really mean the opening scene shows him shoving little dog down the trash chute of his manhattan condominium every day melvin eats at the same cafe sits at the same table and gets served the same waitress you can tell that this is his favorite place be vicious nuisance when his waitress carol helen hunt tells him he can just go sit in another section and all the other waitresses just cringe one day melvin makes comment that goes far and carol genuinely hurt comes down on him like ton of bricks at that point we find that she is not only the only person who can put up him as matter of course but is also the only person who can get him too another person who often crosses melvins sights is simon greg kinnear an artist who lives on melvins floor aside from the fact that he lives near the terror of the city simon has the added benefit of being gay making him prime target simons friend frank cuba gooding jr also gay does not fare much better when simon walks in on pair of men robbing his apartment he is brutally beaten and sent the hospital and frank who has grown tired of seeing his friend take the verbal abuse dished out his neighbor intimidates melvin into watching after simons dog while he convalesces this is the same dog melvin had earlier shoved down the garbage an interesting thing happens when melvin takes this dog in melvin gets like the dog and the two develop an attachment is the catalyst melvins softening up the world around him it does not happen overnight but throughout the he bites his tongue here cares little there and most miraculously falls in love one of the best elements of this is watching melvin try express feelings are not the usual negative ones he so often shares others he is traveling terra incognita here and it shows good performances are turned in all principal players in this especially nicholson and hunt they play well off of each other and have genuine chemistry makes it pleasure watch them on screen greg kinnear who is becoming known for his supporting roles is also very good at playing the vulnerable simon he gives short monologue about what it means for him be an artist and delivers it such inspiration and conviction that you actually get feel some of what he feels cuba gooding jr performs hypedup level of energy contrasts nicely that of kinnear and comes through near constant comic performance the screenplay mark andrus and james brooks is clever touching and funny the best part about it however is that it is filled characters we care about because they are actually interesting melvin is man we cannot quite figure out but whose mannerisms and quirky qualities capture our attention carol is working woman living her mother trying take care of child debilitating respiratory problem simon is man who is success in his circle of peers but who is still not accepted much of society combined the talent of the actors these characters make the the one noticeable area where the is lacking however is the absence of cuba gooding jr through the second half his character makes an exit is supposed be temporary but the ends before his return leaving his relationship simon and melvin unresolved would have liked have seen more of his character in general in addition part in the films conclusion there is one actor who will probably not be recognized any awards but who contributes greatly many of the movies best scenes and who deserves mention this is that little dog he plays such pivotal role melvins character development actually serves forward the plot and has some absolutely scenestealing moments that it is hard believe he is simply an animal award or no however when even the dog puts in good performance you know you have got an outstanding movie

have been told several people you are old fashioned you want do everything hand topiary gardener george mendonca complains defending his continued resort hand shears in trimming his intricately privetsculpted animal creations this is the only way you can do it and do it right snip snip some people believe that we are gonna replace ourselves building these machines and that may be muses mit robot scientist rodney brooks who builds robots that run on instinct there may not be place for humans in the future if we are really successful you feel that there is and looking directly into errol morriss camera know you are you know am in some ways the slickest yet from nonfiction auteur morris the thin blue line brief history of time fast cheap out of control is reportage of the highest order journalism students should dream of making connections like these crosscutting among interviews and filmed segments morris traces the lives of four disparate professionals who seem share nothing but an immersion in their work and then threads them around one another in an intricate quadruple helix the fun is settling into your theater seat and wondering just what the hell one story can possibly have do the other what morris manages is something akin an intellectual magic trick an interrogative sleight of hand one of the things that feels different about an errol morris documentary besides the alwaysstriking visuals is the interview style where subjects seem look directly at the viewer weary of pressing his cheek against the camera lens get this effect during conversations morris developed an elaborate doublecamera gadget he calls halfjokingly the interrotron through rig that uses pair of teleprompters project video images of the interviewer for the subject and vice versa these folks talk startlingly right the camera the video image of morris and extension the audience the gardener wonders whether after his death anyone will be interested in maintaining the garden that he is devoted half his life tending the robot scientist is more than little pleased note that his creations may be primal examples of what an insect or even an animal is complicated set of sensory receptors the mole rat specialist is delighted catalog the ways in these vermin animals behave like insects and notes that they may be more suited longterm survival than people and the circus trainer pines for longlost ideal that was exemplified worldrenowned trainer and showman clyde beatty who starred in such serials as zombies of the stratosphere excerpted at some length here affection starting detect the patterns fast cheap out of control contains multitude of parallels and tiny intersections culminating in what feels like an elegy the is dedicated morriss late mother and stepfather the is balanced on that airy precipice dividing the already musty past from the alternately exhilarating and terrifying space that is the future the title is taken from brooks wish that nasa would send payload of hundreds of expendable robots scurry about the martian surface creating sort of road map for the terrain fast cheap and out of control able assists from editors karen schmeer and shondra merrill and cinematographer robert richardson oliver stones longtime collaborator this becomes cinematic contraption that is wonder of narrative divergence and coherence further enhancing the pictures wacky intellectual mood is the playful score alloy orchestra founder caleb sampson different story threads inform and comment on one another the serene inscrutability of kieslowski or surrealist dream cobbling together out of these motley musings thesis on the nature of craftsmanship invention and existence itself morris reveals the presence of cosmic themes creation evolution death in earthbound lives at the same time and just as significantly he pays tribute consuming passion for ones work this breakdown of the dichotomy between the everyday and the extraordinary is likely as profound as anything you will encounter in pop culture this year and the visuals cry out for the big screen do not miss it directed errol morris edited karen schmeer and shondra merrill cinematography robert richardson music caleb sampson s

the deer hunter directed michael cimino is truly one of the greatest movies ever made captivating drama about the lives of group of friends from small russianamerican pennsylvania community the deer hunter promises be one of those movies that you will never forget in this academy award winner for best picture of outstanding performances are turned in all actors and ciminos brilliant directing provides the perfect vision into the characters lives the first act of the provides us an inside look into the lives of group of men from small community who work and hang out together michael portrayed perfectly robert de niro is shown early on as the natural leader of the group after days work the men leave their jobs at factory head down the local bar where john george dzundza works three of the men michael steven john savage and nick christopher walken will be leaving shortly for vietnam but not before steven gets married after the marriage the group including axel chuck aspegren spend one last day on hunting trip one of their favorite pasttimes this sequence of events enables us view the lifestyle of normal group of men who will be suddenly and permanently affected the ravages and separations of war the wedding scenes although criticized many as being quite long actually enhance even more the purpose of the first act the outstanding performances de niro walken streep savage and cazale who died very shortly after the filming of the movie was completed really begin shine through and promise not halt in the near future the second act of the movie begins the trio of men on the front lines in vietnam stationed in south vietnamese village being attacked the viet cong the men are eventually captured and held in floating prison on river this prison run the c initiates the horrifying scenes in the movie where the prisoners are forced play russian roulette against each other steven who is emotionally marred this turn of events is secluded in tiger cage water up his face when he refuses participate michael shows his leadership again convincing nick that the only way that steven will survive is if the two friends play against each other and moreover they must play bullets in the gun personally felt that de niros absolutely gripping portrayal really was displayed in brilliant way in these and the following scenes the men are eventually able escape but are separated michael is able get steven who ends up losing his legs medical care while nick finds his way saigon and u army hospital michael returns home and does not feel at all like hero he wants avoid the celebrations and recognition that his friends would like bestow upon him he assumes that nick is still lost in vietnam the third act concentrates more on walkens character who eventually stumbles upon small gambling operation where the game is again russian roulette only in this game you play for money michael has learned that nick is possibly still alive and returns saigon attempt find him the two narrowly find each other at the russian roulette games but do not link up until michael discovers nick participating in the games and tries bring him home very emotional and for many very disturbing movie the deer hunter is truly magnificent movie that should not be missed the greatest performances possible are turned in all actors and ciminos directing is considered be at his alltime best in this is equally dazzling do not miss this it will captivate and astound you

storytelling this compelling who needs books based on the book author james ellroy a confidential is probably one of the best piece of work produced in recent years together director curtis hanson the hand that rocks the cradle the river wild whom ellroy corroborated closely throughout the shooting of the resulted in movie plot and and script so tight an atom would have squeeze itself through set in the the story revolves around policemen of vivid personalities jack vincennes spacey is the cop who is more concerned on busting fame and stardom ala style concentrating heavily on work will attract him media attention there is also the young hotshot rookie ed exley pearce fresh out of the academy and allout carve name for himself in the footsteps of his legendary cop father the tough and unnerving bud white crowe cop who believes in justice the swift and violent way policemen distinct in their characters and paths but all of them working in place where there is no real distinction between good and evil when his partner is murdered on the day of his resignation bud sets out find the people responsible but unwittingly delved himself into something more than just simple robbery murder even after exley receives promotion for his work on the murder case happenings began link itself the murder the eventually reach point of convergence when what actually began as personal investigation turns out be an uncovering of complex web of organisedcrime in the last time remember so clever and compelling was when watched the usual suspects in a confidential you do not get the shock and cleverness as the former but it has lot more of story going for it there is not single moment in the in felt was slow at all surprisingly though spacey did very convincing job as the streetwise vincennes the movie was carried mostly the two rather unknowns pearce and crowe pearces exley is cool and calculative in his actions and there is slight hint of val kilmer in his appearance crowes bud white is the most impressive of all headstrong and temperamental he should obtain some sort of recognition for his work here superb acting wonderful storytelling and one of the best climaxing gunfights ever easily the best piece for

synopsis committed an asylum the marquis de sade rush continues publish pornographic literature aided young maid madeleine winslet abbe coulmier phoenix who runs the hospital disapproves of the stories but humours him in the hope of achieving cure de sades craft and life are threatened when the emperor dispatches dr royercollard michael caine stop the marquis work permanently review quills is an exploration of the marquis de sade his madness his cruelty and his perversion his obsession sex in any form no matter how obscene but quills also details the marquis determination write in spite of the obstacles put in his path and propagate his words the masses the extent de sade is willing go practise his trade is amongst the movies most intriguing elements as when de sade scribes story in his own blood or narrates tale via of chain of fellow inmates cell cell provide contrast the marquis wright involves him two very different characters one is the abbe handsome charming and kindly man whose desires are stymied his oath god the abbe lusts for madeleine but it is the wizened marquis who is able have her and then there is royercollard hypocrite who in truth is as sadistic as any of the marquis motley creations rush is splendid as de sade utterly inhabiting the character kaufmans direction is fine and he is able bring sense of bizarre humour the grim proceedings the plot itself is rather mundane and plays out unsurprisingly but this is virtually unimportant for two hours quills acquaints us the marquis de sade and more frightening still allows us brief insight into his scatological soul

more and more television shows having gay characters and even the infamous ellen sitcom being centered on the life of lesbian the movie industry too seems be gaining more and more homosexual based plot lines the birdcage was critically acclaimed as was this years chasing amy then along came in out and all three of these films are on my top ten list for the years in they were released it is also noticeable that this alternative lifestyle becomes less and less taboo as the years go and it seems that using comedy as medium is proving worthwhile effort while it is very serious issue many it is the comedies that people are flocking see and that are gaining notoriety but the way we are using comedy present homosexuality is also changing quite dramatically while the gay community was once very stereotyped and used laugh at it is more and more becoming something we laugh and when movie like in out comes along it is something that both heterosexuals and homosexuals should be able thoroughly enjoy it does not poke fun at the lifestyle it simply uses it all it is comedic capacity just as love sex marriage birth death and anything else has been the idea for in out was born the day tom hanks won his oscar for portraying an aidsafflicted gay man in philadelphia if you remember during his acceptance speech hanks gave highly emotional tribute the gay community and even sighted former gay teacher of his as major inspiration in his life it is serious and touchy subject but producer scott rudin viewed it as the setting for potentially hilarious comedy and pitched it screenwriter paul rudnick it is true that if this same had been written heterosexual it may have been more controversial but because it was written an openly gay writer the prerogative was set kevin kline who only seems become more and more acclaimed stars as howard brackett high school english teacher in the small picturesque town of greenleaf indiana after threeyear engagement fellow teacher emily montgomery joan cusack wedding date has been set and the hubbub surrounding it is almost as big as that surrounding another huge story greenleaf high graduate cameron drake matt dillon is up for best actor oscar the small town eagerly awaits both events and both seem quite astronomical but little does anyone know how much one will affect the other when cameron drake is announced the winner the excitement is heightened as he pays tribute his high school english teacher mr brackett everyone is cheering back in greenleaf that is until cameron tacks on those three calamitous words and he is gay the town becomes silent as the entire population joins in simultaneous jaw drop the thing is nobody including howard can understand how cameron came that conclusion and such wild and unexpected news can only wreak havoc in such conservative american haven such as greenleaf naturally the questions pour from howards fiancee parents debbie reynolds wilford brimley students and the high schools principal tom halliwell bob newhart and the evidence starts become more and more obvious howard is clean neat honest sincere romantic and perhaps the most incriminating fact he loves barbara streisand the frenzy is not helped any when camera crews from every conceivable news magazine and entertainment tonight wannabe show up at greenleaf high the very next morning one particular reporter is peter malloy tom selleck of inside entertainment who unlike the collage of other reporters wants spend whole week in the life of howard brackett including coverage of his wedding the intrusion is all but welcome howard who is going more and more out of his mind each passing minute it seems that no matter where he turns camera is being shoved in his face and questions regarding homosexuality are being tossed him like frisbees the dominoes begin tumble as howards closest friends begin acting different and principal halliwell hints at possible termination of employment should howard indeed be gay it all sounds very devastating and it would be if it were not presented nearperfection one of this years most delightful ensemble casts kline seems only improve age and he is downright perfect here the great thing about this is that every single character has moment shine and they use it wonderfully every single actor turns in one of their best performances ever dillon has never been so likeable cusack has never seemed so perfect for role and brimley reynolds and newhart all provide huge laughs when they are up bat rudnicks script is heavily laced wit and humor and you will likely find yourself laughing out loud for solid ninety minutes while in out does not carry enough give it four stars it remains one of the best done films of the year allaround the script is exuberant the actors are absolutely top notch and we are allowed just the perfect blend of hearttugging so as not bog down the laughs it remains solid comedy throughout its entirety yet we are still allowed sappily touching ending despite it is subject matter and one scene that comes almost too close for comfort on explaining gay sex this is movie that everyone could and should enjoy frank oz best known as voice talent for muppets directs this quite delightfully using all the potential rudnicks script has offer turns out be quite bit check this one out you will have gay old time

his last two films shine and snow falling on cedars australian director scott hicks has proven his cinematic flashbacks be some of the best out there and his latest hearts in atlantis is no different its structure beginning and ending in present day one long flashback in the middle is similar the green mile is bit ironic considering both were based on stephen king books the parallels do not end there either atlantis was adapted william goldman who had previously penned the bigscreen version of misery and is in the process of working on the script for kings dreamcatcher even the films content is bit reminiscent of mile in fact it is the perfect blend of the feelgood nostalgia of stand me also king and mystical power hokum of mile kings atlantis is book comprised of five related short stories but the main focus here is on the first and longest tale called low men in yellow coats the films title comes from the second chapter it is set in harwich connecticut where yearold bobby garfield anton yelchin lives in boarding house run his cold selfcentered mother elizabeth hope davis joe goulds secret who seems care more about her wardrobe than her son bobby spends his time his two closest friends john sullivan will rothhaar and tomboy carol gerber mika boorem who become something like the kevin paul and winnie of harwich when new tenant moves into the vacant room the fatherless bobby finds male role model in ted brautigan anthony hopkins hannibal mysterious stranger who is vague enough about his past make bobbys mom suspicious enough at least momentarily turn her head away from the mirror ted teaches his young neighbor about the wonders of literature after his cheapskate mother gives him library card for his birthday dispenses prophetic words of wisdom and even pays bobby one dollar week read him the local newspaper and keep his eyes peeled for the low men group of people chasing ted exploit his special powers will not go into what these powers are but they are considerably toned down from the book and do not involve black stuff flying out of teds mouth la mile atlantis presentday setting bookends the is based on the novels final chapter titled heavenly shades of night are falling and features david morse in yet another connection the green mile as married middleaged bobby who learns of the death of both of his childhood friends and returns the dilapidated boarding house in he spent his formative years atlantis is nowhere near as flashy as hicks cedars is disappointing but understandable considering the switch from the completely amazing robert richardson the occasionally amazing piotr sobocinski the oscarnominated cinematographer behind krzysztof kieslowskis red the acting is solid from everyone including hopkins who never once makes you think of dr lecter most impressive are youngsters yelchin and boorem who both had tiny parts in along came spider while did not really have much of problem goldmans screenplay do need point out at least one inconsistency goldman for those of you who do not read premiere writes what seems like an annual criticism of everybody elses films carefully explaining why they all suck make no sense and insult their audiences while somehow failing mention the crap that he is penned like the generals daughter it is meanspirited but fun read mostly on account of nobody else in having the balls say anything remotely negative about anybody else in the business including michael jackson j and robert blake in atlantis is supposed be told through the eyes of young bobby one would assume he would have be in each scene in order have the memory flash back well he is not and it does not make sense pg for violence and thematic elements

corey yuens latest hero is notable on two fronts first this is the bring back the shaw brothers studio back the forefront of production secondly the is the rediscovery of yuen biao the opens around the end of the qin dynasty when many immigrants were making their way shanghai poverty and crime rule most of china young man ma wing jing and his brother enter the fabled city and become laborers at the pier tam see is the most powerful gangster in town having control of the center of the city and having an alliance the british army wing jing and see become friends during confrontation their friendship grows as both men start realize their dreams wing jings be powerful and wealthy man and see settle down woman he can truly love wing jing meets the singer at the club jessica hester and falls in love her not realizing that she is the star attraction after stealing her picture from display wing jing and his brother plot impress her first they rob two foreigners of their money and cloths and set up midnight rendezvous unfortunately wing jing has run afoul of rival gangster yeung seung who has bribed the police in an effort gain control of sees night club the two bothers are arrested and held until they manage escape just before dawn jessica having waited outside in the cold her manager all night gives up and returns home see decides retire he gives the night club wing jing as repayment for saving his life during an attempted murder see arranges the trade and ask his lover valerie chow take care of wing jing unfortunately she has sided yeung seung the performances in the are all top notch fine turns takeshi kaneshiro as ma wing jing and jessica hester and valerie chow the comic turn yuen wah previously known as the mad vietnamese in samo hungs eastern condors is marvelous surprise his gift for comedy is marvelously understated and hilarious the standout is yuen biao who returns the screen after string of disappointments stellar performance his tam see is triad boss who knows that his time is coming an end but still has the cunning and craft uphold his pride his gangster is almost nonviolent in that he only retaliates never instigates violence but when the time comes fight yuen biao has never looked better corey yuen directs the maturity and sense of pacing that has been lacking in hong kong movies as of late the lighting cinematography and staging of the are beautiful watch the action scenes do not disappoint either this is the most aggressive and inventive martial art choreography have seen in some time actually surpassing jackie chans work in both rumble in the bronx and first strike the special effects team deserves praise for fantastic job of making the impossible look possible an early fight between takeshi kaneshiro and yuen biao on the back of horse is be seen be believed also noteworthy is the score for the done in marvelously lush orchestral style not representative of most hong kong fare would dare say it ranks as high as the scores for both titanic and rosewood as best of the year all in all hero marks grand return filmmaking for shaw brothers this is the that gives us faith that hong kong cinema is alive and flourishing

synopsis in this cultural exploration chinese american computer engineer named fang peter wang decides take monthlong vacation visit his sister mrs chao shen guanglan her husband mr chao hy xiaoguang and their teenage daughter lili li qinqin in beijing after years of separation fang brings his asian american wife grace sharon iwai and his collegeaged son paul kelvin han yee along both of whom do not speak chinese the encounter between the two families allows the audience compare the eastern and western cultures as well as the ambitions of individual characters opinion sometimes is plot driven sometimes it is character sketch great wall can be called culture sketch as opposed character sketch because it gently compares chinese american family beijing family fangs family is thoroughly americanized fang is an upper middle class professional who enjoys jogging and argues his boss his wife cannot cook chinese his son has white girlfriend and complains of racism when fang encourages him befriend an asian girl meanwhile fangs beijing sister advocates absolute loyalty the work unit her husband is retired official who has heard rumors of american depravity homosexuals running the streets and her daughter lili longs for american freedoms in youth culture where studying for college entrance exams is the most important thing in life the two families spend month slowly learning about each other there is no ultimate answer or final comprehensive understanding after the monthlong vacation the is neither here nor there it is neutral meandering gentle portrait of life on both sides

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned on december amidst all the yearend oscar bait releases from the major studios miramaxs genre label dimension films quietly released sly little ensemble slasher flick titled scream although the teen horror market had been given up for allbutdead in recent years the shocked industry observers scoring consistently high box office returns eventually topping million domestic and becoming one of the most successful films of its type in history while delighting audiences finally presenting set of knowing slasher flick protagonists who were aware of the all the standard cliches associated the genre the sleeper success of scream sent shockwaves through the industry suddenly everybody was looking for hip inexpensive fright films that might be able reap similar fortunes the strategy of casting young tv stars draw the youth demographic was given boost scream director wes craven previously best known as the creator of new lines nightmare on elm street series was thrust back into the limelight and screams rookie scribe kevin williamson burst onto the scene in stunning fashion it is hard understate this last point mr williamson has based upon his produced screenplays as of this writing scream know what you did last summer from october and now scream enjoyed meteoric rise fame quickly become the most wellknown screenwriter amongst the entertainment weeklyreading box office figurewatching youth culture since well since that quentin tarantino guy whom it is said has also achieved some renown as director indeed in singularly freakish oddity it is the screenwriter mr williamson and not the director that has been receiving the lions share of acclaim for the success of scream and the print advertisements for scream theatrical release are similarly indicative of his increasing prominence while the traditional wes craven drapes the films title in the ads right below it in equal sized font yet reads written kevin williamson an affirmation of the screenwriters contribution the project may be unprecedented can envision the board of wga licking their chops at this coup and counting the days until their goal of is attained and much like mr tarantinos screenwriting mr williamsons work is vaguely unconventional incorporating both contemporary pop culture references and allusions other films into the dialogue of his characters in scream they satirically discussed other horror films here in the sequel the characters discuss the relative merits of sequels scream was written in during the infamous bob dole rampage against and mr williamsons rejection of this tirade clearly influenced the writing in both that and this sequel while the sequel was planned from the outset treatment of scream was included when mr williamson sold the screenplay for scream the basic premise for the and the reunion of the surviving characters nevertheless seems extremely artificially contrived and it is only at about the films midway point when it becomes engaging like its predecessor scream opens splashy eyegrabbing prologue only vaguely ties into the films principal narrative this time around we are following the exploits of young couple jada pinkett and omar epps attending riotously gleeful sneak preview screening of stab running filmwithinafilm gag where the true life events behind the first has been turned into movie however although it tries hard and has some good ideas the nightmarishly enthusiastic audience in the vaguely reminded me of the one was sharing the theatre and was certainly thinking about gutting the overlynoisy person few seats away myself after about fifteen minutes the prologue is pale imitation of the bravura opening sequence in the original drew barrymore where her performance not only convinced me that she could act but was so good that it would rank among the best performances in horror that have ever seen there are too many knowing hip popculture references crammed into the scream sequence and the setup is not nearly as cleverly frightening as screams while the first films preface dizzyingly built up final shot that was exhilaratingly terrifying the payoff here is almost campily theatrical flash the campus of smalltown ohio college where returning characters sidney neve campbell and randy jamie kennedy have relocated for their studies and escape the notoriety from the events in the first the murders open this result in reuniting the survivors singleminded tabloid tv reporter gale weathers courteney cox roars into town cover the breaking story while everawkward former deputy dewey riley david arquette flies in protectively guard over sidney they are joined cotton weary liev schreiber who was falsely accused of homicide in cameo appearance during the first his role here is significantly expanded the incidentally provides surprisingly little backstory although suppose good case can be made that it really is not necessary not because so many people have seen the first installment but because this is after all sequel slasher what do you think happened these characters in the prior movie there is lot of new faces on the scene too sidneys new boyfriend derek jerry oconnell and her new roommate hallie elise neal randys fellow student mickey timothy olyphant gales newlyassigned nervous cameraman joel duane martin omnipresent local journalist debbie salt laurie metcalf coed cici cooper ms buffy herself sarah michelle gellar and pair of simpering sorority sisters rebecca gayheart and sirens portia di rossi any of these characters could be the killer or for that matter could be the next victim as is seemingly becoming regular staple of kevin williamson screenplay the narrative is once again framed around the increasinglyflimsy premise of whodunit one problem that scream did not have was keeping you interested in the identity of the killer here and some extent in know what you did last summer mr williamsons screenplay seems slightly hampered trying turn the identity of the killer into mystery the occasionally becomes so bogged down misdirection that you can sense it straining at the seams try and drop red herrings left and right at the expense of its thriller elements it does not help matters any that the killers alterego is fairly obvious from the getgo indeed the finale plays as fullout camp when the villain is finally unmasked frothing at the mouth glazed eyes this is one of those cases where the villain goes on such an endless diatribe about their machinations scheming and motivation that you actually get bored listening and just want them all get on it while the basic setup and premise for the is fairly contrived the aspect where it is headandshoulders above its predecessor is in its suspense sequences they are staged much more imaginatively here save for the first postprologue murder is handled in such mediocre conventional fashion that it seems be culled directly from the predictable slasher flicks that the first satirized and are much more fun watch it is hard hold back smile during giddy scene where sidney and her companion have climb over the incapacitated killer in order escape from car wreck and catandmouse chase involving gale and dewey in campus sound lab is very nicely staged although its ultimate resolution is hilariously overblown in terms of its characters the strong part of the is the interesting relationship between gale and dewey who ambles onto the screen accompanied his very own theme music their verbal sparring at the outset provides much humour an exchange where dewey defensively rebukes charges of perceived aura of incompetency is wellwritten and there is curiously endearing aspect about their relationship amidst all the mayhem and bloodshed on the other hand sidney is pretty dull here she does not have any compelling presence and there is nothing particularly interesting about her this time around make us care about her other than that she is the returning heroine given this and the fact that there is no strong second banana character for sidney elise neals role is not nearly substantive enough adequately fill rose mcgowans shoes it is no wonder why the roles for gale and dewey have been significantly augmented for this installment of the what surprises me the most about scream is its zealousness in decimating its cast the films mounting body count bears out the fact that no character is safe well almost while in principal applaud this bold policy at some point you have got be wondering about just how many characters will make it the next sequel was particularly surprised the untimely demise of one in particular whose casting for the next installment of the series would have seemed obvious but hey as rose mcgowans character said in the first no please do not kill me mr ghostface want be in the sequel look what that got her

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned it is startling consider that it was only few years ago that distributors would worriedly rearrange their summer release schedules in order give the annual disney animated feature juggernaut wide berth the lion king had just cracked million domestic in gross become one of the most profitable ventures in history continuing build on sturdy base left prior flicks aladdin and beauty and the beast since then though disneys animated features have shown an unbroken string of diminishing returns pocahontas the hunchback of notre dame and this years hercules successively proving less and less potent the once seeminglyimpregnable disney stranglehold on the market share suddenly looking mighty vulnerable and faced their first serious competition in the animated market from foxs anastasia disney has brought xmas home early dusting off the feature sparked the modern revival of feature animation the little mermaid while the animation for the is as is typically the case for disney films unquestionably topnotch the magic in the little mermaid is not its animation but the wonderful innocence of its story and its rousingly superb music the films storyline is fairly straightforward young teen falls for handsome man father disapproves and assigns hapless chaperone his daughter teen disobeys father and goes desperate lengths win her man except in this case the chaperone is crab the teen is young mermaid and the object of her desire is human prince what makes the little mermaid so affecting and so emotionally resonant is the richness and charm of its characters and the sheer clarity and honest simplicity of their emotions from the moment mermaid ariel lays her eyes on prince eric she is resolutely smitten and she is such pure and endearing character that one cannot help but invest their heart her this simple but touching love story coupled healthy dose of smart humour makes the little mermaid remarkably captivating picture one of the interesting things about the little mermaid is something now curiously dates it the voices cast for its motley crew of characters this was produced just before the distracting concept of using celebrity voices became in vogue started certain degree beauty and the beast and was irrevocably exacerbated robin williams muchheralded turn in aladdin the release of the lion king and henceforth the majority of characters in the animated films were voiced celebrities while it is understandable that animated features lacking the namerecognition or drawing power of disney say baltos use of kevin bacon and bridget fonda or even anastasias showcasing of meg ryan and john cusack would be forced turn this strategy in order hype their products it is unfortunate that even disney has embraced this policy do we really need hear say demi moore as esmerelda in the hunchback of notre dame is the films entertainment value really augmented hearing recognizable voice rather than voice best suits the role am not exactly on the edge of my seat for eddie murphy in the upcoming mulan fortunately the performers who voice the characters in the little mermaid although perhaps more obscure are impeccably cast chief among them is jodi benson tony nominee for her stage work in crazy for you who voices the films heroine ariel perfection wonderfully expressive speaking voice full of youthful vigor and gorgeous singing voice ms benson provides most engaging anchor for the she is the only reason would even consider catching flubber similarly samuel wright is terrific in the showy role of sebastian the weary guardian crab he easily milks his lovable characters comic moments for all they are worth and his rendering of two of the little mermaids big tunes under the sea and kiss the girl have become the stuff of legend pat carrol is deliciously villainous and vampy as the evil seawitch ursula while kenneth mars booming voice conveys the stern yet affectionate authority of ariels father king triton in large roles and small edie mcclurg as dotting busybody carlotta is ideal and rene auberjonois has great fun his exuberant french chef the little mermaid is impeccably cast of course the little mermaid will probably be best remembered for its remarkable collection of songs composed the songwriting team of alan menken music and howard ashman lyrics who had created little shop of horrors and would go on compose beauty and the beast and aladdin for disney before mr ashmans untimely death not only are mr menkens tunes unbearably catchy but mr ashmans charming lyrics are fully integrated into the films storyline so that the songs are virtual extension of the characters dialogue and consequently work wonderfully within the context of the mr menkens score for the is equally topnotch the sequence where eric voiced christopher daniel barnes and ariel tour his kingdom in horsedrawn carriage becomes magical and wondrous mr menkens fine score it appears that most people prefer the delightfully colourful production number for the calypsostyled under the sea as joyfully crooned mr wright won the academy award and golden globe awards for best song indeed one of the many little joys in screening the during its rerelease was listening children scattered throughout the audience singing along the tune but my favourite is ms bensons heartfelt rendition of the ballad part of your world an achingly beautiful tune of yearning and hope wonderfully lyricized mr ashman accompanied the films most dazzlingly polished animation sequence packs an emotional wallop literally brought tears my eyes during the songs reprise builds crescendo ariel arching on rock as wave crashes in the cumulative effect is nothing short of breathtaking and one becomes acutely aware that this single instance is one of the finest in animation history as of this writing november has come an end as has disneys limited day rerelease of the little mermaid there is no question that the primary motivation for if not the films reissue itself at least its timing was reinforce disneys dominance in the animation market and provide direct competition foxs costly new upstart animation division and their first major venture anastasia in every respect the rerelease of the little mermaid appears be success the films grosses have pushed its cumulative domestic gross over the magic million mark the little mermaid proved have remarkably strong drawing power for initially released only eight years ago and in many homes on video pulling in close million in its opening weekend and although nobody could possibly expect the little mermaid possibly defeat the aggressivelymarketed anastasia in headtohead competition it siphoned enough from the fox films opening weekend totals keep anastasia from the coveted weekend leader spot allowing for disneys odious flubber sweep in on the subsequent week and wrestle the family demographic market share away but although disneys motives in the reissue of the little mermaid were selfserving and protectionist the real winner is the public any reason put this back into theatres is good one and it is true joy see this heartwarming gem back on the silver screen the little mermaid is the best come out of the disneys modern animation renaissance and one of the greatest animated films ever made

this christmas little ralphie parker peter billingsley wants nothing more than red ryder bb gun under the tree although cautioned many that he will shoot his eye out ralphie remains optimistic conjuring up detailed scheme get on the good side of his parents and teachers it could be possible that no one has ever wanted anything more passion than ralphie wants this bb gun and the story of his eternal struggle is charming one a christmas story is favorite among many during the holiday season and boy it is certainly easy see why ralphies endless desire for the bb gun may transport you back your childhood when you were craving certain gift for christmas and the anxiety was almost indescribable evoking pleasant childhood memories is only one of the many things a christmas story does so well here are few features that make this such charming little package for everybody during the holiday season period detail this is based on the memoirs of late humorist jean shepard who shares his experiences as young boy living in the loving detail shepard narrates from first person pointofview divulging his various adventures one snowy december in visions of taking aim his new bb gun replaced that of sugarplums dancing in his head shepards firsthand commentary of several situations is not only downright hilarious but also witty and warm various metaphorical meanings that ring perfectly the essence of comic timing on top of that young billingsleys stupefied reactions each predicament is absolutely perfect in contrast the narration director bob clark captures the look and feel of the era wonderful technicality can hardly imagine more accurate depiction of what christmas for young ralphie must have been like mom and dad both melinda dillon as mom and darren mcgavin as the old man are perfect in their roles it is hard fathom more agreeable pair for the requirements of story like this one each possessing at least one memorable trait that instantly separates them from the wooden caricatures that could have been featured for instance he is bloodthirsty turkey hound and she is forgiving and understanding when it comes some serious issues in portraying the writer as persistent but mildmannered young lad peter billingsley has struck quite the chord his performance is richly textured making all of the humorous situations he stumbles into radiate flavor and enjoyment brings us the comic situations there are plenty of memorable moments in a christmas story moments that undoubtedly will improve in comic potency upon each new viewing so much more explore and cherish am particularly partial of the fword scene in ralphie blurts out the shocking fourletter obscenity while helping the old man in the yard again shepards method of handling this amusing scenario is nothing short of comic wizardry the numerous sequences that stick in ones mind include of course the famous department store santa scene in billingsley has some problems in telling old saint nick what he wants under the tree could go on but will finish on this note a christmas story is standout among holiday movies because it captures so much in meager minutes not only is it funny it is often genuinely hilarious not mention warm fluffy and touching in all the appropriate places plan on making a christmas story christmas tradition why do not you

in intolerance w griffith told four different historical stories at the same time cutting from one the other each of the stories builds fastpaced climax in magnolia paul thomas anderson tells several stories each just tangentially connected the others yet the stories and where they are going are all independent what is strange about these stories is that they are all synchronized each story builds tense moment or what appears be intended be tense moment but then lets the tension dissolve while the tension dissipates one character starts singing song and in each plotline the major characters sing along even though they are not in the same scene then toward the end the stories each build tense moment again it is almost as if the characters are somehow psychically linked this creates some strange effects the stories are about empty desperate people dysfunctional relationships the strands have varying degrees of bizarre content we have the story of dying man earl partridge jason robards wanting get in touch his son and make amends phil parma philip seymour hoffman is his nurse who is frantic help partridge achieve his final goal partridges young wife linda julianne moore is getting more and more anxious as partridge dies but for an unsuspected reason frank mackey tom cruise runs the kinds of selfhelp seminar that businesses like so much but he aims his at teaching disaffected men how be real shitheels in dealing women in an angry backlash womens lib officer jim kurring john reilly is patrolman who has need feel he is making the world better place jimmy gator philip baker hall hosts popular childrens tv quiz show that really exploits and destroys children as we see from the stories of current quiz kid stanley spector jeremy blackman and former quiz kid donnie smith william macy the juggles all these stories for over three hours but even after all this time not one story is resolved satisfactorily each story moves toward single bizarre common climax but it is not one that seems do much but derail each story the common climax itself is ambiguous in many ways and it fails really tie up any of the stories the seems be built around strange events and weird history but it really has little do the content of the stories though they all are connected in part one weird event magnolia will probably bring some much deserved attention paul thomas anderson though in my opinion his two previous films hard eight and boogie nights were better told stories it is interesting that one starts look forward actors from andersons company john reilly seems be standard fixture particularly notable is philip baker hall who gave mesmerizing performance from the first scene of hard eight here he several of the characters are mesmerizing but that characteristic is not really used as studies of characters these stories are each worth following as wellrounded stories beginning middle and end they leave something be desired but the is willing do the unexpected and that helps make the worth sitting through rate it on the scale and low on the scale heavy spoiler heavy spoiler heavy spoiler heavy spoiler during the strange climactic event of the we get multiple messages from the filmmaker that the event we are seeing really does happen and in actual fact it does since biblical times rains of frogs have been interpreted as signs of displeasure of the gods it is however perfectly natural if somewhat unnerving phenomenon the cause is associated whirlwinds we know that tornadoes over land can rip up land and even objects of some size from the ground and hurl them into the air holding them aloft the reader may remember the unfortunate cow in twister smaller objects can be hurled high into the atmosphere and then be kept aloft the updrafts for surprisingly long periods of time much as hail and chunks of ice are when the whirlwind is over water animals near the surface frequently fish and frogs may suffer the same fate essentially they are vacuumed up the whirlwind held aloft updrafts and finally dropped elsewhere so while the rain is possible some doubts do creep in the rain of frogs depicted in this may be of greater scale than had pictured for rain of frogs it seems unlikely the frogs would still be alive when dropped it is not clear that geographic conditions are right for los angeles have this sort of phenomenon frankly have no idea on these points otherwise the event was quite believable what we see in this is much more credible than the phenomena we saw in volcano in the it is left ambiguous if the rain is sign from god since there are many references exodus and the frogs shall come up both on thee and upon thy people and upon all thy servants however rain of frogs though it feels biblical is most definitely not biblical portent note that the previous verse says and the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly shall go up so the bible is referring not rain but an infestation from the river the only other reference frogs in the bible is as symbol for uncleanness in revelation

contact is the movie have seen the most five times be exact four of those times were on the big screen but even on tv it is very impressive the same cannot be said for films like independance day but that is because contact is rare example in scifi filmmaking where the story is treated more importantly than the special effects and all of us know looking back that id did not offer much outside of some onetime delightful eye candy contacts wonderfully presented story deals ellie arroway jodie foster radio astronomer whose preference of study involves the outdated technique of merely listening sounds out in space her interest in the field of astronomy developed at very young age encouraged her loving father ted david morse who let ellie use small ham radio pick up on frequencies and communicate people as far away as pensacola fl that was of course before the days of internet chat rooms while everyone else uses modern technologies aid them in the search for extraterrestrial intelligence of the program seti is an acronym for ellie prefers pop on pair of headphones and see what she can pick up on keeping the youthful magic and intrigue strongly alive ellies strong scientific basis essentially makes her an atheist belief likely influenced the death of her father while she was still quite young in puerto rico she meets palmer joss matthew mcconaughey writer examining the effects of technology on the worlds overall happiness one time seminary student who describes himself as man of the cloth without the cloth despite the vast differences in opinion regarding supreme being ellie and palmer hit it off and even take the time sleep together it is weak and hurried relationship but director zemeckis needs it add the plot later on meanwhile dr david drumlin tom skerritt who has authority over seti but finds the program frivolous waste of time and money is ready pull the plug on any and all seti funding this leaves the passionate ellie searching for new sponsors eventually finding setup in new mexico and leaving palmer no explanation and only one night stand remember it is in this nm city where several months later ellie finally picks up on strong signal from outer space perhaps the most profound discovery in the history of science when the signal is closely examined many new developments spring up and before long drumlin is stepping in take over the operation he once scoffed at eventually it is concluded that information in the signal may be blueprints for transportation device used teleport an earthling vega where the signal seems have originated the media swarms fanatics go further off the deep end scientists clamor for new information politicians huddle in discussion of appropriate actions take and presidents are morphed into celluloid reality remember when zemeckis could not get enough of this in forrest gump as if that were not enough ellies discovery leads her the nations capital where she again runs into palmer contact is based on the novel carl sagan and deals heavily the subject of science vs religion the impressive thing is how well both aspects are presented no signs of bias arguments for both sides are intelligent solid and thoughtprovoking when palmer joins selection committee choose an ambassador vega of ellie is leading candidate personal convictions play more important role than love interests the question is can person who does not believe in god truly be the best representative of earth when of the planet does believe in higher power even when the wraps up it is uncertain whether it is meant play as an advocate for religion science both or even neither and in our modern day society where right and wrong is only opinion at least speaking politically correctly the ambiguity is an incentive do not get me wrong as much as it sounds like it contact is not merely theology class rolled into reel of it is highly enjoyable two and half hours despite its seemingly heavy issues it is not tedious undertaking watch this the special effects are outstanding though warning highly depreciated on the small screen even so some of the subtle visual effects that will likely go unnoticed many are even more impressive than ones more recognizable as scifi the storytelling is rich and complete and although there are moments in the that feel quite pretentious and at times even hokey it is easily one of the best films and one of the best scifi films have ever seen this is zemeckis best since back the future and for those of us who actually know that forrest gump was astronomically overrated zemeckis now has real reason boast

roberto benigni is clown in the tradition of chaplin and keaton this italian star best known in the united states for the poorly received son of the pink panther has done the near impossible creating comic fable about the holocaust but benignis life is beautiful la vita bella is not so much story of the holocaust as it uses that monstrous outrage against humanity as backdrop tell story of familial love devotion and sacrifice the movie starts out as typical slapstick farce benignis guido arriving in the small tuscan town of arezzo in fulfill his dream of owning bookstore like many of the slapstick clowns who preceded him most notably the almostforgotten harry langdon benignis guido has childlike innocence he ignores the growing antisemitism of the fascist government instead guido ardently falls in love and persues dora local school teacher who already is engaged local fascist official in benignis tightly wound script this is the same fascist official whom guido had an earlier unfortunate yet slapstick encounter guido wins dora they marry fast forward about five years guido dora and their yearold son giosue giorgio cantarini are happy family guido has finally fulfilled his dream of opening bookstore but racial and antisemitic tensions are on the rise in italy and guido has determined do his best shield his son from these harsh realities the task becomes even the more difficult when the family is deported concentration camp here guido must use all his skill and imagination not only shield his son but keep him from being exterminated it is at this juncture in life is beautiful may tend offend those whom the holocaust has touched for the scenes in the concentration camp lack the horror the pain the unimaginable suffering of schindlers list true many italian jews were not deported until the war was nearly over and most were not sent the death camps but work camps where they were used as slave labor unlike steven spielberg benigni is not out tell the story of the holocaust his story is about family and the lengths parent will go protect child for guido save his son transforms the entire experience into an elaborate game giosue must follow the rules without
