there are no secret backdoors into military computers thank you whoever it was for giving us graphical user interface when we use our computers

there exists litany of differences between successful action movie and successful suspense movie action movies are typically devoid of plot other than simple byline can string together several explosive sequences while suspense movies hinge on plot and subtlety and the ability bring everything fullcircle for fans of both genres however realism is key action fans want know that the weapons and methods their heroes are using are authentic and suspense fans want everything fall into an explainable framework the movies end on this advice director john frankenheimer the island of dr moreau strives for realism in an interestingly dynamic balance of suspense and action for his latest thriller ronin the depth of intrigue in ronin is quite amazing considering the fare that is fallen into the same category over the last few years the script written d zeik in his bigscreen debut approaches levels of complexity that had people spinning away from mission impossible two years ago certain number of people will be lost this but afficianados will appreciate it all the more and return multiple times frankenheimer masters the script poise and tells us dark but stoically realistic tale of group of postcold war mercenaries working earn their paycheck his ability convey feeling and character while promoting explosiveness and tense atmosphere works well here and ronin becomes better movie because of it robert de niro headlines this cast of noteworthies in performance that is the most outstanding of his in quite some time he takes command and offers much gravity as the exspy sam man who is called france help shady operations controller named dierdre natascha mcelhone recover package the package becomes the central motivator for the entire cast especially once the requisite doublecrossing begins and its role is skillfully penned zeik at times however zeiks tale becomes almost too reminiscent of mission impossible de niro might easily become tom cruise the package might become cruises computer disk fortunately the focus here is almost entirely on the package whereas in mission the script was more concerned the doublecross and why it happened the action content is impressive and it lives up the hints given in previews the only fans who will be disappointed are those who expect fullblown combat scenes and instead are forced suffer through moments of slowness ronin does take degree of intelligence follow all of the nuance from start finish but even the uninitiated will be able keep grasp on most characters mand subplots the suspense tapers off considerably the end bit of drawback because of its height at the movies open considering these factors it is good see that ronin was project that turned out well and it is another good bet this month since quality is usually sparse during the early fall months it is definitely worth the visit

jay and silent bob strike back kevin smiths swan song his two most famous characters is the best received comedy that have seen since there is something about mary is tea party in comparison the foulmouthed humor in jay and silent bob strike back the audience did not just laugh they went wild boisterous laughter and heavy applause throughout in short if you like really raunchy humor you may find it as did be the funniest movie of the year on the other hand if you are one of those who walked out in disgust smiths dogma then jay and silent bob strike back is not the movie for you in one of the fastest paced movies of the year the story has jay and silent bob jason mewes and kevin smith pair of card carrying drug dealers traveling from their new jersey convenience store home so that they can stop movie it seems their comic book alter egos bluntman and chronic are being used in movie without jay and silent bobs consent jason biggs and james van der beek are slated star in it jay and silent bob strike back has more and better used cameos than just about any movie that have ever seen among others they include carrie fisher as bibletoting nun mark hamill as comic book version of his famous alter ego and gus van sant as director too busy counting his money yell action best of all are ben affleck and matt damon who mock themselves and their movies the stops several times make fun of itself and of the audience who was stupid enough buy tickets this movie actually purchasing tickets this is extremely smart given that it delivers more laughter per dollar than anything in recent memory the even skewers people who write about movies on the internet guilty although it is filled inside jokes you will still be laughing even if you only get some of them it is easy understand enough so that they are still funny jay is motor mouth who has not met subject that he could not vulgarize his favorite topic is oral sex but being an equal opportunity profaner he is willing make crude jokes about absolutely anything but it is his buddy the aptly named silent bob who is responsible for most of the movies success his reaction shots his wildly exaggerated eye movements are comedic gems the storys main subplot concerns four animal rights activists justice shannon elizabeth and her three sexy buddies sissy eliza dushku missy jennifer schwalbach smith and chrissy ali larter these charlies angels types give ride our heroes on their trek lalaland stop the picture jay tries put the moves on justice but he does not stay in command of the situation for long one of the funnier sight gags has the women using pink clamshaped birth control case that contains high tech gadgetry granted it is not the movie for everyone but if you like kevin smiths brand of humor you will find that this is his best and as said earlier it is the funniest movie of the year thus far no wait forget thus far it is bound be the funniest movie of the year in time when almost every movie feels obligated come in at pg so that they can rake in the maximum cash it is great see filmmaker the guts target only mature audience jay and silent bob strike back runs lightening fast it is rated and contains pervasive crude humor and language and sexual situations it would be acceptable for high school seniors and older the opens nationwide in the united states on wednesday august in the silicon valley it will be showing at the amc and the century theaters

damn those trailers had it not been for the advertising of this reveals far too much about its contents would have been glued under the sand as it is the retains some value thanks an excellent performance charlotte rampling and more mature francois ozon in the directors chair marie charlotte rampling and her husband jean bruno cremer lounge on the beach she takes nap while he goes for swim when marie wakes up jean is nowhere be found she contacts authorities but they cannot find him either did he disappear start new life was he killed accident did he commit suicide marie still asks herself these questions year later and in order move on her life she must find some answers it is fine premise and this little movie uses it the limit the moves at leisurely pace bit slow but relaxing it is very visual story and you can pretty much just sit back without reading the subtitles this is mostly thanks the excellent camera work antoine heberle and jeanne lapoirie who shot the in dreamy haze and the lead performance rampling rampling is so expressive in her portrayal of marie you connect her character instantly despite that she is delusional the scenes where she interacts her husband who she still believes is alive are heartbreaking she cannot quite get over him they have been married for twentyfive years the other actors particularly jacques nolot are excellent too the sex in the is rather unneeded but compared ozons criminal lovers it is the disney channel likely cause some discussion afterwards under the sand is fine movie going experience while it is hard recommend as entertainment it is fine adult alternative about how we deal loss ozon seems ask what you would do and that is certainly hard question answer

bob the happy bastards quickie review rush hour so what is the problem hours clones these days they always try for the same thing that eddie murphy and nick nolte had that was the problem that plagued these clones not mention the actual sequel another hours complete waste of but at last someone has different take on the matter and it is director brett rainer rush hour features jackie chan in his first s action movie playing chinese detective who is being flown the us investigate the kidnapping of the chinese consulates daughter of course the fbi is upset that he will be interfering in their investigation and stick him an lapd office big mouth of course that is chris tucker what makes rush hour work so damn well is the chemistry between the energetic chan and the absolutely hilarious tucker tucker mouths off chan at every given opportunity am michael jackson you tito and chan delivers few zingers of his own as well as some terrific fight scenes the storys pretty much your average fare but decent twist involving the main villain highly clouded figure named jun tao at least it is entertaining and the concept is excellently realized particular fight scene in chinese office where chan and tucker duke it out the bad guys is funny and energetic at the same time and the finales real treat as well chan delivers yet another fantastic stunt for the fans story drop rush hour is just the sort of you will get kick out of on any night of the week just make sure you do not look for anything culturally different and you will be fine drunken master ii this as not

this sunday afternoon had the priviledge of attending private screening at the sony astor cinema in new york city of james camerons most heralded titanic postponed from last summer an escalated budget that makes it the most expensive movie in history this was one was eager preview so is this movie going sink or swim this holiday my best guess it will sink though many awards attatched its hull no doubt titanic is the most elaborate disaster movie ever made it boasts the most amazing effects that have ever seen done date see ship fall apart actual people running across the ship flying across the deck and falling the water is just amazing look at the effects are so stunningly realistic you would swear you were looking at actual footage but titanic is more than disaster movie and that is where the problem lies there is love story attatched that nearly ruins the entire premise will give capsule summary of the story without spoiling anything for you the begins modern day excavation of sorts of the sunken titanic we see actual footage of the sunken ship as cammeron had set up special cameras the wreckage on the ocean floor bill paxton leads the expedition in search of sunken treasure what he finds instead leads him mysterious old woman who recounts her tale of the titanic voyage we meet rose kate winslet young woman who comes from an upperclass family rose is be wed man she does not love we meet jack leonardo dicaprio young man who comes from poor financial background and wins ticket aboard the titanic in poker game the two meet under interesting circumstances and the love story begins add in jealous fiance and notsonice law officer played david warner and you have story that well gets bit overplayed and oversappy must add at this point that the most likeable character in the movie is played kathy bates as woman new money who is lot less uptight than the other rich folk on the ship she is pleasure see on screen when the ship does hit the iceberg at exactly into the and eventually sinks you never really feel for any of these characters the is just loaded unlikeable rich snobs and other folk you never really get grasp on the effects are tremendous from the roars of gears and pumps in the engine room doomed ship cracking at the seams this is an effects picture that looks and sounds like no other we saw titanic in dolby digital surround and far it is the best sounding movie have ever seen my friend commented it was the best sound mix he has ever heard when people are in the water at films end you are surrounded the voices of lost soles titanic runs far too long the movie is hours and minutes in length and while most of the first hours runs very fast and wellpaced the final minutes almost comes sudden stop and you realize that this sappy love story has finish itself out before the movie finally ends do not get me wrong about titanic it is not bad as am making it out be it really is an exceptionaly wellmade the costumes and sets are incredible and true the time period the ship is painstakingly created exactly true form as we see actual pictures of the modernday wreckage transformed into the movie depiction this will certainly win on effects costume set design and sound cameron has certainly made his best date unfortunately titanic is not best picture candidate it just does not have strong supporting story it is an exceptional disaster sappy filler inside it just does not have the emotional impact that suspect mr cameron was shooting for predict that titanic will open likeable reviews it is worth seeing predict that it will only do moderately well at the box office its extreme running time and lack of enough robust get substantial wordofmouth expect that it will do even better on home video this will certainly be the definitive ac movie for all you home theater enthusiasts titanic opens december th and is released paramount pictures and twentieth centuryfox give titanic stars that is not bad ron epstein riginally
